Aviana Winterwing.name: Powerful Build
Aviana Winterwing.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Unarmored Defense (Barbarian)
Aviana Winterwing.description: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Danger Sense
Aviana Winterwing.description: At 2nd level, you gain an uncanny sense of when things nearby aren't as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge away from danger. You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps and spells. To gain this benefit, you can't be &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], or &Reference[incapacitated].

Aviana Winterwing.name: Extra Attack
Aviana Winterwing.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Fast Movement
Aviana Winterwing.description: Starting at 5th level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing heavy armor.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Feral Instinct
Aviana Winterwing.description:
By 7th level, your instincts are so honed that you have advantage on initiative rolls.

Additionally, if you are &Reference[rule=Surprise]{surprised} at the beginning of combat and aren't &Reference[condition=incapacitated], you can act normally on your first turn, but only if you enter your rage before doing anything else on that turn.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Eagle's Dash
Aviana Winterwing.description: While you're raging and aren't wearing heavy armor, other creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attack rolls against you, and you can use the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Spirit Seeker
Aviana Winterwing.description: Yours is a path that seeks attunement with the natural world, giving you a kinship with beasts. At 3rd level when you adopt this path, you gain the ability to cast the Beast Sense and Speak with Animals spells, but only as rituals, as described in chapter 10.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Speak with Animals (Spirit Warrior)
Aviana Winterwing.description: You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many beasts is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. You might be able to persuade a beast to perform a small favor for you, at the DM's discretion.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Beast Sense (Spirit Warrior)
Aviana Winterwing.description: You touch a willing beast. For the duration of the spell, you can use your action to see through the beast's eyes and hear what it hears, and continue to do so until you use your action to return to your normal senses. While perceiving through the beast's senses, you gain the benefits of any special senses possessed by that creature, though you are &Reference[condition=blinded] and &Reference[condition=deafened] to your own surroundings.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Lethal Limbs
Aviana Winterwing.description:
When you attack while you are unarmed, you can roll a d4 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike. This die changes as you gain levels.

Your unarmed damage type is non-magical bludgeoning, slashing or piercing damage, depending on the features of your limbs and the way you attack.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Athletic
Aviana Winterwing.description:
- When jumping, you jump an extra 5ft.

- Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20. (STR)

- You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice. (Persuasion)

- Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus. (Athletics)

Aviana Winterwing.name: Tattoo of the Mountain
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Whenever you deal damage to a grappled creature, you are bound together until the start of your next turn and any movement of one will also affect the other.

As long as you're bound together, you cannot choose to release the grapple.

While grappling a creature, it cannot cast spells with somatic components.

Due to the magical nature of this curse, dealing damage to a grappled creature can cause wild magic surges to occur.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Eyes of an Eagle
Aviana Winterwing.description:
You gain the eyesight of an eagle.

You can see up to 2 miles away with no difficulty, able to discern even fine details as though looking at something no more than 100 feet away from you.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Stable Frenzy
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Your melee attacks that deal non-magical slashing, piercing, or crushing damage are enhanced:

  • Slashing: You reduce the target's physical saving throws by 1 until the end of it's next turn.

  • Piercing: You repeatedly reroll each damage dice that lands on a 1.

  • Crushing: You reduce the target's mental saving throws by 1 until the end of it's next turn.

Additionally, while raging you gain the Stable Footing condition.

Stable Footing

You can't be knocked prone or moved along the ground against your will by non-magical means.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Common Clothes
Aviana Winterwing.description: Clothes worn by most commoners.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Rod of Unwilling Retribution
Aviana Winterwing.description: Up to three times per day when another entity you can see within 60 feet damages you, the Rod activates and zaps the creature nearest to you who must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 10 + your character level), taking 2d10 lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Final Breath
Aviana Winterwing.description:
While raging, as long as you're grappling a creature, all attack rolls against you have advantage.

Additionally while raging, if a creature of the same size or smaller has been grappled by you for 2 continuous turns you can, as a free action at the start of your turn, rip them apart dealing damage equal to 10 unarmed attacks.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Dagger
Aviana Winterwing.description: A short metal blade mounted to a small hilt and crossguard. The dagger makes an effective side armament for hardened warriors or a hidden blade for assassins and thieves.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Potion of Legendary Resistance
Aviana Winterwing.description:
The way the potion shimmers is not unlike looking through a kaleidoscope.

When you drink this potion, you gain one Legendary Resistance for 8 hours. Spending it allows you to nullify the effect a single attack, spell, or ability would have on you.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Mending (Spellwrought Tattoo)
Aviana Winterwing.description:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such an object.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Adamantine Manacles
Aviana Winterwing.description: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 30 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 30 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick the manacles' lock with a successful DC 25 Dexterity check. Manacles have 50 hit points.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Flexing
Aviana Winterwing.description: Aviana flexes.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Cursed Thunderfeet Footwraps
Aviana Winterwing.description:
When you jump, you cause a shockwave upon landing dealing 1d20 thunder damage to anyone, including yourself, in a 5ft radius.

If your size is larger than medium, add 1d20 thunder damage for each size category above medium.

Curse

Equipping this item curses you to become unwilling to part with it. Only when you become targeted by the Remove Curse spell or similar magic can you choose to unequip it. This item does not require attunement.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Spirit of the Tiger
Aviana Winterwing.description:
When you activate this blessing you gain the following benefits:

Ambush Predator

Level 6 Feature

You gain advantage on Stealth checks.

Scent of Blood

Level 6 Feature

If you are hiding when you take the jump action, you can activate Rage as a free action while you're mid-air.

Pouncing Strikes

Level 6 Feature

You make a single attack with your natural weapons against up to 4 different creatures within range. This ability can only be used right after landing from a jump.

Solitary Hunter

Level 10 Feature

When both you and your target are isolated and you deal damage to it, double all of your damage dice. A creature is isolated if no ally is within it's line of sight.

Rip and Tear

Level 14 Feature

Whenever you roll maximum damage on any damage die, roll that die again and add the result to the total. Repeat this as many times as needed. (All damage dice explode recursively.)

Aviana Winterwing.name: Inspiring Flex
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Aviana flexes. It is very effective.

As an action you flex your muscles while looking directly into the eyes of one creature that can see you.
That creature gains one Inspiration die, a d6.

Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, damage roll, or saving throw it makes. The creature cannot choose to use the Inspiration die after the roll has been made.
Once the Inspiration die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can only have 1 Flexing Inspiration die at any time.

You can use this ability a number of times equal to the sum of your Strength and Constitution modifiers.
You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Spirit of the Wolf
Aviana Winterwing.description:
When you activate this blessing you gain the following benefits:

Keen Senses

Level 6 Feature

You have blindsight out to 15ft.

Pack Tactics

Level 6 Feature

All attacks rolls made against hostile creatures within 5ft of you have advantage.

Hamstringing

Level 10 Feature

Critical hits against hostile creatures within 5ft of you deal an additional xd12 damage where x is half your proficiency bonus rounded up.

Coordinated Hunt

Level 14 Feature

When a creature that is threatened by both you and at least one of your allies makes an attack, you can use your reaction to let each of your allies make one weapon or spell attack against the threatened creature.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Strionic Resonator
Aviana Winterwing.description: During combat, as long as it's not your turn, triggered abilities from features and non-consumable items are copied. If the triggered ability consumes resources, the copy does not.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Spelleater's Charm
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Whenever you're hit by a spell attack while raging, you can spend a rage to shield yourself, nullifying the damage you'd take from that hit.

If you don't shield yourself, the charm causes the spell to also deal it's damage not only to you but also to every creature within 5ft of you.

Any non-damaging effects the spell attack causes are not influenced by this item.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Royal Commander's Cloak
Aviana Winterwing.description:
During your turn you can expend one rage to remove a single effect from yourself or one ally within 5ft as a free action.

Additionally, you can make it billow dramatically.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Grateful Fey's Charm
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Wearing this charm grants you resistance to one type of damage while and making you vulnerable to another. Using your reaction, you can change one or both.

Additionally, taking damage of a type you're vulnerable to from a hostile creature during combat lets you make one additional attack when you use the attack action on your following turn. This effect stacks.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Broken Sentinel Statue
Aviana Winterwing.description:
This statue is broken into 10 pieces which can be restored with mending cantrips. Each casting of the spell repairs one break in the statue. If the statue is made whole, a single core crystal can be placed inside it's chest which transforms the statue into a construct .

The Ironfeather Sentinel obeys any commands given by the character who repaired the statue to the best of it's abilities.

When it's hit points are reduced to zero, the construct breaks apart into 10 pieces of a statue again which can once again be repaired. A new core crystal is only required if the the one inside it's chest was removed.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Guardian Scale of Evocation
Aviana Winterwing.description:
A creature can only have one Guardian Scale equipped at any given time.

While you have this scale equipped, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.qlNQcTgL0TgpHOvd]{Fire Shield} (1/day) and @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.F8bkRDsQf9ccHQwh]{Sacred Flame}.

The ancient magic of this scale alters these spells. They require no concentration or components, can be cast while raging and have a flat spell save DC of [[12 + @prof]] and a flat spell attack bonus of [[4+@prof]].

Additionally, the cantrip this item grants has a casting time of 1 bonus action.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Guardian Scale of Abjuration
Aviana Winterwing.description:
A creature can only have one Guardian Scale equipped at any given time.

While you have this scale equipped, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.VYHyzt6WXpvtojku]{Death Ward} (1/day) and @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.8wVUR6t3Xc45PJH3]{Resistance}.

The ancient magic of this scale alters these spells. They require no concentration or components, can be cast while raging and have a flat spell save DC of [[12 + @prof]] and a flat spell attack bonus of [[4+@prof]].

Additionally, the cantrip this item grants has a casting time of 1 bonus action.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Mythic Power
Aviana Winterwing.description:
One doesn't need to be a mythic creature, an otherworldly being, or a deity's chosen to become a hero. This path may be grueling and full of temptation, but the mortal who treads it fully earns the right to call themselves a true Legend.

Mythic characters can draw upon a wellspring of power to accomplish amazing deeds and cheat fate. This power is used by a number of different abilities.

Each week, you can expend an amount of mythic power equal to 2 + twice your mythic rank.

This amount is your maximum amount of mythic power. If an ability allows you to regain uses of your mythic power, you can never have more than this amount.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Titanous Strength
Aviana Winterwing.description: Your Strength and Constitution scores, as well as your maximum for those scores, increase by 2 for each Mythic Rank you have.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Grapple
Aviana Winterwing.description:
When you want to grab a creature or wrestle with it, you can use the Attack action to make a special melee attack, a grapple. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them. The target of your grapple must be no more than one size larger than you, and it must be within your reach.

Using at least one free hand, you try to seize the target by making a grapple check, a [[/skill ath format=long]] contested by the target's [[/skill ath format=long]] or [[/skill acr format=long]] (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, you subject the target to the &Reference[grappled] effect. The condition specifies the things that end it, and you can release the target whenever you like (no action required).

Aviana Winterwing.name: Vice Grip
Aviana Winterwing.description:
When you successfully grapple a creature, you damage it for an amount equivalent to one unarmed strike.

As long as the creature is grappled by you, you can replace any of your attacks each turn to deal said damage again.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Reckless Attack
Aviana Winterwing.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can throw aside all concern for defence to attack with fierce desperation. When you make an attack, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls, but attack rolls against you have advantage. These effects last until the start your next turn.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Rage
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Eagle's Rage

While you're raging and aren't wearing heavy armour, other creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attack rolls against you, and you can use the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn. The spirit of the eagle makes you into a predator who can weave through the fray with ease.

Rage

In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action.

While raging, you gain the following benefits if you aren't wearing heavy armour:

  • You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
  • When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll. This bonus increases as you level.
  • You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

If you are able to cast spells, you can't cast them or concentrate on them while raging.

Your rage lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked Unconscious. You can also end your rage on your turn as a bonus action.

Once you have raged the maximum number of times for your barbarian level, you must finish a long rest before you can rage again. You may rage 2 times at 1st level, 3 at 3rd, 4 at 6th, 5 at 12th, and 6 at 17th.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Light Hammer of Crackling Joy
Aviana Winterwing.description:
This magical hammer crackles with electric energy, infused from having been used as a toy by playful elementals. When thrown, the sound of their laughter can still be heard.

When used in melee combat, this magical light hammer is nothing more than a dull stick. It's magical properties activate only when it's thrown.

You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. On a hit, the hammer deals an extra 2d10 lightning damage.

Once thrown, the weapon is recalled to your hand as part of the attack after hitting or missing it's target. However upon summoning it back, the hammer deals 1d10 lightning damage to you.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Jump
Aviana Winterwing.description: Using your bonus action, you can jump up to [[/r @talia.jumpDistance]] ft.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Core Crystal
Aviana Winterwing.description: Encased in the core of every permanent construct, this crystal pulses with a rhythmic, crimson luminescence. Its jagged edges and vibrant glow give it an almost organic appearance, as if it were a living heart beating within a metallic shell.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Relentless Rage
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Starting at 11th level, your rage can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds.

If you drop to 0 hit points while you're raging and don't die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a short or long rest, the DC resets to 10.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Glasses of Scarlet Sight
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Tainted by the blood of countless battles, these glasses now show the world through a crimson hue, forever marked by their previous owner's fury.

For every 20% of your maximum hit points that you are missing, your melee weapon attacks deal additional damage equal to your Constitution modifier.

Additionally, when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you roll one additional weapon damage die for every 20% of your maximum hit points that you are missing.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Murgaxor's Elixir of Life
Aviana Winterwing.description: Whoever drinks this concoction gains advantage on death saving throws for 24 hours.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Dried Meat
Aviana Winterwing.description: The process of drying meat is long and extensive. In some particular cases, for the highest quality of dried meat, it can take over a year. It is highly sought after due to its extended shelf life, and depending on the meat used, it is, quite frankly, delicious.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Wool
Aviana Winterwing.description: A textile fabric that is obtained from farm animals, mainly sheep, and is primarily used for clothing. In addition to that, it is also used for blankets, saddle cloths for cavalry, carpeting, and on rare occasions even a soil fertilizer.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Sewing Needle
Aviana Winterwing.description: A sewing needle, utilized for hand-sewing and crafted from steel or bone, is a long slender tool with a pointed tip at one end and a hole, or eye, designed to hold the sewing thread.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Activated: Feather Fall - 1st
Aviana Winterwing.description:
1st Level

Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If the creature lands before the spell ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, and the spell ends for that creature.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Jungle Rope (50 feet)
Aviana Winterwing.description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Jungle Vine (50ft)
Aviana Winterwing.description: Rope, made from hanging vines, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Barbaric Critical
Aviana Winterwing.description:
If you or a creature within 5ft of you is the first target of an attack roll, that attack's critical hit threshold is reduced by 1. Additionally, whenever a hostile creature scores a critical hit against you, you recover 1 spent Rage.

At levels 13 and 17, the reduction to the critical hit threshold and the amount of Rage you recover both increase by 1.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Continual Flame Gem
Aviana Winterwing.description: This magical gem can be activated or deactivated using an action. While activated, it shines like a lit torch, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Spirit of the Elk
Aviana Winterwing.description:
When you activate this blessing you gain the following benefits:

Adept Forager

Level 6 Feature

You have advantage on Survival checks and you add your Constitution modifier to these checks.

Battering Ram

Level 6 Feature

When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a special charge attack.

You move up to 50 feet in a straight line that is 5 feet wide, stopping when you hit the first creature in your path. The creature must make a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your Strength modifier + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d12 + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage and is knocked back a distance equal to how far you charged before hitting it (to a maximum of 50 feet).

﻿If the creature is knocked back into another creature or a solid object, additional effects occur based on the distance it was knocked back:

Less than 30 feet: The creature is &Reference[distracted] until the start of its next turn.

30 to 40 feet: The creature is &Reference[restrained] until the end of its next turn.

More than 40 feet: The creature is &Reference[paralyzed] until the end of its next turn.

﻿If the creature collides with another creature, both creatures suffer the same effect.

Survival Instincts

Level 10 Feature

Your walking speed is increased by 20ft, you have a 1d6 bonus to your initiative rolls and, as long as you aren't incapacitated, you cannot be surprised.

Using Battering Ram grants you an amount of temporary hit points equal to your barbarian level.

Unstoppable

Level 14 Feature

As long as you're not &Reference[incapacitated], your movement speed cannot be reduced and you are immune to being &Reference[frightened], &Reference[restrained], &Reference[prone], and &Reference[grappled].

Additionally, you can use Battering Ram to charge through and break solid objects, such as walls, up to 5ft thick. You can also charge through and create holes in magical barriers this way if you succeed on a [[/save str format=long]] against the caster's spell save DC. If the barrier requires concentration to maintain, breaking through it immediately ends the caster's concentration on the barrier.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Spirit of the Bear
Aviana Winterwing.description:
When you activate this blessing you gain the following benefits:

Intimidating Presence

Level 6 Feature

You have advantage on Intimidation checks and you add your Strength modifier to Intimidation checks.

Savage Taunt

Level 6 Feature

Using your bonus action, you can roll an Intimidation check to present yourself as the biggest threat on the battlefield.

The DC against this ability is half the check's total, rounded up.

Hostile creatures within 20ft of you need to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they have to focus all of their attention solely on you for their next two turns.

Creatures with a Strength score that is higher than their Intelligence and Wisdom scores combined automatically fail this save.

Compelled Duel

Level 6 Feature

Using your bonus action, you can roll an Intimidation check to challenge a single creature that can see you to a duel.

The DC against this ability is check's total.

The creature needs to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has to focus all of it's attention solely on you for it's next two turns.

Creatures with a Strength score that is higher than their Intelligence and Wisdom scores combined automatically fail this save.

Only one creature can be compelled to duel you at any given time.

Ironfur

Level 10 Feature

When you take damage from a melee attack, your damage resistances reflect half of the incoming damage back at the attacker instead of just preventing it.

Survival of the Fittest

Level 14 Feature

Immediately after you take damage during combat, you can choose to spend one of your hit dice to heal yourself for 1d12 + your Constitution modifier.

If you're below 50% health, this healing increases to 2d12 + 2x your Constitution modifier.

If you're below 25% health, this healing increases to 4d12 + 4x your Constitution modifier.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Dented Iron Flask
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Current Inhabitant: None

Wondrous item

This iron bottle has a brass stopper. You can use an action to speak the flask's command word, targeting a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. If the target is native to a plane of existence other than the one you're on, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be trapped in the flask. If the target has been trapped by the flask before, it has advantage on the saving throw. Once trapped, a creature remains in the flask until released. The flask can hold only one creature at a time. A creature trapped in the flask doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink and doesn't age.

You can use an action to remove the flask's stopper and release the creature the flask contains. The creature acts in accordance with its normal disposition and alignment.

An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{Identify} spell reveals that a creature is inside the flask, but the only way to determine the type of creature is to open the flask.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Guardian's Reflex
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Prerequisite: Constitution 15 or higher

With the spirit of a true hero, you leap into harm's way to shield your allies, taking the hit they cannot. You gain the following benefits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

  • Intervene. When a creature you can see hits a target you can see, other than yourself, with a ranged weapon or spell attack, you can use your reaction to intercept it. To use this reaction, there must be an unoccupied space adjacent to the target, between the target and the attacker, and within your jumping distance. You leap to this space, landing directly in the line of attack and taking the hit intended for the target, applying all effects of the attack to yourself as though you were the original target. Until the end of the turn, the target gains &Reference[Three-Quarters Cover] and cannot roll death saving throws. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Ioun Stone, Language Knowledge
Aviana Winterwing.description:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of [[/r 1d3]] feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (&Reference[skill=Acrobatics]) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.

A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

You are fluent in one additional language while this pulsating bit of red jeweled crystal orbits your head. The DM chooses the language bestowed by the stone.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Torch
Aviana Winterwing.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Backpack
Aviana Winterwing.description: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Tinderbox
Aviana Winterwing.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Spyglass
Aviana Winterwing.description: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Potato Sack
Aviana Winterwing.description: A sack can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Hempen Rope (50 ft.)
Aviana Winterwing.description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Beast Spirit's Blessing
Aviana Winterwing.description:
During each short or long rest, you can spend some time training your physical abilities. Doing so will grant you the blessing of one of the beast spirits that guide or inspire you, depending on the kind of training you do.

At level 12, your bond with the beast spirits strengthens, allowing you to exchange one blessing for another even when you're not taking a rest. Calling for a spirit's blessing this way takes an action and gives you one level of &Reference[exhaustion].

Aviana Winterwing.name: Legendary Vigor
Aviana Winterwing.description:
By expending 1 Mythic Power as a free action on your turn, you can achieve feats of strength and endurance that most would consider to lie firmly in the realm of myth and legend. Alternatively, while it is not your turn, you can use this feature as a reaction, which you take before making a Strength or Constitution ability check or saving throw.

For 1 round per Mythic Rank, you gain the following benefits:

  • Whenever you make a Strength or Constitution ability check or saving throw, you treat a d20 roll of 19 or lower as a 20.

  • When using the Grapple action, you can grapple creatures of any size as if they were no more than one size larger than you.

  • The damage of your melee weapon attacks against structures and objects increases by a factor of 10 per Mythic Rank.

  • The maximum distance you can jump and the distance you can shove a creature when you use the Shove action both increase by a factor of 10 per mythic rank.

  • Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift increases by a factor of 10 per Mythic Rank.

Immediately after this effect ends, the grappled condition ends on any creature grappled by you if its size exceeds the maximum size you can grapple.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Potion of Growth
Aviana Winterwing.description:
The red in the potion's liquid continuously expands from a tiny bead to color the clear liquid around it and then contracts. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

When you drink this potion, you gain the "enlarge" effect of the enlarge/reduce spell for 1d4 hours (no concentration required):

While enlarged, your size is increased by one category and your weight is multiplied by eight.
You have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws and your attacks with weapons deal an additional 1d4 damage.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Resistance
Aviana Winterwing.description: You touch one willing creature. For the duration of the spell, the creature adds a d4 to all saving throws.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Death Ward
Aviana Winterwing.description:
You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death.

The first time the target would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead drops to 1 hit point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is instead negated against the target, and the spell ends.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Spirit of the Eagle
Aviana Winterwing.description:
When you activate this blessing you gain the following benefits:

Keen Sight

Level 6 Feature

You have advantage on Perception checks.

Billowing Wings

Level 6 Feature

You have a flying speed equal to your current walking speed. This benefit works only in short bursts; you fall if you end your turn in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft.

Diving Strike

Level 10 Feature

As a bonus action, you leap at a creature within jumping distance that's at least 10ft away from you and attack it with a natural weapon attack. If this attack hits, it deals an additional 1d6 damage for every 10ft of distance between your starting location and the target creature.

Afterwards, regardless of the attack hitting, you land in the nearest unoccupied space (and cause any effects that trigger upon landing a jump).

Double Down

Level 14 Feature

When you hit a creature with your Diving Strike, your next Diving Strike this turn is an attack action instead of a bonus action. If the hit was a critical hit, your next Diving Strike this turn is a free action instead.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Unflinching
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Whenever you take damage from a critical hit, you immediately regain 2d12 hit points per mythic rank.

If the hit points restored this way exceed the damage taken from the triggering hit, all hostile creatures that can see you must make a [[/save wis dc=8+@abilities.con.mod+@prof format=long]] (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus) or become &Reference[frightened]. While frightened by this effect, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature can make another [[/save wis dc=8+@abilities.con.mod+@prof format=long]]. On a successful save, the effect ends for that creature.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Godbreaker
Aviana Winterwing.description:
While you're grappling a creature, you can expend 1 Mythic Power as an action to throw the grappled creature 20 feet straight up into the air and leap after it.

While airborne, make an unarmed attack against the creature. If the attack hits, the creature is flung an additional 20 feet upward, and you follow along, propelled by the momentum of your jump.
You may repeat this process a number of times equal to your mythic rank, launching the creature another 20 feet upward with each successful hit. The sequence ends early if an attack misses.

When the sequence ends—whether due to a missed attack or after the maximum number of attacks—you seize the grappled creature and drive it into the ground as you land.
You take no falling damage, but the grappled creature and all other creatures within 5 feet of it must make a [[/save dex dc=8+@abilities.str.mod+@prof format=long]] (DC = 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus), which the grappled creature automatically fails. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as though falling from double the total height reached and falls &Reference[prone]. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked &Reference[prone].

Aviana Winterwing.name: Bugman’s Ale
Aviana Winterwing.description:
This special brew was originally created by the legendary dwarven brewmaster Joseph Bugman, and he shared its recipe only with his most trusted apprentices.

When you drink this ale, you need to make a DC 30 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you become immune to the &Reference[Frightened] condition for 8 hours.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Dodge
Aviana Winterwing.description: When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated (as explained in the appendix) or if your speed drops to 0.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Stone's Endurance
Aviana Winterwing.description: You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you're about to take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total ([[/roll 1d12+@abilities.con.mod #Damage Reduction]]). You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Silver Wing Shield
Aviana Winterwing.description:
You use your powerful wings instead of a regular shield, granting you +2 to your AC.

You cannot unequip this item.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Boots of Vile Darkness
Aviana Winterwing.description: When you land from a jump, magical darkness spreads from your location, as per the Darkness spell. This effect does not require concentration and lasts for the spell’s normal duration. Any previous darkness created by these boots is immediately dispelled when this effect occurs.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Darkness
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with Darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Activated: Sending - 3rd
Aviana Winterwing.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a [[/r 1d20]]{5 percent} chance that the message doesn't arrive.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Manacles
Aviana Winterwing.description: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick the manacles' lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 hit points.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Chain (10 feet)
Aviana Winterwing.description: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Triggered: Shield - 1st
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Trigger: Targeted by magic missile

An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Activated: Longstrider - 1st
Aviana Winterwing.description:
You touch a creature. The target's speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Activated: Hold Person - 2nd
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be Paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Activated: Borrowed Knowledge - 2nd
Aviana Winterwing.description: You draw on knowledge from spirits of the past. Choose one skill in which you lack proficiency. For the spell's duration, you have proficiency in the chosen skill. The spell ends early if you cast it again.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Find Traps
Aviana Winterwing.description:
You sense the presence of any trap within range that is within line of sight. A trap, for the purpose of this spell, includes anything that would inflict a sudden or unexpected effect you consider harmful or undesirable, which was specifically intended as such by its creator. Thus, the spell would sense an area affected by the alarm spell, a glyph of warding or a mechanical pit trap, but it would not reveal a natural weakness in the floor, an unstable ceiling, or a hidden sinkhole.

This spell merely reveals that a trap is present. You don't learn the location of each trap, but you do learn the general nature of the danger posed by a trap you sense.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Triggered: Anticipate Arcana - 3rd
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Trigger: Targeted by a spell or magical effect from an enemy that forces a save.

Your foresight gives you an instant to ready your defenses against a magical attack. When you cast this spell, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects until the start of your next turn.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Abjurer's Bangle
Aviana Winterwing.description: You can clasp or remove this metal bracelet around the wrist or ankle of yourself or a willing creature within your reach using an action, unless that creature already has an Abjurer's Bangle equipped. The bangle emits a ward of abjuration magic from it that has 120 charges. A creature wearing the bangle can use its reaction when it takes damage to speak the bangle's command word and expend any number of charges to gain temporary hit points equal to the number of charges spent. Upon consuming the last charge, the bangle becomes a nonmagical bracelet.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Activated: Mind Blank - 8th
Aviana Winterwing.description: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is immune to psychic damage, any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, divination spells, and the &Reference[condition=charmed] condition. The spell even foils wish spells and spells or effects of similar power used to affect the target's mind or to gain information about the target.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Potion of Giant Size
Aviana Winterwing.description:
This potion is a pale white liquid made from the tongue of a giant clam, with a pungent aroma akin to that of rotting algae. It tastes sweet, however, when consumed.

When you drink this potion, your size increases by up to two categories for 24 hours. For that duration, your Strength becomes 25, if it isn't already higher, and your hit point maximum is doubled (your current hit points are doubled when you drink the potion). In addition, the reach of your melee attacks increases by 5 feet.

Everything you are carrying and wearing also increases in size for the duration. When rolling damage for weapons enlarged in this manner, roll three times the normal number of dice; for example, an enlarged longsword would deal [[/r 3d8]] slashing damage (instead of [[/r 1d8]]), or [[/r 3d10]] slashing damage (instead of [[/r 1d10]]) when used with two hands.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Activated: Greater Restoration - 9th
Aviana Winterwing.description:
You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

One effect that &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=petrified] the target

One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item

Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores

One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

Aviana Winterwing.name: Amulet of Fragile Tranquility
Aviana Winterwing.description:
requires attunement by a barbarian

You are immune to psychic damage and you have advantage on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed], &Reference[frightened], or otherwise affected by mind-altering effects.

Additionally, you have a bonus to [[/skill inv]], [[/skill ani]], [[/skill ins]], [[/skill prc]], [[/skill sur]], [[/skill per]], [[/skill dec]], and [[/skill prf]] checks equal to the number of unspent uses of your Rage feature.

Curse.

This amulet is cursed, and this curse extends to you for as long as you're attuned to it.

While cursed this way, you can’t willingly enter a rage but whenever another creature damages you while you are not raging, you immediately enter a rage, expending one use of your Rage feature. If you have no remaining uses of Rage, you instead fall into a Blood Frenzy for 1 minute.

Blood Frenzy.

You enter a rage without expending a use of your Rage feature. While in this frenzy:

  • You are &Reference[blinded] and &Reference[deafened], and your blindsight is reduced to 0 feet.

  • You are immune to telepathy.

  • You can sense the presence of living creatures within 60 feet of you, even through solid objects. This sense does not detect constructs, elementals, oozes, plants, undead, ethereal creatures, petrified creatures, or those immune to bleeding.

  • Each living creature you can sense this way is perceived as prey, and you must take the most direct and effective actions available to hunt down and kill the closest one to the best of your abilities.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Shalkoc's Black Scale
Aviana Winterwing.description: An scale from Shalkoc given to Aviana in good gesture, just before he goes to fetch some Wine from the Cellar.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Steel Mirror
Aviana Winterwing.description: A mirror made of steel.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Ink Pen
Aviana Winterwing.description: A deviced used in combination with ink to write or draw on a sheet of paper.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Ink Bottle
Aviana Winterwing.description: A small bottle of ink for writing upon parchment.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Null-Steel Chain (10 feet)
Aviana Winterwing.description: A chain of heavy, blackened steel which has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check. A creature restrained by these chains cannot cast spells of 5th level or lower.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Headband of Intellect
Aviana Winterwing.description: Your Intelligence score is 19 while you wear this headband. It has no effect on you if your Intelligence is already 19 or higher without it.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Gold locket with a painted portrait inside
Hearthstone
Aviana Winterwing.description:
The Hearthstone is a sacred item among all giantkin. These heavy, flat pieces of granite—typically 1 to 2 feet in diameter—are painstakingly carved by mighty runepriests, imbued with ancient magic to tether the bearer’s essence to a place of safety. Revered as both currency and a protective charm, Hearthstones are traded between giants with great reverence, their value lying not only in material worth but in the promise of an arduous but ultimately safe journey back home in death, for those strong enough to endure it.

Shattering. When a creature carrying a Hearthstone dies, the Hearthstone shatters. Upon doing so, the creature must make a [[/save con DC 18]] saving throw. On a successful save, the creature's body and any attuned items it carried at the time of its death instantly return to the location of its last extended rest. The body appears unconscious, afflicted by a deep fever, and remains in this state until the soul completes its return journey.

Unless the creature’s soul is captured at the time of the creature's death, it must travel through a cold and snow-covered woodland, eventually finding refuge in a warm cabin, symbolizing its body. The journey back to its body takes a number of weeks equal to 50 minus the result of the saving throw (minimum of 1 week). During this time, the creature cannot be revived by any means, including spells like revivify or raise dead.

Once the soul completes its journey, the creature’s fever breaks, and it awakens with 1 hit point. The Hearthstone is destroyed after use and cannot be restored or repaired.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Potion of Heroism
Aviana Winterwing.description:
This blue potion bubbles and steams as if boiling.

When you drink this potion you gain 10 temporary hit points. Additionally you are under the effect of the Bless spell for 1 hour (no concentration required).

Aviana Winterwing.name: Compelled Duel
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Using your bonus action, you can roll an Intimidation check to challenge a single creature that can see you to a duel.

The DC against this ability is check's total.

The creature needs to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has to focus all of it's attention solely on you for it's next two turns.

Creatures with a Strength score that is higher than their Intelligence and Wisdom scores combined automatically fail this save.

Only one creature can be compelled to duel you at any given time.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Ironfur
Aviana Winterwing.description: When you take damage from a melee attack, your damage resistances reflect half of the incoming damage back at the attacker instead of just preventing it.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Intimidating Presence
Aviana Winterwing.description: You have advantage on Intimidation checks and you add your Strength modifier to Intimidation checks.

Aviana Winterwing.name: Savage Taunt
Aviana Winterwing.description:
Using your bonus action, you can roll an Intimidation check to present yourself as the biggest threat on the battlefield.

The DC against this ability is half the check's total, rounded up.

Hostile creatures within 20ft of you need to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they have to focus all of their attention solely on you for their next two turns.

Creatures with a Strength score that is higher than their Intelligence and Wisdom scores combined automatically fail this save.

Emilio Astray.name: Pact Magic
Emilio Astray.description:
Your arcane research and the magic bestowed on you by your patron have given you facility with spells.

Cantrips

You know two cantrips of your choice from the warlock spell list. You learn additional warlock cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Warlock table.

Spell Slots

The Warlock table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your warlock spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.

For example, when you are 5th level, you have two 3rd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell thunderwave, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 3rd-level spell.

Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher

At 1st level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the warlock spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Warlock table shows when you learn more warlock spells of your choice of 1st level and higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 6th level, for example, you learn a new warlock spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the warlock spells you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Spellcasting Ability

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells, so you use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

Spellcasting Focus

You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

Emilio Astray.name: Starbonded
Emilio Astray.description:
When you are presented with an aberrant creature's natural form, you instantly recall some esoteric bit of lore about that creature. Usually, this information regards the creature's favored diet or habitat, but on rare occasion you may know that creature's name.

Your DM might rule that this effect may only happen once per day, or that the information only comes to you when you next fall asleep.

Emilio Astray.name: Moderately Armored
Emilio Astray.description:
Prerequisite: Proficiency with light armor

You have trained to master the use of medium armor and shields, gaining the following benefits:

  • Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20. (chosen Dexterity)
  • You gain proficiency with medium armor and shields.

Emilio Astray.name: Agonizing Blast
Emilio Astray.description: When you cast Eldritch Blast, add your Charisma modifier to the damage it deals on a hit.

Emilio Astray.name: Devil's Sight
Emilio Astray.description: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

Emilio Astray.name: Pact of the Tome
Emilio Astray.description:
Your patron gives you a grimoire called a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three cantrips from any class's spell list (the three needn't be from the same list). While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They don't count against your number of cantrips known. If they don't appear on the warlock spell list, they are nonetheless warlock spells for you.

If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.

Emilio Astray.name: Book of Ancient Secrets
Emilio Astray.description:
You can now inscribe magical rituals in your Book of Shadows. Choose two 1st-level spells that have the ritual tag from any class's spell list (the two needn't be from the same list). The spells appear in the book and don't count against the number of spells you know. With your Book of Shadows in hand, you can cast the chosen spells as rituals. You can't cast the spells except as rituals, unless you've learned them by some other means. You can also cast a warlock spell you know as a ritual if it has the ritual tag.

On your adventures, you can add other ritual spells to your Book of Shadows. When you find such a spell, you can add it to the book if the spell's level is equal to or less than half your warlock level (rounded up) and if you can spare the time to transcribe the spell. For each level of the spell, the transcription process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp for the rare inks needed to inscribe it.

Emilio Astray.name: Thirsting Claws
Emilio Astray.description:
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action with your Reaping Claws on your turn.

Additionally, attacks made with these claws count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

Emilio Astray.name: Mystic Arcanum
Emilio Astray.description:
At 11th level, your patron bestows upon you a magical secret called an arcanum. Choose one 6th-level spell from the warlock spell list as this arcanum.

You can cast your arcanum spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

At higher levels, you gain more warlock spells of your choice that can be cast in this way: one 7th-level spell at 13th level, one 8th-level spell at 15th level, and one 9th-level spell at 17th level. You regain all uses of your Mystic Arcanum when you finish a long rest.

Emilio Astray.name: Circle of Death
Emilio Astray.description:
A sphere of negative energy ripples out in a 60-foot radius from a point within range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Higher Levels
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 6th.

Emilio Astray.name: Dying of the Light
Emilio Astray.description:
A wave of withering darkness erupts from you, filling a 120-foot-radius sphere and extinguishing any nonmagical light sources in the area. Any light produced by spells of 6th level or lower is dispelled. Magic items (but not artifacts) that give off light have that property suppressed while in the spell's area. Any light sources brought into the area during the spell's duration are likewise extinguished. Light-producing spells of 7th level or higher function within the area.

Nonmagical light sources removed from the area can be reignited. Magic items regain their ability to give off light 1 round after leaving the area. This magical darkness foils &Reference[darkvision] except for creatures that can see in magical darkness, such as devils.

Each creature you choose to be affected that ends its turn in the darkness takes [[/damage 4d8 necrotic]] damage and gains one level of &Reference[exhaustion]. A successful Constitution saving throw halves the damage and negates the &Reference[exhaustion].

Emilio Astray.name: Tough
Emilio Astray.description: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a level thereafter, your hit point maximum increases by an additional 2 hit points.

Emilio Astray.name: Grasp of Hadar
Emilio Astray.description: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with your Eldritch Blast, you can move that creature in a straight line 10 feet closer to you.

Emilio Astray.name: Hidden Heart
Emilio Astray.description: As long as you have your pact tome on your person, you cannot be compelled to tell the truth via magic, and your illusions and transmutations, including any shapeshifting forms, appear as real to divination magic and truesight.

Emilio Astray.name: Trickster's Escape
Emilio Astray.description: You can cast Freedom of Movement once on yourself without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

Emilio Astray.name: Freedom of Movement
Emilio Astray.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target's movement is unaffected by &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain}, and spells and other magical effects can neither reduce the target's speed nor cause the target to be &Reference[condition=paralyzed] or &Reference[condition=restrained].

The target can also spend 5 feet of movement to automatically escape from nonmagical restraints, such as manacles or a creature that has it &Reference[condition=grappled]. Finally, being underwater imposes no penalties on the target's movement or attacks.

Emilio Astray.name: Blade Ward
Emilio Astray.description: You extend your hand and trace a sigil of warding in the air. Until the end of your next turn, you have resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by weapon attacks.

Emilio Astray.name: Eldritch Blast
Emilio Astray.description:
A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage 1d10 type=force]] damage.

The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

Emilio Astray.name: Hellfire
Emilio Astray.description:
You create an eruption of smoldering hellfire around a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take [[/damage 1d4 type=fire]] damage plus [[/damage 1d4 type=necrotic]] damage.

This spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4 each), 11th level (3d4 each), and 17th level (4d4 each).

Emilio Astray.name: Frostbite
Emilio Astray.description:
You cause numbing frost to form on one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 1d6 type=cold]] damage, and it has disadvantage on the next weapon attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

The spell's damage increases by [[/damage 1d6]] when you reach 5th level ([[/damage 2d6]]), 11th level ([[/damage 3d6]]), and 17th level ([[/damage 4d6]]).

Emilio Astray.name: Counterspell
Emilio Astray.description:
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

Emilio Astray.name: Dissonant Whispers
Emilio Astray.description:
You whisper a discordant melody that only one creature of your choice within range can hear, wracking it with terrible pain. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes [[/damage 3d6 type=psychic]] damage and must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from you. The creature doesn't move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and doesn't have to move away. A &Reference[condition=deafened] creature automatically succeeds on the save.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d6]] for each slot level above 1st.

Emilio Astray.name: Void Torrent
Emilio Astray.description: You open a small gate to the Far Realms, unleashing a 60-foot cone of inky blackness. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a target takes [[/damage 3d6 cold]] and [[/damage 3d6 acid]] damage, or half as much on a successful save. You can then dissolve into the torrent, reappearing in an unoccupied space within the cone’s area. This repositioning doesn’t count as movement and doesn’t trigger opportunity attacks.

Emilio Astray.name: Steel Wind Strike
Emilio Astray.description:
You flourish the weapon used in the casting and then vanish to strike like the wind. Choose up to five creatures you can see within range. Make a melee spell attack against each target. On a hit, a target takes [[/damage 6d10 type=force]] damage.

You can then teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of one of the targets you hit or missed.

Emilio Astray.name: Nondetection
Emilio Astray.description: For the Duration, you hide a target that you touch from Divination magic. The target can be a willing creature or a place or an object no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. The target can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical Scrying sensors.

Emilio Astray.name: Abhorrent Apparition
Emilio Astray.description:
You toss the item ahead of you to a spot of your choosing within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-sphere centered on that point must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a target takes [[/damage 6d8 type=psychic]] damage and becomes &Reference[condition=frightened] of you for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn’t&Reference[condition=frightened]. A creature &Reference[condition=frightened] this way can make another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by [[/r 1d8]] for each slot level above 4th.

Emilio Astray.name: Gift of Alacrity
Emilio Astray.description: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target can add [[/r 1d8]] to its initiative rolls.

Emilio Astray.name: Howling Horrors
Emilio Astray.description:
You let loose the howl of a ravenous eldritch horror. Each hostile creature within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a target believes it has been transported to the void and is under attack by unspeakable horrors. An affected creature must choose either to face the horrors or to curl into a ball for protection. A creature that faces the horrors takes [[/damage 7d8 psychic]] damage, and then the spell ends on it. A creature that curls into a ball falls &Reference[condition=prone] and is &Reference[condition=stunned] until the end of your next turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by [[/r 2d8]] for each slot level above 5th.

Emilio Astray.name: Arms of Hadar
Emilio Astray.description:
You invoke the power of Hadar, the Dark Hunger. Tendrils of dark energy erupt from you and batter all creatures within 10 feet of you. Each creature in that area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes [[/damage 2d6 type=necrotic]] damage and is &Reference[distracted] until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, but suffers no other effect.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d6]] for each slot level above 1st.

Emilio Astray.name: Hellish Rebuke
Emilio Astray.description:
You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes [[/damage 2d10 fire]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by [[/r 1d10]] for each slot level above 1st.

Emilio Astray.name: Tasha's Mind Whip
Emilio Astray.description:
You psychically lash out at one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 3d6 type=psychic]] damage, and is &Reference[distracted] and &Reference[dazed] until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers none of the spell's other effects.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Emilio Astray.name: Detect Thoughts
Emilio Astray.description:
For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature—what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature's thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.

Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can't see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within 30 feet of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with an Intelligence of 3 or lower or one that doesn't speak any language.

Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be within range.

Emilio Astray.name: Guidance
Emilio Astray.description: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a [[/r d4]] and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice. It has to roll the die before making the ability check. The spell then ends.

Emilio Astray.name: Mage Hand
Emilio Astray.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Emilio Astray.name: Minor Illusion
Emilio Astray.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/skill investigation dc=@attributes.spelldc format=long]] against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Emilio Astray.name: Detect Magic
Emilio Astray.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Emilio Astray.name: Alarm
Emilio Astray.description:
You set an alarm against unwanted intrusion. Choose a door, a window, or an area within range that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. Until the spell ends, an alarm alerts you whenever a Tiny or larger creature touches or enters the warded area. When you cast the spell, you can designate creatures that won't set off the alarm. You also choose whether the alarm is mental or audible.

A mental alarm alerts you with a ping in your mind if you are within 1 mile of the warded area. This ping awakens you if you are sleeping.

An audible alarm produces the sound of a hand bell for 10 seconds within 60 feet.

Emilio Astray.name: Backpack
Emilio Astray.description: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

Emilio Astray.name: Bedroll
Emilio Astray.description: Roll of cloth used by traveller to sleep in.

Emilio Astray.name: Hooded Lantern
Emilio Astray.description: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

Emilio Astray.name: Moonstone
Emilio Astray.description:
"There's a legend that lycanthropes, just at the mere sight of this stone, are forced to shape-shift. Quite fascinating, indeed."

It is one of the most affordable gemstones in circulation and in some societies it is sewn into garments as a charm.

Emilio Astray.name: Playing Cards Set
Emilio Astray.description:
This item encompasses a wide range of playing card types, both unmarked and marked.

If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set. Each type of gaming set requires a separate proficiency.

Emilio Astray.name: Rations
Emilio Astray.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Emilio Astray.name: Shovel
Emilio Astray.description: A tool resembling a spade with a broad blade and typically upturned sides, used for moving coals, earth, snow or other material.

Emilio Astray.name: Thieves' Tools
Emilio Astray.description: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

Emilio Astray.name: Tinderbox
Emilio Astray.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

Emilio Astray.name: Whetstone
Emilio Astray.description: Whetstone is a sharpening stone. It is used to sharpen the edges of steel tools and implements through grinding and honing.

Emilio Astray.name: Adamantine Breastplate
Emilio Astray.description:
This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

Emilio Astray.name: Crown of the Wrath Bringer
Emilio Astray.description:
This jagged iron circlet bears ornaments in the shape of the enemy rune. When worn, the crown glows with pale light as it draws upon the wearer's fury to strike opponents with vicious terror.

When you make an attack roll against a creature and hit it while wearing this crown, you can spend and roll one of your unspent Hit Dice. The creature takes extra psychic damage equal to the number rolled.

Invoking the Rune. As an action, you can invoke the crown's rune to cast the Fear spell (save DC 15) with it; the spell has a duration of 1 minute and doesn't require &Reference[concentration]. Once the rune has been invoked, it can't be invoked again until the next dawn.

Emilio Astray.name: Fear
Emilio Astray.description:
You project a phantasmal image of a creature's worst fears. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become &Reference[condition=frightened] for the duration.

While &Reference[condition=frightened] by this spell, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

Emilio Astray.name: Eldritch Claw Tattoo
Emilio Astray.description:
Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo depicts clawlike forms and other jagged shapes.
