All doors in the warded area are magically locked, as if sealed by an arcane lock spell. In addition, you can cover up to ten doors with an illusion (equivalent to the illusory object function of the minor illusion spell) to make them appear as plain sections of wall.

Stairs.

Webs fill all stairs in the warded area from top to bottom, as the web spell. These strands regrow in 10 minutes if they are burned or torn away while guards and wards lasts.

Other Spell Effect.

You can place your choice of one of the following magical effects within the warded area of the stronghold.

  • Place dancing lights in four corridors. You can designate a simple program that the lights repeat as long as guards and wards lasts.
  • Place magic mouth in two locations.
  • Place stinking cloud in two locations. The vapors appear in the places you designate; they return within 10 minutes if dispersed by wind while guards and wards lasts.
  • Place a constant gust of wind in one corridor or room.
  • Place a suggestion in one location. You select an area of up to 5 feet square, and any creature that enters or passes through the area receives the suggestion mentally.

The whole warded area radiates magic. A dispel magic cast on a specific effect, if successful, removes only that effect.

You can create a permanently guarded and warded structure by casting this spell there every day for one year.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Blue-White Diamond
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: The most notable gem from the Diamond variations is usually the colorless one which does have a blue-white tint. The use of diamonds is mainly in the jewelry market. Due to its brilliance, hardness, and rarity, it is the most famous of all gemstones.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Ancient Chainmail of Celerity
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Requires attunement by an arcane spellcaster

While you're wearing this +2 ancient chainmail and are attuned to it, you're under the effect of Celerity.

Ancient Armor

Arcane Spell Fail chance: 35%
Armor Check Penalty: -5

&Reference[ancientarmor]

Celerity

Your speed is doubled and you have a +1 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.

You gain an additional action each turn. This action can only be used to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action, or cast a spell with a casting time of one action.

While under the effect of Celerity, if you were to become affected by the Haste spell, you instead become lethargic for one turn.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Traitorous Blood
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You target a creature within range whose blood betrays them under your dark influence. The creature must have a Challenge Rating less than twice the level of the spell slot used to cast this spell. If the creature fails a Constitution saving throw, you seize control of its blood, twisting and manipulating it to puppet the creature’s body for the duration of the spell.

On the creature's turn, you dictate its movement and physical actions, forcing it to move and strike as you command. However, the creature's mind remains its own, fully aware of the unnatural control over its body. Because of this, you cannot compel the creature to cast spells, perform tasks that require concentration or significant mental effort, or take actions that require its willingness.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Inflict Wounds - 5th
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
5th Level

Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 necrotic damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Murgaxor's Elixir of Life
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Whoever drinks this concoction gains advantage on death saving throws for 24 hours.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Glasses of True Seeing
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
These glasses have 3 charges. As an action, you can speak the glasses' command word and expend 1 charge. For the next 10 minutes you have &Reference[rule=truesight] out to 30 feet while you're wearing them.

The glasses regain [[/r 1d3]] expended charges after you finish a long rest.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Evocation Savant
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: As a bonus action, you can swap out any of your prepared spells with an unprepared evocation spell you know. You can use this feature a number of times per day equal to your proficiency bonus.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Dispel Magic - 3rd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
3rd Level

Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Conjure Elemental
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You call forth an elemental servant. Choose an area of air, earth, fire, or water that fills a 10-foot cube within range. An elemental of challenge rating 5 or lower appropriate to the area you chose appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. For example, a fire elemental emerges from a bonfire, and an earth elemental rises up from the ground. The elemental disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The elemental is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the elemental, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the elemental, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

If your concentration is broken, the elemental doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the elemental, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled elemental can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

The DM has the elemental's statistics.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Gentle Repose
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You touch a corpse or other remains. For the duration, the target is protected from decay and can't become undead.

The spell also effectively extends the time limit on raising the target from the dead, since days spent under the influence of this spell don't count against the time limit of spells such as raise dead.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Greater Restoration
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

One effect that &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=petrified] the target

One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item

Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores

One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Emerald
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Translucent Emeralds are cut and polished in gem cuts for jewelry. Mainly provided as gifts for royalty or nobility. In the past, it was associated with health, fertility, and growth and used to adorn magical items that improved the healing arts.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Blue Quartz
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Preferred by glassmiths or gaffers, to make different types of cups and vases and with help from the blacksmiths, it is used to ornate tankards. Magic wielders use this gemstone to see across the lands or through someone's deceit.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Sunbeam
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
A beam of brilliant light flashes out from your hand in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 6d8 type=radiant]] damage and is &Reference[condition=blinded] until your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't &Reference[condition=blinded] by this spell. Undead and oozes have disadvantage on this saving throw.

You can create a new line of radiance as your action on any turn until the spell ends.

For the duration, a mote of brilliant radiance shines in your hand. It sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. This light is sunlight.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Mind Crystal (Subtle)
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This gemstone contains a crystallized bit of spellcasting magic.

When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action while holding the mind crystal, you can modify the spell in the way described below. You can use only a single mind crystal to modify the spell, and you can't use a mind crystal and a Metamagic option on the same spell. Once you use the mind crystal, it shatters into nothingness.

Modify Spell

You cast the spell without any somatic or verbal components for this casting.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Rary's Telepathic Bond
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You forge a telepathic link among up to eight willing creatures of your choice within range, psychically linking each creature to all the others for the duration. Creatures with Intelligence scores of 2 or less aren't affected by this spell.

Until the spell ends, the targets can communicate telepathically through the bond whether or not they have a common language. The communication is possible over any distance, though it can't extend to other planes of existence.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Jade
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Its primary form is called Jadeite, after cutting, it's mainly used in ornamental sculptures and figurines. Musicians of all kinds believed that if they wore Jade, they would improve their musical prowess

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Flame-Runed Alchemist's Supplies
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Only the fire giants of Muspelheim know how to scribe runes capable of enhancing one's craftsmanship.

When you make a tool check using this tool, you can choose to consume one charge to add a d4 to the roll. The tool regains all spent charges when you take a long rest.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Fever Grass
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Thrives abundantly in sunny grasslands. Slender stems bear needle-like leaves and golden-hued flowers. Possesses a fragrant aroma believed to hold medicinal properties.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Globe of Invulnerability
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
An immobile, faintly shimmering barrier springs into existence in a 10-foot radius around you and remains for the duration.

Any spell of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas affected by such spells.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the barrier blocks spells of one level higher for each slot level above 6th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Globe of Invulnerability
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
An immobile, faintly shimmering barrier springs into existence in a 10-foot radius around you and remains for the duration.

Any spell of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas affected by such spells.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the barrier blocks spells of one level higher for each slot level above 6th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Snow Moss
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Clings to the walls of deep glacial crevasses. Its tiny, delicate leaves form a thick, velvety carpet that glistens with frost under the icy light.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Voidborn Explorer's Spellbook
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You’ll use it, won’t you? You’ll use the spells. But remember… it’s not the monsters out there that will break you. It’s what you bring back.


Requires attunement by a wizard capable of casting 5th-level spells.

This ancient tome, its cover etched with shifting cosmic patterns, hums with an eerie energy. The pages, faded but intact, display not only arcane writings but also celestial maps that seem to twist and change when viewed from different angles. Written by one of the few who ventured into the far reaches of the void and managed to return - though his mind was forever changed and twisted.

While you're attuned to the book:

  • You reduce any psychic damage you take by an amount equal to your wizard level.

  • You gain a bonus to Intelligence and Charisma saving throws equal to one-third your wizard level (rounded down).

The spellbook has 12 charges. While holding the book and attuned to it, you can use the charges to cast the following spells without expending a spell slot or material components. Each spell cast in this way consumes charges equal to the spell’s level:

  • Lesser Restoration (2 charges)
  • Legend Lore (5 charges)
  • Greater Restoration (5 charges)
  • Word of Recall (6 charges)
  • Sign of Sanctuary (7 charges)
  • Foresight (9 charges)

The spellbook regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Greater Restoration
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

One effect that &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=petrified] the target

One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item

Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores

One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Legend Lore
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Name or describe a person, place, or object. The spell brings to your mind a brief summary of the significant lore about the thing you named. The lore might consist of current tales, forgotten stories, or even secret lore that has never been widely known. If the thing you named isn't of legendary importance, you gain no information. The more information you already have about the thing, the more precise and detailed the information you receive is.

The information you learn is accurate but might be couched in figurative language. For example, if you have a mysterious magic axe on hand, the spell might yield this information: "Woe to the evildoer whose hand touches the axe, for even the haft slices the hand of the evil ones. Only a true Child of Stone, lover and beloved of Moradin, may awaken the true powers of the axe, and only with the sacred word Rudnogg on the lips."

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Word of Recall
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within the same location once each day for 7 days in a row. Once placed, the location of your sanctuary can only be changed through the casting of a Wish spell.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Lesser Restoration
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Sign of Sanctuary
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You inscribe a sign on the ground, the floor, or other solid surface of a structure. The sign creates a spherical sanctuary with a radius of 50 feet, centered on the sign.

Choose one of the following creature types: aberration, beast, celestial, dragon, elemental, fey, fiend, giant, humanoid, monstrosity, ooze, plant, or undead. The sign affects creatures of the chosen type (including you, if applicable) in the following ways:

  • If an affected creature tries to enter the sphere's area either via nonmagical means or by using teleportation, a dimensional shortcut, or other magical means, it must make a successful Charisma saving throw or the attempt fails and the creature takes [[/damage 10d8 type=radiant]] or [[/damage 10d8 type=necrotic]] damage (your choice).

  • They cannot see into the sphere, it's surface appearing like opaque glass to them.

  • They cannot hear any sounds that originate inside the sphere.
  • They can't &Reference[condition=charmed]{charm}, &Reference[condition=frightened]{frighten}, or possess creatures inside the sphere.

When you cast this spell, you can choose to reverse its magic; doing this will prevent affected creatures from leaving the area instead of from entering it, make them unable to hear sounds that originate outside the sphere, and so forth.

At Higher Levels

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the radius increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 7th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Foresight
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You touch a willing creature and bestow a limited ability to see into the immediate future. For the duration, the target can't be surprised and has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. Additionally, other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target for the duration.

This spell immediately ends if you cast it again before its duration ends.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Call of the Void
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
With a flick of your wrist, you rend open the fabric of reality, creating a rift to the Far Realms. A writhing, unnatural void fills the air, exuding an eerie silence and drawing everything around it into its alien darkness.

When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled into the Far Realms. On a failed save, the creature is instantly transported to the Far Realms, engulfed by its chaotic and mind-shattering landscape. If the saving throw succeeds, the creature takes 8d10 acid damage and 8d10 cold damage as it resists the void’s pull.

If a creature is more than 5 feet away from the rift’s edge, it automatically fails the saving throw, having nothing to grasp as it is dragged toward the void. Whenever a creature fails the saving throw and is transported to the Far Realms, the radius of the rift expands by 5 feet, its influence creeping ever outward.

A single caster can have only one active rift created by Call of the Void on a plane at any given time. If a caster attempts to create a second rift while their original rift remains open, the spell fails. Multiple casters, however, can each maintain their own rift on the same plane.

A caster can close their own rift by using dispel magic cast at 6th level or higher, focusing their magic on the rift to stitch the tear shut and end the spell’s effects.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Ironclad Heritage
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Prerequisite: Dwarf (mountain)

Among many of your kin, chainmail might pass as armor, but only heavy plates and a shield make one fully dressed. You gain the following benefit:

  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with heavy armor and shields.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Sending
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a [[/r 1d20]]{5 percent} chance that the message doesn't arrive.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Slow
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and becomes &Reference[distracted]. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a [[/r d20]]. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted.

A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Guidance
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a [[/r d4]] and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice. It has to roll the die before making the ability check. The spell then ends.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Ioun Stone, Language Knowledge
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of [[/r 1d3]] feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (&Reference[skill=Acrobatics]) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.

A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

You are fluent in one additional language while this pulsating bit of red jeweled crystal orbits your head. The DM chooses the language bestowed by the stone.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Guidance
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a [[/r d4]] and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice. It has to roll the die before making the ability check. The spell then ends.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Necklace of Fireballs
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This necklace has 9 beads hanging from it. You can use an action to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet away. When it reaches the end of its trajectory, the bead detonates as a 3rd-level fireball spell (save DC 15).

You can hurl multiple beads, or even the whole necklace, as one action. When you do so, increase the level of the fireball by 1 for each bead beyond the first.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Fireball
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Ioun Stone, Sandstone
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of [[/r 1d3]] feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (&Reference[skill=Acrobatics]) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.

A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

While this sandstone orbits your head, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Flame-Runed Jeweler's Tools
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Only the fire giants of Muspelheim know how to scribe runes capable of enhancing one's craftsmanship.

When you make a tool check using this tool, you can choose to consume one charge to add a d4 to the roll. The tool regains all spent charges when you take a long rest.

Fearghas MacAllistar.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Potion of Time Stop
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
The liquid contained in this potion never seems to move.

When you drink this potion, gain the effects of the Time Stop spell for 1d4 + 1 turns.

Time Stop

You briefly stop the flow of time for everyone but yourself. No time passes for other creatures, while you take 1d4 + 1 turns in a row, during which you can use actions and move as normal.

This spell ends if one of the actions you use during this period, or any effects that you create during this period, affects a creature other than you or an object being worn or carried by someone other than you. In addition, the spell ends if you move to a place more than 1,000 feet from the location where you cast it.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Hoarfrost Shield
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Requires attunement by a spellcaster.

While holding this shield you benefit from the following properties:

Cold Absorption. Whenever you are subjected to cold damage, you take no damage and instead gain a number of hit points equal to the cold damage dealt.

Piercing Cold. Spells you cast that deal cold damage gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs and any 1 or 2 on any of the spells' damage die are rerolled.

The shield has 12 charges and regains 1d12 expended charges when you finish a long rest. You can use the following abilities by expending charges:

Thermal Void (1 charge). Immediately after a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can expend 1 charge to activate the shield as a free action and freeze the attacking creature in place. It must succeed on a [[/save con dc=@attributes.spelldc format=long]] against your spell save DC or take [[/damage 4d8 type=cold]] damage and become &Reference[restrained] until the start of it's next turn.

Curse of Biting Cold (2 charges). You can expend 2 charges to cast Curse of Biting Cold at 4th level. You can choose to upcast this spell by spending one additional charge per additional spell level.

Otiluke's Freezing Sphere (6 charges). You can expend 6 charges to cast Otiluke's Freezing Sphere at 6th level.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Curse of Biting Cold
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Choose one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws, loses any resistance to cold damage and each time it takes cold damage from any source, that cold damage is increased by an amount equal to your spellcasting modifier.

A remove curse spell ends this effect.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for every slot level above 4th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Otiluke's Freezing Sphere
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
A frigid globe of cold energy streaks from your fingertips to a point of your choice within range, where it explodes in a 60-foot-radius sphere. Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10d6 cold damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

If the globe strikes a body of water or a liquid that is principally water (not including water-based creatures), it freezes the liquid to a depth of 6 inches over an area 30 feet square. This ice lasts for 1 minute. Creatures that were swimming on the surface of frozen water are trapped in the ice. A trapped creature can use an action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC to break free.

You can refrain from firing the globe after completing the spell, if you wish. A small globe about the size of a sling stone, cool to the touch, appears in your hand. At any time, you or a creature you give the globe to can throw the globe (to a range of 40 feet) or hurl it with a sling (to the sling's normal range). It shatters on impact, with the same effect as the normal casting of the spell. You can also set the globe down without shattering it. After 1 minute, if the globe hasn't already shattered, it explodes.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 6th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Dispel Magic - 3rd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Sending - 3rd
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a [[/r 1d20]]{5 percent} chance that the message doesn't arrive.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Activated: Rary's Telepathic Bond - 5th
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You forge a telepathic link among up to eight willing creatures of your choice within range, psychically linking each creature to all the others for the duration. Creatures with Intelligence scores of 2 or less aren't affected by this spell.

Until the spell ends, the targets can communicate telepathically through the bond whether or not they have a common language. The communication is possible over any distance, though it can't extend to other planes of existence.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Unholy Grimoire of Profanation
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
While you are attuned to this grimoire, you can cast each spell written inside as if you had them prepared. These spells can only be contained inside an Unholy Grimoire.

With your growing mastery of dark arcane arts, you're able to decipher the following spells:

  • Gravecraft

  • Life Leech

  • Speak with Dead

Completing the rituals to unlock the grimoire's secrets also reveal the following spells:

  • Withering Touch

  • Soul Cage

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Gravecraft
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You channel the forces of undeath to create one of the following effects within range:

  • You cause a corpse of a creature you can see to randomly twitch or move. For example, you can cause the arm or tail of a corpse to wave. This movement is not enough to perform simple tasks, interact with an objects, or harm a creature in any manner.

  • You cause one medium or smaller corpse or piece of a corpse to briefly reanimate and move 5ft. in a direction of your choice. After the end of this movement it returns, to its inanimate state.

  • You mend a single dismemberment such as a hand or arm, on a corpse or skeleton that you can see in range. For example, you can reattach an arm or mend a broken bone of a corpse provided the necessary body parts are available.

  • You cause the eyes of a corpse to give off dim light in a 5ft. radius for up to 1 minute.

  • You cause any remnant flesh on a skeleton to rapidly decompose over 1 minute. This process only leaves hardened or bleached bone.

  • You cause spectral whispers or voices to originate from a corpse. You have no control of these whispers as they are in language that the creature spoke in life and the word or phrase spoken is a random phrase about something in that creature's life. It may be any name of a person, thing, place, or moment from any point in that creature's life.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Life Leech
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You create a pair of dark tendrils that lash out from you at targets within range.

Make a ranged spell attack for each tendril. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage 1d12 type=necrotic]] damage and you, or one creature you choose within range, regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional tendril for each slot level above 2nd.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Speak with Dead
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You grant the semblance of life and intelligence to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be undead. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Essence Tithe
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Your mastery of forbidden magic allows you to replace costly material components with the essence of life itself. When casting a spell that consumes a material component with a specified gold piece cost, you may forgo the component and instead offer a tithe of life essence equal to [[/damage 1d10]] hit points per 25 gp of the component’s cost (minimum 1d10).

To pay the tithe, you must first choose any number of willing creatures within 60 feet. After rolling the tithe, divide the hit point damage among the willing creatures as you choose. A creature's tithe cannot be higher than the amount of hit points than it has remaining and this damage cannot be reduced or mitigated in any way. If the sum of hit points lost this way does not meet or exceed the required cost, the spell fails, but the spell slot is not expended.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Rite of Profane Power
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You can expend 1 Mythic Power and choose a school of magic to perform a profane ritual, requiring 4 hours of uninterrupted work and the corpse of a humanoid creature, which is consumed in the process. The number of such rituals you can perform each day equals half your mythic rank rounded up.

Upon completion you are imbued with profane power for the next 24 hours, empowering your ability to bend the weave of magic to your will. Whenever you cast a spell of the chosen school by expending a spell slot during this time, the spell is treated as if it were cast using a spell slot one level higher, up to a maximum of 9th level. This bonus is doubled if the chosen school is Necromancy.

The unholy nature of the ritual leaves no trace of the consumed corpse, erasing it entirely from existence.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Jump
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Using your bonus action, you can jump up to [[/r @talia.jumpDistance]] ft.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Bag of Scolding
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Wondrous item

While equipped, this bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 300 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again.

Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Plate Armor of the Litr Rune
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
The ornate decorations and runes of this +2 plate armor are covered in the scratches of many battles. A character who examines the runes and succeeds on a [[/skill his dc=20]] check recognizes it as a litr ("color" in Giant) rune that confers great power.

The armor has 10 charges, and it regains [[/r 1d4]] expanded charges when you finish a long rest. Its properties are as follows:

  • Focus of the Litr Rune. You can use the armor as a spellcasting focus for your spells. Any visible effects created by a spell cast through this armor shimmer in many different colors.

  • Flash of the Litr Rune. If a creature scores a critical hit against you, you can expend 1 charge as a free action to emit a flash of bright light. All creatures within 60 feet of you that can see you must make a [[/save con dc=20 format=long]] or be &Reference[blinded]. Any creature blinded by this effect can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns to end the effect.

  • Ward of the Litr Rune. As an action you can expend 8 charges to activate the Ward of the Litr Rune for 1 minute. While the ward is active, a barrier of translucent panels of many-colored light forms around you, making you resistant to 4 different types of damage and vulnerable to one other. The types of damage you're resistant and vulnerable to are determined randomly when you first receive the effect and at the start of each round in combat.

  • Gift of the Litr Rune. A master blacksmith can transfer the armor's magic to another nonmagical plate armor by etching the exact decorations and runes that adorn this armor into the other. The transfer takes 8 hours of uninterrupted work that requires the two items to be within 5 feet of each other. At the end, this this armor is destroyed and the chosen item gains all properties of this armor.

The wearer has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Pyrope
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Pyrope, a type of garnet known for its exquisite beauty, also holds military significance. It is believed that adorning weaponry with this garnet allows it to penetrate the thickest hides or demolish the strongest doors, aided by arcane forces.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Oil of Immovability
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: A vial of this usually contains 4 doses. As an action, a dose can be applied to the hinges of a door or chest lid, the gears of a machine, the axel of a wagon, or to the moving parts of another object. For the next 8 hours, those moving parts are locked in place. It requires a [[/check str dc=25 format=long]] to move the parts, but that usually causes the object to break first, unless it is a very sturdy object.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Potion of Mind Restoration
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: This potion cures any type of insanity or confusion, restores memories that have been altered or removed with the modify memory or similar spell, ends the charmed condition, and reverses the effects of the feeblemind spell. This potion is a clear purple that sparkles when you shake it.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Pure Wrong
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Extracted from large-sized or larger aberration creatures. This eerie substance exudes an unsettling aura, its shifting colors and slimy texture defying natural order.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Grapple
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
When you want to grab a creature or wrestle with it, you can use the Attack action to make a special melee attack, a grapple. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them. The target of your grapple must be no more than one size larger than you, and it must be within your reach.

Using at least one free hand, you try to seize the target by making a grapple check, a [[/skill ath format=long]] contested by the target's [[/skill ath format=long]] or [[/skill acr format=long]] (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, you subject the target to the &Reference[grappled] effect. The condition specifies the things that end it, and you can release the target whenever you like (no action required).

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Chain Lightning
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You release a surge of static energy that fills the air, crackling as it seeks its path. Choose a target you can see within range, and make a ranged spell attack. If the attack hits, the static energy arcs towards the closest creature within 30 feet of the previous target that hasn’t been struck by this casting of Chain Lightning. You make a new ranged spell attack for each new target. This process repeats up to three times, plus one additional time for each critical hit you score, or until there are no valid targets, or until you choose to end the chain.

Once the path is fully traced, all hit creatures are struck in a flash of destructive force, each taking [[/damage 10d8 type=lightning]] damage simultaneously. If the initial attack roll was a critical hit, each creature struck by the lightning takes critical damage from this casting of Chain Lightning.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the spell's damage increases by [[/damage 2d8 type=lightning]] and it's critical hit range increases by 1 for each spell slot level above 6th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Chain Lightning
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You release a surge of static energy that fills the air, crackling as it seeks its path. Choose a target you can see within range, and make a ranged spell attack. If the attack hits, the static energy arcs towards the closest creature within 30 feet of the previous target that hasn’t been struck by this casting of Chain Lightning. You make a new ranged spell attack for each new target. This process repeats up to three times, plus one additional time for each critical hit you score, or until there are no valid targets, or until you choose to end the chain. Critical hits on chained targets do not roll bonus damage, instead adding to the maximum chain size.

Once the path is fully traced, all hit creatures are struck in a flash of destructive force, each taking [[/damage 10d8 type=lightning]] damage simultaneously. If the initial attack roll was a critical hit, each creature struck by the lightning takes critical damage from this casting of Chain Lightning.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the spell's damage increases by [[/damage 2d8 type=lightning]] and it's critical hit range increases by 1 for each spell slot level above 6th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Black Nerium
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Clinging to the sheer faces of rugged cliffs, Black Nerium is a hardy plant with slender and completely black leaves that taper to sharp points. Its blossoms are small and deep purple, almost black, emitting a faint, spicy aroma. The stems are tough and wiry, allowing the plant to anchor itself securely in the rocky crevices where few other plants dare to grow.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Dodge
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated (as explained in the appendix) or if your speed drops to 0.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Hold Person
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be Paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Hold Monster
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[Paralyzed] for the Duration. This spell has no effect on Undead. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Greater Invisibility
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: You or a creature you touch becomes &Reference[condition=invisible] until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[condition=invisible] as long as it is on the target's person.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Grease
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point within range and turns it into difficult terrain for the duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall Prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall Prone.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Earth Tremor
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You cause a tremor in the ground around a point within range. Each creature other than you in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 1d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage and is knocked &Reference[condition=prone]. If the ground in that area is loose earth or stone, it becomes &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} until cleared, with each 5-foot-diameter portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

At Higher Levels

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d6]] for each slot level above 1st.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Greater Invisibility
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: You or a creature you touch becomes &Reference[condition=invisible] until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[condition=invisible] as long as it is on the target's person.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Raulothim's Psychic Lance
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You unleash a shimmering lance of psychic power from your forehead at a creature that you can see within range. Alternatively, you can utter a creature's name. If the named target is within range, it becomes the spell's target even if you can't see it. If the named target isn't within range, the lance dissipates without effect.

The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 7d6 psychic damage and is Incapacitated until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't Incapacitated.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Raulothim's Psychic Lance
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You unleash a shimmering lance of psychic power from your forehead at a creature that you can see within range. Alternatively, you can utter a creature's name. If the named target is within range, it becomes the spell's target even if you can't see it. If the named target isn't within range, the lance dissipates without effect.

The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 7d6 psychic damage and is Incapacitated until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't Incapacitated.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Vicious Mockery
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take [[/damage 1d4 type=psychic]] damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

This spell's damage increases by [[/r 1d4]] when you reach 5th level ([[/damage 2d4]]), 11th level ([[/damage 3d4]]), and 17th level ([[/damage 4d4]]).

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Withering Touch
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Your hands become black claws bathed in necrotic energy. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage 4d8 type=necrotic]] damage and becomes cursed for the duration of the spell. While cursed in this way, the target suffers one of the following effects of your choice, or all effects if the attack is a critical hit:

  • Curse of Impotence. The number of attacks the target can make using the Multiattack action is reduced by 1.

  • Curse of Lethargy. The target falls &Reference[prone] upon becoming affected by this spell and at the start of each of its turns in combat.

  • Curse of Fragility. Choose one damage type: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing. The target's immunity or resistance to that damage type is downgraded by one step. If the target doesn't have immunity or resistance to the chosen damage type, it is vulnerable to that damage type instead.

A remove curse spell or similar magic ends all effects inflicted by this spell.

At higher levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th. Additionally, if you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the spell does not require concentration.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Soul Cage
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
This spell snatches the soul of a humanoid as it dies and traps it inside the tiny cage you use for the material component. A stolen soul remains inside the cage until the spell ends or until you destroy the cage, which ends the spell. While you have a soul inside the cage, you can exploit it in any of the ways described below. You can use a trapped soul up to six times. Once you exploit a soul for the sixth time, it is released, and the spell ends. While a soul is trapped, the dead humanoid it came from can't be revived.

Steal Life. You can use a bonus action to drain vigor from the soul and regain [[/r 2d8]] hit points for each exploit you choose to expend this way.

Query Soul. You ask the soul a question (no action required) and receive a brief telepathic answer, which you can understand regardless of the language used. The soul knows only what it knew in life, but it must answer you truthfully and to the best of its ability. The answer is no more than a sentence or two and might be cryptic.

Borrow Experience. When you make an attack roll, damage roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can expend one or more exploits to add a +1 bonus to the roll for each one.

Eyes of the Dead. You can use an action to name a place the humanoid saw in life, which creates an invisible sensor somewhere in that place if it is on the plane of existence you're currently on. The sensor remains for as long as you concentrate, up to 10 minutes (as if you were concentrating on a spell). You receive visual and auditory information from the sensor as if you were in its space using your senses.

A creature that can see the sensor (such as one using See Invisibility or &Reference[rule=truesight]) sees a translucent image of the tormented humanoid whose soul you caged.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Shield +2
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: While holding this shield, you have a bonus to AC of +2. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Anticipate Arcana
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Your foresight gives you an instant to ready your defenses against a magical attack. When you cast this spell, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects until the start of your next turn.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Anticipate Arcana
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: Your foresight gives you an instant to ready your defenses against a magical attack. When you cast this spell, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects until the start of your next turn.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Remove Curse
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Mental Prison
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You attempt to bind a creature within an illusory cell that only it perceives. One creature you can see within range must make an Intelligence saving throw. The target succeeds automatically if it is immune to being &Reference[condition=charmed].

On a successful save, the target takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psychic]] damage, and the spell ends. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psychic]] damage, and you make the area immediately around the target's space appear dangerous to it in some way. You might cause the target to perceive itself as being surrounded by fire, floating razors, or hideous maws filled with dripping teeth. Whatever form the illusion takes, the target is &Reference[blinded] and &Reference[deafened] to anything beyond it and is &Reference[restrained] for the spell's duration. If the target is moved out of the illusion, makes a melee attack through it, or reaches any part of its body through it, the target takes [[/damage 10d10 type=psychic]] damage, and the spell ends.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Cone of Cold
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
A blast of cold air erupts from your hands. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes [[/damage 8d8 type=cold]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d8]] for each slot level above 5th.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Contact Other Plane
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You mentally contact a demigod, the spirit of a long-dead sage, or some other mysterious entity from another plane. Contacting this extraplanar intelligence can strain or even break your mind. When you cast this spell, make a [[/save ability=intelligence dc=15]] saving throw. On a failure, you take [[/damage 6d6 type=psychic]] damage and are insane until you finish a long rest. While insane, you can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and speak only in gibberish. A Greater Restoration spell cast on you ends this effect.

On a successful save, you can ask the entity up to five questions. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. The DM answers each question with one word, such as "yes," "no," "maybe," "never," "irrelevant," or "unclear" (if the entity doesn't know the answer to the question). If a one-word answer would be misleading, the DM might instead offer a short phrase as an answer.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Telekinesis
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You gain the ability to move or manipulate creatures or objects by thought. When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can exert your will on one creature or object that you can see within range, causing the appropriate effect below. You can affect the same target round after round, or choose a new one at any time. If you switch targets, the prior target is no longer affected by the spell.

Creature

You can try to move a Huge or smaller creature. Make an ability check with your spellcasting ability contested by the creature's Strength check. If you win the contest, you move the creature up to 30 feet in any direction, including upward but not beyond the range of this spell. Until the end of your next turn, the creature is &Reference[condition=restrained] in your telekinetic grip. A creature lifted upward is suspended in mid-air.

On subsequent rounds, you can use your action to attempt to maintain your telekinetic grip on the creature by repeating the contest.

Object

You can try to move an object that weighs up to 1,000 pounds. If the object isn't being worn or carried, you automatically move it up to 30 feet in any direction, but not beyond the range of this spell.

If the object is worn or carried by a creature, you must make an ability check with your spellcasting ability contested by that creature's Strength check. If you succeed, you pull the object away from that creature and can move it up to 30 feet in any direction but not beyond the range of this spell.

You can exert fine control on objects with your telekinetic grip, such as manipulating a simple tool, opening a door or a container, stowing or retrieving an item from an open container, or pouring the contents from a vial.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Otiluke's Resilient Sphere
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
A sphere of shimmering force encloses a creature or object of Large size or smaller within range. An unwilling creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is enclosed for the duration.

Nothing—not physical objects, energy, or other spell effects—can pass through the barrier, in or out, though a creature in the sphere can breathe there. The sphere is immune to all damage, and a creature or object inside can't be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside, nor can a creature inside the sphere damage anything outside it.

The sphere is weightless and just large enough to contain the creature or object inside. An enclosed creature can use its action to push against the sphere's walls and thus roll the sphere at up to half the creature's speed. Similarly, the globe can be picked up and moved by other creatures.

A disintegrate spell targeting the globe destroys it without harming anything inside it.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Tongues
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken language it hears. Moreover, when the target speaks, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear the target understands what it says.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Revivify
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature returns to life with 1 hit point. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Major Image
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. You can't create sufficient heat or cold to cause damage, a sound loud enough to deal thunder damage or deafen a creature, or a smell that might sicken a creature (like a troglodyte's stench).

As long as you are within range of the illusion, you can use your action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/skill inv]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

At Higher Levels

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring your concentration.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Darkness
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with Darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Detect Thoughts
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature—what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature's thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.

Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can't see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within 30 feet of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with an Intelligence of 3 or lower or one that doesn't speak any language.

Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be within range.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Immovable Object
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You touch an object that weighs no more than 10 pounds and cause it to become magically fixed in place. You and the creatures you designate when you cast this spell can move the object normally. You can also set a password that, when spoken within 5 feet of the object, suppresses this spell for 1 minute.

If the object is fixed in the air, it can hold up to 4,000 pounds of weight. More weight causes the object to fall. Otherwise, a creature can use an action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, the creature can move the object up to 10 feet.

At Higher Levels

If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the DC to move the object increases by 5, it can carry up to 8,000 pounds of weight, and the duration increases to 24 hours. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the DC to move the object increases by 10, it can carry up to 20,000 pounds of weight, and the effect is permanent until dispelled.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Knock
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
Choose an object that you can see within range. The object can be a door, a box, a chest, a set of manacles, a padlock, or another object that contains a mundane or magical means that prevents access.

A target that is held shut by a mundane lock or that is stuck or barred becomes unlocked, unstuck, or unbarred. If the object has multiple locks, only one of them is unlocked.

If you choose a target that is held shut with Arcane Lock, that spell is suppressed for 10 minutes, during which time the target can be opened and shut normally.

When you cast the spell, a loud knock, audible from as far away as 300 feet, emanates from the target object.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Spiritual Weapon
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You create a floating, spectral weapon that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to [[/r 1d8]] + your spellcasting ability modifier.

For as long as the spectral weapon is summoned you can, as a bonus action on your turn, repeat the attack against a creature within range.

The weapon can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular weapon (as St. Cuthbert is known for his mace and Thor for his hammer) make this spell's effect resemble that weapon.

At Higher Levels

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by [[/r 1d8]] for every two slot levels above 2nd.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: See Invisibility
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: For the duration, you see &Reference[condition=invisible] creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Silence
Fearghas MacAllistar.description: For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are Deafened while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Aganazzar's Scorcher
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
A line of roaring flame 30 feet long and 5 feet wide emanates from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes [[/damage 3d8 type=fire]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d8]] for each slot level above 2nd.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Hellish Rebuke
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

Fearghas MacAllistar.name: Spell Scroll: Silent Image
Fearghas MacAllistar.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15-foot cube. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for the duration. The image is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects.

You can use your action to cause the image to move to any spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking.
