Fearghas reports to the advisor to the king of Lessia (the king is nowhere to be seen) that the party delved into the mausoleum of Thamdarul to remove the undead general. The advisor nearly swallows his tongue at the news, and requests proof. He pulls a corpse from his bag of holding, as evidence. It's the corpse of Drakar Zul, the undead general and servant of the Lich.

The advisor fails to find words, asks Fearghas to put away the body, and goes to find the king. This is clearly far above his pay grade. A ring of dwarven guards surrounds the door the regent leaves through; they are very serious about their job.

The advisor, Mordram, returns with the king, who remains behind an honour guard of 30 dwarves. He thanks Fearghas for getting rid of the undead general, and announces the feast will also be dedicated to the party.

We leave the king's hall, and a giand Aviana waves at us. As if she was not TOWERING above everyone present. She proceeds to apologise for the rudeness. She has been speaking with the captain of the guard, Torgrus. He appears very tired, for some reason…

Shalkoc is ravenous, and Aviana goes on about her glasses. Fearghas is pleased by the outcome, somehow. Aviana thought I was a child, due to my very small size. I am offended. She is simply too tall!

As Mordram said quite clearly that Fearghas smells (he indeed does), Linzi recommends walking to a clear lake outside the gates to take a bath. Shalkoc is unwilling, and would rather kidnap a glassblower. Nobody wants to let Aviana stomp to the lake alone.

We all go to the lake. Shalkoc jumps into the cold water, Aviana opens a bottle, and Fearghas begins to scream. Shalkoc then gets out of the water, in a sense, and walks on it to the shore. Aviana says this is how he swims. Fearghas admits he doesn't know how the big lizard is doing it.

It turns out, Aviana freed an invisible Haunt and we are all flailing trying to catch it. I use my wand to cast Detect Magic, it does not help at all. We eventually have to give up and accept it flied away. Fearghas has a lot of words with Aviana, none of them friendly.

Shalkoc picks up a skeletal finger and begins to wave it around. I can sense necromantic energy in it; he casts False Life on himself and is very pleased with it. Linzi is happily taking notes, claiming this book will sell like crazy. I can see it. I can feel Fearghas' nerve weakening.

We walk back to Lessia and Fearghas explains about the giant rock floating in the sky. This is their island, Promise. I struggle to comprehend all of this…

The feast begins, and the king makes a speech. At this moment, a telepathic connection opens in my mind, and my boss, the Drow matron Vandree, tells me to explain why the undead army was routed, what is going on in Lessia, and what I've heard. I report with as much information as I am able, fearing for my life, my heart sinking into my socks as I am betraying Fearghas' home even as he sits right beside me. I ask whether the Drow will attack now, and before I can get a reply, the connection ends. I blink and come back to my senses, feeling sick. The king is nattering on about the people of Lessia and their courage, his gratitude to Fearghas… I am considering excusing myself, but I do not dare.

Fearghas whispers to me that the king is corrupted by a dragon's eye! The captain of the guard comes to Fearghas and whispers that a dwarf is here to see him and it is urgent. Fearghas gets up to leave, and I leap on the excuse to go with him, to leave the throne room. We meet with Barrik, who reports to Fearghas about the situation with the Duergar.

Lessia's mines are very close to Ukgluz, the Duergar setting I've come from… For years there has been an agreement between Lessia and the Duergar that they do not mine closer to one another. Recently however, orders have come from the king of Lessia to dig the other way. He MUST have known he would find the Duergar. Two or three weeks of digging found the Duergar, and the incident happened. We suppose the dragon eye is what caused the king to grow aggressive and seek to expand his territory.

As we discuss this, we hear a hollow roar coming from just above us! (I squeaked out of character, everything is fine.) A command rings out in everyone's minds; "Give back what was stolen!" We rush out to see a massive skeletal dragon carrying an undead man with a staff.

Fearghas and Aviana Windwalk to the gates, and Shalkoc sprouts a pair of wings, grabs me despite my screaming, and leaps into the air. 300 feet up above Lessia, I feel his grip slipping a little, and start apologising to my mummy and daddy. Somehow, he does not drop me.

We immediately start fighting the two undead figures. The dragon has a sickening bilious aura, and the Skull Lord teleports them both, it bites me because I am small (the audacity!), inflicting acid damage. We struggle, Shalkoc punches, the dragon starts destroying Fearghas. He is bleeding and within an inch of his life! Heedless of the risks, I rip my wards from my wrists and channel a heightened spell. I cast heal at 9th level, leaving Fearghas with barely a small cut.

Aviana tackles and dragon and drags it underwater, but it still beams its necrotic breath at us, Aviana dodges most of it but it hits me with full force. Fearghas shoots the Skull Lord several times with a Scorching Ray. Aviana is teaching the dragon to swim, for some reason.

We defeat the Skull Lord, and the Black Deathdragon, by shooting Shalkoc and having him deflect the missiles onto the dragon. Aviana emerges grumbling about poke-eyyyy-mons, and chucks the corpse of the dragon onto the shore so that Fearghas can start chopping it up.

Aviana carries the corpse of the dragon into Lessia, which is swarming with guards looking for Drow. The king's honour guard is blocking the entrance to the throne room. As we approach, the king leaps out and accuses Fearghas of being in league with the Drow, and having stolen the eye of Dahak! Not just that, but also to have lead the undead army against Lessia!

We tried to reason with the king. We tried everything. He is having none of it, and our only option was to be stripped naked and cast into prison to face "justice"… or resist. Fearghas put an end to the pointless argument, told his king he was ashamed of how low he had sunk, and teleported us all out of the throne room. We arrive in Locus on Promise.

pages.name: 70 - So, we ran
pages.content:
After being accused by the king of Lessia of controlling the undead army, Fearghas refuses to put up with any more of that nonsense, and teleports us all to their flying island, Promise. Wait… me too? What about Linzi? We can't leave her behind!

As we materialise, there is a sound of metal falling, and Plex appears, trying to carry three full sets of plate armour, and failing. He takes a tumble and has a grumble about carrying all this. (Thank you Domi for the pipes falling sound, peak immersion.) Aviana offers ME Linzi's job, but I decline saying we must go back for my Halfling friend. Plex claims he traded the dead body that was inside one of the suits of plate armour while he was in the Feywild. Fearghas and Aviana are trying very hard to get him to say what he got in exchange for the body.

Plex traded the body of a dead dwarven hero for the freedom of his goblin friends Antrx and Prantx. He said it just in time to stop Fearghas from having a seizure. I'm not sure if I could heal that, definitely not with my wards on. Shudder…

We argue about the morality of eating and selling people. Could I heal myself if I had a seizure? I feel like I might find out, after hearing Shalkoc's arguments about selling organs. We also discuss what to do with the undead dragon's corpse, which Aviana is still lugging around like it's nothing.

Aviana contacts Linzi with a spell gem of Sending ("the rock from the Hell Lady"), and tells her to return to Promise. Linzi replies that she is hiding in the mines of Lessia with Barrik. Fearghas contacts Barrik with his own Sending spell, asking what is going on and whether Barrik needs picking up. Barrik replies that the king has started forcefully arresting people, and he fled with other people towards Ukgluz.

Fearghas turns into a cloud and skedaddles off to the mines of Lessia to teleport Barrik and his party to Promise. I slump on a couch inside the cabin, trying to recover from the whirlwind I have been swept into, when Aviana yells to me about dwarven smut stories, and Plex is looking for a sharp rock. Shalkoc is going up to his hoard to stow the dead undead dragon there. The dragon whom we sharply reminded of its own demise. Shalkoc wants it, for some reason. Aviana is looking for tools to make a tiara… for… me? Out of jade and dragon… bits? One of Shalkoc's scales? And a brick? She seems to struggle immensely, I somehow feel like Fearghas is here with us, shaking his head.

Aviana fumbles her crafting, and asks Shalkoc for further scales. I have a feverish image in my head of a harpy attemping to pluck a dragonborn like a chicken. In my defense, it is one in the morning, I have survived a battle and been teleported to a floating island, and feel I am starting to lose my wits.

I make some tea, and try to convince Plex to partake in a relaxing brew, but he sneaks off to town rambling about paint and gambling. He ignores my pleas about going to bed, and gets stopped at the gates by a guard who is convinced that our goblin is drunk. Plex attempts to explain that he lives in the forest, and much like Shalkoc earlier on the topic of selling people, or parts thereof, he only mires himself deeper. The guard leads him to the barracks to sleep off the assumed ale. Plex sneaks off, and wakes the entire town as he raises an alarm.

I give up looking for him and curl up on the couch to get some rest. I've slept much worse places. In the last week even. At least the couch is indoors, it's warm, and I assume the likelihood of being woken by slavers, or abyssal horrors, or why not both, is about as low as it's been ever since Edgar's shady friend dropped me off on the coast of Erastrea.

While I sleep, Shalkoc drapes a blanket over me without waking me, because he is very sneaky. How nice! But then Aviana goes to the town, growing huge again as Plex's Microscopic Proportions spell wears off. Predictably, she scares everyone out of their minds as she stomps around, a giant in the middle of the night. She claims it was just a test to get people accustomed to giants, as there is a trade agreement with, well, giants. She runs into Plex, who is still looking for paint. At this point I assume he means to fill his little lungs with the fumes, just for the funny feeling.

Even in my troubled dreams, I miss Fearghas' common sense.

Speaking of Fearghas, he is struggling to find Barrik and his party, having been to the mines very seldom. He is taking a long time finding his way, and has to cast Wind Walk again. As he does that, a wild magic surge hits him, teleporting him to the elemental plane of water. He drops into a deep, dark ocean with no prior warning. Does a cloud feel wet? This one certainly does, and grumbles healthily about wild magic.

I suddenly get upsetting dreams of Fearghas sinking in bubbling darkness. There is no way I am waking well-rested from all of this. He chuggs a potion of Water Breathing, casts Mordenkainen's Magnificent Mansion to escape the water (and sounds of whales and… ghost leviathans?? Aerelia I know you are going to read this, are you a Subnautica nerd? Great game, I cannot for the life of me play it. Not enough brown pants. Anyways. - Haven't played it myself but I've watched multiple lets plays. Let's just say I'd find playing the game myself very boring because I wouldn't dare venture past the shallows…), and then teleports back to Locus, from where he flies back, in cloud form, to the mines of Lessia to "find those fuckers".

"I will pitch you like a baseball." - Aviana, 1497

And she does in fact, chuck the goblin and jumps away, landing in a massive explosion due to her cursed Thunderfeet Footwraps… Realising that jumping was a poor decision, she walks back to the cabin. She still cannot enter it due to being massive. She tries to cover herself with a dozen tiny (for her) blankets. I could probably wrap myself up in just one of these blankets like one Halfling maki roll.

Fearghas finally finds Barrik's party, they wonder why he is drenched but he clears it up with Prestidigitation. Even this much magic is terrifying to dwarves of Lessia, but Fearghas promises it's going to be all right, that magic is not scary. (I press X.) He works hard at convincing them that TELEPORTING is not scary magic. It takes one full hour, but props to ya, Fearghas. They all appear in Locus at dawn, and make their way to the cabin by morning.

I am woken by a completely exhausted Fearghas and many dwarves; he offers a room for me, and shuffles off to his own room to sleep. We meet up around three in the afternoon and go down to the living room to discuss what the hell we do.

I confess to the party that I am a spy for the Drow. Fearghas is angry, but he believes me and understands that I had no choice. I try to explain exactly how strong the Lady Vandree is, but I am no scholar, and can only relate what I've seen. Aviana suggests making friends, or fighting! Are they taking this seriously? When the matron comes for me on Friday, our lives will be on the line.

Fearghas proceeds to google my boss cast Legend Lore on the Matron of House Vandree. The spell only brings isolated words; exile, revenge, ambition. He then directs the spell to the Eye of Dahak; it is as expected an artifact of immense power.

We decide to go down to Ukgluz, and try to prepare for a confrontation with the Drow matron. Fearghas gives me a spellgem of Nondetection to shield myself from the matron's scrying spells (I assume that is what she is using to find me), and he places in his breast pocket one spellgem of Revivify, and a diamond that can be used to cast Raise Dead, in case one of us dies. Sadly he does not have a black sapphire, so I remain unable to summon my Umbral Spirit.

Aviana is considering which spirit to be blessed by, Fearghas is muttering about spells and gems, Plex suggests casting Death Ward on me. We are trying to figure out how to find the matron. I give as much information on the Drow as I can; the matron doesn't usually participate in combat, her three consorts are also powerful spellcasters, and the fighters are the backstabbing kind, or the shooting from afar kind. They are not keen on taking risks, as they aren't versed in healing magic.

Shalkoc flies off to find an ally of the party's, a spidery Drow lady called Kali, with very unsettling eyes. Fearghas casts Comprehend Languages because Kali speaks Druidic. We learn that House Vandree was led by twins… so my boss, the one who does NOT have the scar on her left eye, has a twin sister. One of the sisters was pronounced dead some years ago, but rumour has it that she was still alive. That is probably my boss. Kali giggles and says "You have no idea who you are dealing with, do you?", and tells us that House Vandree specialises in assassinations, and that their contracts are very expensive.

Plex wants to use me as bait, to draw the Drow party out and beat them up. I do not think that's a good idea.

The longer the conversation with Kali goes, the more concerned I get… House Vandree has immense power, and even an exiled matron is more powerful than I can imagine. I suspect that trying to fight her will get us all killed, or worse. Kali suggests we go to the Abyss and hire a DEMON to help us. (IRL my heart went cold at that.) Aviana tries to give to Kali a pristine white dress of an angel, bought in Hell. Kali is not terribly keen, considering the lack of pockets. I'm just sitting here white as a sheet at the talk of demons and angels. Eventually the memories haunting me are too much, and I am violently sick.

Fearghas decides to Wind Walk to Ukgluz and try to find my boss. However, we first stop at Fearghas' parents' shop to pick up supplies for a potion of heroism. Sneakily. As we hover over the shop in cloud form, we see one of the king's honour guards exit and walk away. The shop is closed and dark, but Fearghas' parents are nowhere to be seen. The house bears no signs of struggle, like the couple simply left. In the shop, many of the alchemical tools, and most of the ingredients and potions are missing. Fearghas collects the few remaining ingredients.

We head to Ukgluz, take a break for Fearghas to brew us potions of heroism, as Shalkoc whips up some rice balls to snack on. Plex casts Death Ward on me. Feeling as prepared as we'll ever be, we float above Ukgluz. It looks a lot more impressive from above, despite extensive destruction from boulders falling from the ceiling. Now… our campaign against the exiled matron of House Vandree begins.

pages.name: 71 - Brave underground adventures
pages.content:
As we camp outside of Ukgluz and Shalkoc wraps up rice balls, Fearghas contacts his father with spellgems of Sending. As he opens his bag, the thing blurts out "You're the loveliest hag in the coven." His father is alright, though imprisoned, and Fearghas tells him he is trying to find a solution. Family love.

Plex and Aviana argue, grapple with each other, and both disappear. Fearghas sighs heavily, "we do not have time for that". Indeed we do not, but Plex teleporting another person is a new thing. Fearghas asks about my wards, I do my best to give an explanation, but leave out exactly how crippled I am without them. It's not a matter of trust, really… call it an expression of hope. We exchange quick information about our respective abilities. I cast Augury to consult the omens on our looking for the Matron, the results come up mixed; weal and woe. Well that is ominous.

We float down to Ukgluz in cloud form. It's an industrial place, all rough black stone. Soot from furnaces thicken the air. The city teems with slaves supervised by Duergar. There are many statues… The city looks very different from above. The walls are heavily guarded by more Duergar with glaives. (something about chaos dwarves and a war hammer, but none of us is using such a heavy weapon, how very odd!)

We float to the hospital, where I am known and hope to find some help, then we make for the morgue to transform out of cloud form without being seen. Fearghas and me are sneaky, but Shalkoc stumbles. In cloud form. How he manages that is beyond me. A Duergar accidentally inhales a whisp of Shalkoc and coughs. I am a horrified little cloud. The Duergar definitely notices a strange cloud, and alerts others. Shalkoc does his very best cloud impression, it seems to convince them as they laugh and walk away.

The coast is now clear, so we /uncloud in the morgue. There are three bodies covered in shrouds, and not much else. Shalkoc wants to disguise himself as a doctor. I say we should probably leave before somebody finds us living people in the morgue, and that the dead won't tell us much. Shalkoc disagrees and uses his little finger (well, Dam'ghur's little finger, which is now Shalkoc's, so Shalkoc's Little Finger Formerly of Dam'ghur's) to cast Speak with Dead (and that's a surge). Fearghas establishes a telepathic bond between the three of us.

Shalkoc begins to question the three dead bodies.

S: How are you today?

Dead: Cold.

S: Huh must be very cold being dead then?

Dead: Yes.

Shalkoc is enlightened by this and concludes that it must not be very nice to be dead. Fearghas sighs even as Shalkoc continues with the question "Why are you dead?". They reply in turn "work accident", "defending Ukgluz", and "throat slit by a knife-ear".

Fearghas tries to get Shalkoc to ask better questions, especially from the assassination victim.

S: Where?

Dead: The shrine of Azgal.

S: How to get there?

Dead: Walk.

And that's his five questions from the assassination victim. Fearghas makes sure nobody is coming our way. I say I worked with Thorkam Burnbleeder and we could look for him. Shalkoc further enquires from the other dead about the way to the shrine, and gets somewhat usable directions.

Fearghas makes Shalkoc and himself invisible so they can follow me undetected as I look for Thorkam. A guard approaches me, limping down the hallway with his glaive. He asks me where I come from, I reply I returned in a hurry because I need to speak to the Matron. Something with the guard seems… off. He is hiding something. I try to pry, but do not want to behave suspiciously and let him be on his way.

Shalkoc tries to grab the Duergar, losing his invisibility in the process. (8 strength but he rolls a nat 20, you can't make this sh*t up). The guard screams. Fearghas screams too, in our heads: RUN! Shalkoc sprouts his wings and flies off.

The mental image of Shalkoc flying into a random room, and ending up face to face with a MAD old Duergar lady threatening him with a hairbrush yelling SAAAAAAATANA. No this is not personal experience, ha ha.

None of the above happens in game, our Dragonborn escapes and Fearghas pretends very hard to be a potted plant, unseen, unheard. The Duergar attempt to arrest me for "collaborating with the knife-ears". I think to Fearghas: NOW we run. He breaks invisibility, and casts Dimension Door to teleport us to the roof of the hospital. Shalkoc is hiding in the morgue. Fearghas calls him to fly up to the roof, he lands saying "WHEW that was scary!". Both of us proceed to tell him off, and we then turn back to cloud form and hover towards the altar (the shrine of Azgal).

Fearghas picks up some of the words the Duergar are speaking; something about a scepter being stolen. We hover as clouds and brainstorm. It is not going well. Fearghas does some cloud shenanigans, casts Comprehend Languages, and eavesdrops on the priests at the shrine. It turns out that Dimzad, the king of Ukgluz, is furious that the scepter has been stolen, and in the name of all Duergar, he has declared war on House Vandree. Dimzad has sworn to execute all of House Vandree, especially after an unsuccessful attempt at dialogue, and an emissary now missing a tongue.

We decide to seek an audience with Dimzad, which may be a terrible idea, but it's better than blindly scouring the Underdark looking for the Matron. My very important job is to keep Shalkoc from doing anything stupid as Fearghas walks up to the very surprised king's guards and claims (in Common) to have information about the stolen Scepter of Azgal. He asks to speak to the king.

Fearghas is allowed to come in, under heavy guard, arms over his head at all times. If he makes the smallest misstep, he will be killed on the spot. Can clouds sweat? This small cloud is sweating so much, it might be raining. The darker cloud that is Shalkoc next to me seems to be sniffing the air in hopes of food smells, but all we pick up is ash, soot, and sulfur. If a cloud could wrestle another cloud, I would. I just frantically think at him to stay next to me.

Dimzad is one massive Duergar, who is intrigued that Fearghas is not an emissary, and working against the king of Lessia. He demands to know how Fearghas knows that Matron Vandree stole an artifact. Fearghas is struggling to explain himself, being very careful with his words. He claims he heard rumours, and reveals that the "Matron Vandree" the Duergar are hunting is the exiled twin sister who is my boss. The king grumbles about surface dwellers not knowing honour; an oath must be kept no matter what.

Dimzad asks Fearghas what he has to offer. Fearghas replies "a Halfling who was enslaved by the Drow". I think "haha, yeah" at that, and Fearghas mentally lifts an eyebrow at me. The king wants to imprison me in the deepest dungeon, and is surprised when Fearghas refuses, and says I am under his protection. The king does not want to let me run free (supposedly I am too useful), but Fearghas, bless his heart, insists that I should be free. Dimzad wants to put me in chains, use me as bait, fire on the Matron (and me) when she comes, and if I live, enslave me to work in the hospital again. Fearghas says it's too obvious a trap and it won't work because of my magic, and Dimzad casually says he can put me in antimagic chains. I start to scream in panic, in Fearghas' head (and Shalkoc's).

The king asks what artifact was stolen from Lessia. Fearghas honestly replies "it's the eye of a dragon". The entire room GASPS (even the walls I am sure; they tend to have ears so why not a mouth too, really). Dimzad is very interested. He asks Fearghas why he wants the eye of Dahak. Fearghas says he wants to inspect it in the hope to cure a curse. Dimzad is way too interested in the eye (and in the Halfling, that is me, supposedly the head doctor at the hospital spoke highly of me). All of the Duergar are deeply confused as to the simple notion of letting a healer run free…

The king does not believe that Fearghas and his group could deal with the Matron. (I don't blame him honestly.) For us to prove our strength, he tasks us with removing (he says the word "close") a nearby hindrance… a portal to the void. If we can manage this, Dimzad will help us. (Shalkoc is trying to puzzle out how that "help" will fit into his dragon hoard.) Fearghas agrees to deal with the portal in exchange for the Duergar's help to deal with the Matron.

We discuss the void portal. Fearghas assumes it connects to the Far Realm, and reveals that Plex:

  • "acquired" a Demilich

  • found a void portal and started to communicate with it

  • was requested to make a sacrifice to the portal, and chucked the Demilich into it

  • asked for a friend in return for giving up the Demilich

  • was promised a friend, but the party closed the portal

I have no words.

Fearghas wants to go fish Aviana out of the Feywild so that we can go deal with the void portal. I suggest scouting and researching first, because picking up our harpy from the Feywild is going to take a lot of magic. The portal is VERY close by, just an hour's walk from Ukgluz. We float there as fart clouds to investigate. As we travel, Fearghas and Shalkoc fill me in on how they are BOTH contracted to devils of Hell.

Fearghas assures me that I do not have to help him, or Shalkoc, fulfil their contracts. But I saved Fearghas' life, and I may be a strong healer, but I am not strong enough to watch a man I've healed, who has helped me, dive into deadly danger. I also admit my other reason to stick with him; if we are fighting demons, I am IN.

We arrive to an encampment of Duergar that are keeping watch on the void portal. We has proof that King Dimzad sent us here; a hat he gave to Fearghas, similar to the hat the king is wearing, but much smaller. We /uncloud at the bottom of stairs, to the sound of very heavy boulders being rolled. Fearghas reluctantly puts the hat on. There are ballistas around the camp, pointing at the… stairs? As we approach, the Duergar turn around, look at us, and Fearghas casts Compregend Languages. The Duergar say in Deep Speech "The unbelievers have come for us!". In the distance, heavy steps approach…

We roll initiative. The camp is also full of large, rolling stone creatures (granite juggernauts). I spring into action first, and try to restrain the nearest one with Binding Shadows, but they resist my magic. The eyes on these things are burning, but also blacker than night, a darkness so deep it seems to shine. (I snap at Aerelia at this, of course.) My spell has failed, and I very bravely hide behind Shalkoc, who rushes to the thing and punches it very hard. Shalkoc tanks like a boss with Turtle style, but also punches the juggernaut some more, for good measure. The juggernaut charges Fearghas, but our dwarf is too tough for the monster, stopping its charge. (bonk)

One of the ballistas shoots at me, but I am too smol! As Fearghas is distracted by the stone construct strangely… nuzzling… him, an iron golem stomps up the stairs and comes to nuzzle Fearghas on his other side. He is deeply uncomfortable. I get shot by another ballista, successfully (and painfully) this time. A chain is attached to the bold and it drags me across the floor as I (bravely) yell "eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeelp". The same happens to Fearghas, with considerably less squeaking.

The next ballista shoots an explosive bolt at us, Fearghas has sick dodges and I am just out of range (phew). Fearghas summons a spiritual weapon to hit one of the juggernauts; the wheels slip out from under it and it crashes to the floor. It would be very funny if the iron golem wasn't looking at me like I'm kindling in the middle of winter… I free myself from the ballista bolt and try to run, but it has higher reach than I thought and slices me on the way out. I quickly heal myself but it only begins to knit my wounds.

Shalkoc bravely turtles to the golem and spits breathes on it. It does not work out great. One of the Duergar went invisible at some point so eeeeh… we don't know where he is. Shalkoc gets a major surge that makes all our potions useless. The golem punches him hard, then turns around and slices me with his sword (natural 20 aaaaaaa). It hurts a lot, and I am badly injured. Shalkoc punches half-heartedly, making very little progress. Fearghas gets harpooned again. The Duergar are running around repairing the ballistas. One of the Duergar tries to run, falls down, and breaks his neck. Less work for us…?

The bag of scolding savagely roasts Fearghas. He slaps a Curse of Biting Cold on the iron golem; Fearghas makes sure to shout to Shalkoc about the effects of that curse. He then shoots all of five scorching rays at the closest juggernaut (pew pew). He teleports himself out of the ballista bind like a boss, and bravely takes cover behind a pillar.

I'm hurting, bleeding, and afraid… I intended for a healing spell on myself, but for a moment the shadows guide my hand, and I direct them to the golem and the closest juggernauts for a Shadow Monsters spell. It works! I take cover behind the golem, cast a healing word, and then watch in awe as Shalkoc punches the hell out of the golem… with his fire gauntles… which would normally heal it. I crouch (bravely of course) behind the golem, and the next ballista shot misses me.

Fearghas magically and bravely shoots at everything. Go Fearghas! The juggernaut I hit with Shadow Monsters just rolls over the iron golem, absolutely flattening it. I frantically heal myself, popping sorcery points like candy. I want to take cover but I got hit and grappled by the braglista (the bragging ballista that insists I am a tiny fairy) so there is no way to wriggle free just now. Shalkoc goes to spit breathe COLD on the juggernaut and the very flattened iron golem. He also punches really hard again. What a lizard!

Meanwhile I am still getting repeatedly shot like I'm a plump little duck. Through multiple severe piercing wounds, I grit my teeth and hold on to my concentration with all my might. Fearghas tells me to get closer, that they shoot at the farthest target. Fearghas shoots at things once more, and tries to be the target for the bolts. I'm bleeding heavily; in barely controlled panic, I stumble to Shalkoc, free myself from the grappling bolt, and remove my wards to heal myself. It drains me, but the pain begins to fade.

Shalkoc rushes in, but as a deep stab wound opens on his body, a Duergar with a glaive appears next to him, invisibility spell shattered. My wards are on the floor and my body feels slow… I need to get to Shalkoc! The golem spews poison at Shalkoc, who appears completely unaffected (all the same, I squeak a little bit). Fearghas begins to rapid fire at the ballistas once more, getting frustrated at how poorly they burn (despite being made of wood). Aerelia is a little sheepy because he gave them lots of HP.

Shalkoc is barely standing in the middle of enemies. I take out my onyx dog figurine and throw it to the floor, yelling the command word AMBULANCE! Dwen the Rock appears, I hop on his back and we run towards Shalkoc. My spellwards all but forgotten, I reach out to apply a juicy Healing Word on him (7th level). It takes a heavy toll, but Dwen steadies me.

The Duergar hits Shalkoc, and he is enlightened by this. "Nah," our Dragonborn says with a dominating smile, "let me show you how it's done." He can now crack a whip as well as Jill. Who's Jill? Don't worry about it. He takes an attack like a champ to punch back; the Duergar does not get back up. Fearghas is hanging out at the back, protected by a Shield pierced by dozens of ballista bolts. He tries again to cast Fire Bolt, fails again as his armour hampers him. He is fiercely grumbling.

I move in, still riding Dwen, and fire (haha) a Cone of Cold from my staff, and heal myself… almost to full… because my max HP has been lowered so much. Shalkoc continues punching, invigorated by my healing. Fearghas grits his teeth as he dashes and loads up a Ray of Frost that finally goes through, and deals a number on the golem, but it still stands. He commands his spectral axe to slash at the golem, getting it square in the chest. A black sapphire tumbles out! I limp to pick it up.

We made it… Shalkoc and me are injured and I'm shaking from the channeling fatigue, but Fearghas is mostly grumbling with GREAT conviction due to his armour's arcane failure rate.

pages.name: 72 - A rainbow goat and other abominations
pages.content:
Just as the fight ends, Plex and Aviana appear in a flash of light. Plex is riding a screaming goat surrounded by rainbow light. We start trying to figure out what is happening, when a man walks up to us, telling us to be quiet. His hair is white and his eyes are purple, very unusual colours for a human… He gives the name Emilio and tells us to shut up the goat one way of another. Fearghas is trying to make ANY sense of the situation, with very little success. Shalkoc slaps the goat, Plex ties a piece of yarn around the goat's neck and casts a spell, which stops the goat dead in its tracks, hanging from the now-immovable yarn. Plex flies off the goat's back, pulls a backflip in mid-air, and makes a perfect landing in front of the goat. He is standing halfway into the tent, through the tent really. A surge made him able to pass through walls.

I very tiredly ride Dwen in search of my spellwards, which I let fall during the battle. Emilio says the portal is extremely dangerous and needs to be closed right now before anything (more) steps out of it. We try to discuss the goat, and what to do with it, which is very difficult to do over the goat's screaming. Aviana argues that the goat is a political agent in treating with the Feywild, and that it MUST survive. Fearghas and Emilio ask that we please leave the goat behind. Plex is feeding scraps of tent canvas to the rainbow goat, which is trying to strangle itself on the immovable yarn. There is talk of another goat inside the iron flask.

We decide to rest for a moment before taking care of the portal of impending doom. Fearghas explains to Aviana and Plex what happened while they were in the Feywild. Shalkoc cooks a re-hydrate streak for himself, a burger for Fearghas, an eyeball-looking cake (??) for Aviana, and a recovery dumpling for me. Our harpy lady tries to give Emilio a cute nickname. He is not keen.

Fearghas asks for clarification about what happened in the Feywild. Aviana "explains":

  • Plex made friends with goat people

  • People in the Feywild get extremely drunk

  • Aviana lifted a big rock, there was a goat underneath

  • The rock goat was scary, it stepped on Aviana, Plex used a gate to launch Aviana into the air

  • The Fey people gave Plex and Aviana the rainbow goat as a sign of thanks

  • The rock goat is still in the Feywild, and is very angry and Aviana and Plex

  • Plex teleported into the forest and found a lantern goat (our rainbow screaming goat)

  • Plex claims the rainbow goat is a party-saver and his friend

Shalkoc wants to cook the goat, predictably.

Emilio is extremely overwhelmed by all this noise we're making. I try to soothe him, offering a cup of tea, or a chance to pet Dwen. Then Aviana tries to put the rainbow goat in chains. Plex and Aviana try to convince Fearghas to teleport the goat to Promise. He refuses, also predictably. Aviana begins to apply nail polish.

The goat stays behind.

Then Emilio says time is up, and we need to go. We go towards the portal, chugging various potions on the way. The air grows thick with purple mist as we approach. Translucent chains connect to the portal, on either side of a chasm filled with purple smoke. A scream sounds in all our minds; the others recognise the Void Dragon. Misshapen creatures pour out of the portal, along with a wave of void energy. Acid washes over us, Fearghas and I brace for it just in time, but the others get hit full force. Thankfully (?) I have experience taking acid to the face (maybe Fearghas too?). Plex looks at one of the monsters; it trips over its own claws and dies. One down! That was easy.

I step forward, riding my dog into battle. Brandishing my staff, I throw a fireball at the creatures, frying two on the spot (Chokers). Looking at the anchor for one of the chains, I see it is covered in runes. It is sturdy, but if it is hit JUST right, it will shatter. Emilio investigates the chains, after muttering that the runes are in Deep Speech. The chains are tangible enough to be held… therefore probably pulled… therefore probably yanked out of the portal. Emilio just… points, and blasts the insect-like creature (Wardu) three times, with incredible force (haha).

The big spiky creature (Otyugh) speaks to us in our minds… it projects images of an enormous purplish dragon covered in eyes. Plex then teleports himself to the portal with an Arcane Gate to get a good look. He does not get a good look. He still peers into the portal, and he does not understand what he sees. He's left feeling confused, afraid, and incredibly small and insignificant. Our goblin decides to step back and hide. We can clearly see his efforts.

Shalkoc accidentally steps through Plex' Arcane Gate, looks at the portal up close, and turns to the side real fast-like. He boosts himself with a scale, then spits breathes on the Otyugh. Aviana chugs a potion and becomes massive again. Possibly because her eyes are so big now, she can see the anchor a lot better, and concludes that they can be disabled instead of destroyed. She yells at Plex to turn off the magic thing. Fearghas steps through the Arcane Gate. He gets a really good look at the portal, and theorises he can overload that, which could damage it, and possibly destroy it if he were to throw enough magic juice at it. He can't rule out an explosion, but he says we will call that "plan Bee". I don't see any bees around here…

Emilio argues that portals are unstable by nature, and slapping more magic into it probably isn't a good idea. Fearghas then further investigates the anchor, looking for a way to disable it. He puzzles out the Deep Speech, and disconnects one of the chains from the portal. The portal… calls… for help. Plex' portal does not answer (we checked). More little shites come through. I knew it wouldn't be that easy…

The portal unleashes another wave of acid. Emilio is hit hard, and Dwen whimpers and reverts to his figurine form. A lot more creatures step through the portal, and last of them, an ominous, staff-bearing abomination scuttles out. That's another fireball. It fries up all the little things, but the scuttling thing (Warped Seer) dodges it. I try and fail to disable the anchor. Emilio tries too, but he is short on the brain juice. He fires at the Wardu but only one beam hits.

The Otyugh crawls up to Aviana, clearly impressed by her muscles. Chomp! But Aviana dodges the bite. She slaps the Otyugh's tentacles away. The aberration sends images to her mind of… rule 34?! Which confuses Shalkoc, our sweet summer Dragonborn. We move on. The Warped Seer scuttles over to Shalkoc and whacks him very hard with his stick. Shalkoc is severely injured and knocked prone… then the Seer hits him again. He goes down and does not get up again. The Seer then walks away and melts into the ground.

The flying tick (Wardu) looks at Emilio crosswise, then stabs me. Twice. Emilio is deafened by the Wardu's stare. Plex teleports Shalkoc closer to me. He's still not moving, and a wave of acid is coming up… Contrary to Aviana's belief, he CANNOT "take it". Aviana rages and stampedes into the Wardu, which is knocked back and pretty much lands on Emilio. She proceeds to do it again. She then grabs one of the chains (it feels slimy) and yanks it out of the portal. Fearghas walks up to another anchor but he is pushed back, returns to it grumbling, and gets pushed back again. His grumbling intensifies. He smothers it with an extra large potion of healing, just before a new wave of acid rolls out. More enemies appear, including a translucent, purple, humanoid… thing.

Shalkoc, if we survive this, you BETTER bake me some honey cakes. I take off my wards and summon what little strength I have left. Nobody is prepared for the burst of healing I unleash on Shalkoc; he springs to his feet, back in top shape. Emilio fires his lasers at the Wardu and it pops like a disgusting blood balloon. He tries to disable the anchor and fails, but suffers no bad consequences. Things are slapping Aviana. Things are slapping Fearghas. The Seer scuttles through the portal to Emilio and me. Plex! Help us! Any bright ideas are welcome!

Plex rescues teleports me across the chasm, and makes the Seer smell like feeeeesh fish. He tries very hard to shove the Seer off the edge with telekinesis, sadly the scuttling bastard resists it. Plex tries to disable the anchor, but fails and is pushed back. He immediately runs back to stand right in front of the Seer. Shalkoc punches the Seer, but he uses his reaction to swap positions with another voidborn… THE BIG PURPLE FUCKER. Shalkoc is unimpressed and punches on, stunning the hulking aberration. He continues to punch! With conviction! So much conviction! But then he tries to yank the chain out, causing it to reverberate. The disturbed chain radiates necrotic energy, hurting us all.

Aviana walks past one of the Otyughs, it bites at her leg, but she is unflinching! She casually continues to walk, dragging the aberration with her, teeth still clamped on her leg. She strides toward the Seer, ignoring minions. She grabs a Wardu and holds it in front of the portal. The Wardu gives her a judgemental glare. She is unfazed. Fearghas tries once more to disable his anchor. This time it's a success! Three more Otyughs crawl out of the portal. Fearghas conjures up one massive hand, then teleports closer to me with a Misty Step.

The portal expels another acid wave, but Aviana blocks it alone, protecting us all. She stands right in front of the gate… and she can just make out the shape of the void dragon rushing towards us. I heal Plex, then myself, and I try to disable the anchor, but fail. I take psychic damage and get knocked back. Emilio blasts the Star Spawn Hulk (the purple fucker), and also attempts to disable the anchor, but no luck.

Aviana has a lot of "friends" over there. They're scared of her. I would be, too. Shalkoc punches the Wardu with a Leaden fist; somehow it does not die on the spot. Then he runs off to help Aviana, who very much needs it. Aviana disregards the portal, and rushes to help us instead. Things slap at her on the way, to little effect, until one of them does… radiant damage?! That hurts. She juiced up on a potion of speed, so she reaches us, still holding the Wardu. She reaches into her pack and… throws a bedsheet… "full of Plex stuff" (wooden chicken statues)… across the chasm. The statues come to life and all peck at the anchor with their tiny knife beaks. They destroy the anchor, and a bunch of scuttling Seers appear, along with four Hulks.

Aviana squishes the Wardu for good luck, but it drips disgusting fluids all over her painted nails. With a warning for Plex, she yanks the chain out of the portal… but a force pulls it back. Something beyond the portal is holding the other end of the chain… She says she needs both hands and chucks me the Wardu. As she pulls the chain harder, claws and a snout appear through the portal, hanging on to the chain and trying to drag it back. She is doing a tug-of-war with the void dragon. She asks Emilio for advice. He says we're too late, that the dragon is coming through either way.

Detaching the chain from the anchor might be our only hope… Aviana hits the anchor, destroying it. The chain fades, and Aviana stumbles then catches herself just in time, very short of crashing into me. (That might have killed me, too.) The portal closes! But the voidborn remain…

The Wardu Aviana squeezes looks at Plex… menacingly. He's worried about his chickens. Aviana asks Emilio to pick up Plex' chickens. Shalkoc gets yoinked teleported into the middle of the voidborn. One of the Seers fires an orb onto one of the Hulks… it is healed, and reverberates the damage to everyone around it… Fearghas commands his Bigby's Hand into the fray and make it grab Shalkoc with the intention to chuck him towards us. We are trying to get the hell out of here. I use my last sorcery point on a twinned Guiding Bolt, bursting one of the Wardus. Emilio is trying to pick up Plex' chickens while Fearghas is yelling at him to leave the chickens.

Emilio… teleports? across the chasm. With a tiny void portal. The party's trust for him plummets. Plex already laments the loss of his chickens. I argue that he can't have chickens if he is dead. He is unconvinced. Shalkoc kindly casts Cure Wounds on me. It's weak sauce but I appreciate the gesture. Shalkoc tries (and fails) to pop the last Wardu. He goes into Turtle Stance just to be safe. I appreciate this gesture even more because I no longer have the strength to scrape him off the floor. Aviana gives the Wardu a good squeeze, sadly still not enough to pop it. She then jumps over the chasm to go get the chicken statues… The shockwave from her Thunderfeet shatters seven of the chickens. Plex might be about to cry.

One of the Seers is catching up to us and blasts Plex with three Psychic Orbs. In reaction he activates his Abjurer's Bangle, absorbing most of the damage. Another Seer fires at Plex; he crumples to the ground. The next Seer shoots, this time at me. It hits hard, but I keep my footing. I need to help Plex! Fearghas makes an Arcane Gate to the other side of the chasm, and says we are leaving. Plex… I rush to his side and heal him, and hesitate before running through the gate. Plex, Shalkoc, and Emilio are still on the other side…

Out of nowhere, tentacles burst out of the chasm, grab one of the Hulks, and drag it down into the purple smoke. An unfortunate event… for him, not for us. Emilio attacks, then runs into the gate. Plex casts Thunder Step, teleporting him and Shalkoc across the chasm. Aviana opens the iron flask, releasing a horned humanoid (it's a Leshen, we all recognise it). Aviana speaks friendly words in Sylvan. The Leshen turns into a flock of crows and comes for us. It casts a Wall of Thorns, Fearghas promptly pops a Counterspell gem… it does not work out. Emilio casts Counterspell. To everyone's relief, it works. The Leshen casts Grasping Vine, which lashes out at Emilio. He is pulled towards the vine.

Emilio is hit by three Psychic Orbs, and goes down. The Leshen hits me, triggering Plex' Death Ward. Fearghas apologises to Shalkoc, as he is out of range of his teleporting spell. "Meet us back in the mines of Lessia." Shalkoc and Aviana are fast enough to run and meet up with us. They will have to be. We appear in the tunnel overlooking Ukgluz. Fearghas hands me a healing potion, and feeds another one to the unconscious Emilio. Plex is still mute, but he tries his best to communicate.

We sit in the dark tunnel nursing our wounds, waiting for Aviana and Shalkoc… and hoping.

pages.name: 72 - Summary
pages.content:
A rainbow goat and other abominations

Plex, Aviana, and a screaming rainbow goat appear. A man with white hair and purple eyes tells us to be quiet, that includes the goat. We try several things to shut up the goat, including a piece of immovable yarn, with very little success.

We take a short rest, eat some food, and discuss:

  • the goat's political importance in the Feywild

  • the void portal of impending doom

  • another goat, angry, and in the Feywild

  • goat people (I'm sure this will not come up again)

We leave the goat behind and go to the cavern where the portal is. The ground is split in two by a smoky purple chasm. The portal is held open by five chains, anchored on either side of the chasm. The void dragon screams in our minds (that's rude) and the portal spits acid at us (no manners!).

There are some void critters, Plex kills one just by existing. I start to grill the rest of them, with great efficiency! I don't like this... it's too easy. Aviana seems to agree, she drinks a potion and becomes very big again. We figure out various ways to close the portal, including one that seems very unwise (overloading the portal with a lot of magic).

More monsters appear, these ones are intelligent and one of them beats Shalkoc senseless. Emilio is shooting beams, Aviana is charging, and Fearghas is grumbling trying to disable the anchors. I heal Shalkoc with such force that he springs to his feet without a scratch on him. (My upstairs neighbour has kindly been made aware of this.) Plex makes one of the Seers smell like fish. Aviana blocks an acid wave from the portal, holding a Wardu for emotional support (the Wardu's, not her own).

The more anchors we disable, the more monsters appear. Aviana throws Plex' chickens at them, then she plays tug-of-war with the void dragon, and nearly yanks it out of the portal! Emilio is pessimistic about the outcome, I don't blame him. Turns out he has void powers too. The plot thickens. There are a lot of Seers now and they are killing us real fast-like. We manage to close the portal, but there are now way too many abominations for us to handle. Fearghas says we are leaving, he makes a gate to take us across the chasm so we can run back to the cavern we came from. Plex is struck down by the Seers. I scrape him off the floor.

We eventually all get across the chasm, but Aviana has the bright idea to once more open the iron flask. An Ancient Leshen springs out and proceeds to beat us the hell up. Fearghas uses a spellgem to teleport us out of here, but he can't catch Shalkoc and Aviana into the range, so we tell them to meet us in the tunnel overlooking Ukgluz. We teleport there, all severely injured and Emilio unconscious. Fearghas feeds him a healing potion, and gives me one so I can feed it to myself (not in this order).

Now we just hope our friends can find us again.

pages.name: 73 - A strong neck can rule a nation
pages.content:
Aviana and Shalkoc escape arrest by the Duergar by… Shalkoc flying up, with Aviana inside the iron flask. They leave the Duergar to deal with the Leshen, and Shalkoc flies up to the tunnel where we had been huddling for about three hours. We've had a short rest, and Plex is no longer mute. Shalkoc releases Aviana from the flask; she is grimacing with a terrible headache, and is in a vile mood. After a few words from Plex, she again grabs his neck, and both of them disappear. Fearghas attempts to explain the process to Emilio, he does not seem very enlightened.

Shalkoc is very out of breath from flying all this way, so Fearghas casts Leomund's Tiny Hut as a ritual, conjures up Unseen Servants, and we set up camp in the tunnel. The bag of scolding grills Fearghas, we take a long rest. Shalkoc cooks up an impressive amount of bacon, egg, and sausage, helping everyone feel alive again.

We discuss our plans, the voidborn, and whether Shalkoc could conceivably feed all the void invaders to appease them (not likely). Motivated by Fearghas' enthusiam (and reluctance to burn a 6th level spell slot first thing in the… evening? We slept the day away), we walk down to Ukgluz. Many of the statues in Ukgluz are severely damaged, scratch marks like those left by giant claws. The hospital seems to be overflowing with wounded soldiers, most of them with broken bones like they've taken a big fall. Some look like they've been bitten by a swarm of mosquitoes. I ask the party if they know what kind of creature could do that. Fearghas says a spell could do that; Insect Plague.

We assume all these wounds occurred in the Duergars' attempt to capture the Leshen. :')

Fearghas asks for an audience with King Dimzad regarding the void portal. We are ushered in by excited guards who did not expect we would survive. We are all impressed by the strength of the neck on King Dimzad, supporting the massive hat on his head. He greets Fearghas, surprised and pleased to see him, congratulates him on the… use of his slaves (that's us). The Leshen apparently destroyed several of the Duergars' demon engines; they eventually caught it, but it's proving troublesome, "like a demon but not quite". Shudder…

Fearghas explains that the Leshen comes from the Feywild, but that he doesn't really know any more about it. Dimzad wants to get his hands on Aviana (alive or dead) to try to bind the Leshen. He does not seem to understand that Fearghas can't just sell him Aviana. Dimzad claims that the more emotional a demon gets, the easier it becomes to bind it. I'll keep that in mind… The king is pretty convinced that the Leshen is a demon and not a fey creature.

Fearghas reminds Dimzad that there was an agreement for assistance in fighting the Matron Vandree, but the king tries to backtrack and say that closing the portal only proved that Fearghas is "worth serving him". Fearghas guesses that Dimzad is just saving face in front of his court and not actually trying to short us. Phew… Dimzad and Fearghas proceed to have a very uncomfortable conversation over my head about training your slaves, and keeping me from escaping. The king suggests a chain of null-steel, and promises to gift one to Fearghas.

On the way out, Fearghas mutters that he hates Duergar. Shalkoc replies that we should deal with them once we are done with the Drow. I am shaking at the thought of anti-magic shackles. Emilio is brooding. One of the king's servants comes to us carrying a very heavy chain that looks like it's covered in soot, despite being clean. Fearghas receives advice to "bind the Halfling with that". He examines the chain with great interest. I am definitely uneasy. Fearghas? We are friends yes? We're at least allies?

Fearghas casts Detect Magic on the chain; it is non-magical. He knows that it inhibits magic, but does not understand exactly how, yet. Fearghas leads us into an alley out of sight, and casts Mordenkainen's Magnificient Mansion. It is an impressive dwarven mansion, with a cohort of servants that look like clockwork constructs resembling dwarves. Fearghas formally welcomes us in, and Shalkoc makes a beeline for the larder that is bursting with ingredients. Emilio and I are confused as to how anyone can casually cast a spell of such proportions. He's not wearing spellwards! Let alone taking them off!

One of the rooms is a "hall of grudges". A dwarven thing, Fearghas says. Don't worry about it. There are three categories in the hall, alphabetically ordered: A, G, and P. I wonder what is written in there… We start discussing magic and its various origins. Emilio says his magic was forced upon him, he is not comfortable with explaining. Fearghas says that wild magic surges did not always happen, that they appeared a long time ago, from the Feywild "bleeding" into the material plane. He also says that infusing spells into gems can bypass the wildness of magic.

Fearghas is still curious about the null-steel chains, and asks Emilio to bind his wrists with the chain. On the point of touching the chain, Emilio recoils and takes a few steps back. I offer assistance, but Emilio declines. Fearghas asks Shalkoc to bind him instead. It's a cold burn on his skin, and he grows tired and unfocused. He is not comfortable. Shalkoc winds the chain around his wrists, and does not seem to mind the cold touch.

I agree to have the chain put on me… for science. It's a little bit like my spellwards, just a million times more intense. Familiar, if uncomfortable. As I examine the chain I realise… the one dark spot on one of my bracelets is the exact same colour as the chain. I freeze, mind racing. Shalkoc and Fearghas kindly ask if I'm okay, but I start stammering that I need to know HOW these chains are made. I can't stop myself from shaking and praying that my suspicions aren't true. Concerned, Fearghas suggests that we look into it right now. I agree, trying very hard to keep my emotions together and mostly failing. We go back to Ukgluz in a hurry to figure this out.

We go to the market looking for a smithy. Looks like the Duergar eat a lot of fish from the many many lakes in the Underdark. A Duergar comes up to Fearghas wanting to buy Emilio. Fearghas politely declines. Emilio looks even more grumpy than usual, especially as the Duergar insists… Fearghas asks how the null-steel chains are made. The Duergar says they are regular steel chains, that are brought up to the priests in the temple, and the chains come out soot black and much stronger. I do not like where this is going…

Fearghas casts Discord call Rary's Telepathic Bond so we can communicate discreetely. I am questioned about my suspicions regarding the null-steel chains, and I reluctantly admit that I suspect the Duergar are using the blood of angels. I show my stained spellward to support my claim. Fearghas is intrigued, and Shalkoc assumes I have killed an angel. I can't find any words in response to that… Emilio wants to ask around about more voidborn, or another void portal. A frightening perspective. I wish our big and strong harpy was with us.

Shalkoc suddenly… claims that "we are working on it". Zariel just contacted him and asked how they are doing. He winks at me. I am so confused. He shares Zariel's messages with us, demanding to know Shalkoc's progress on their contract, and details. Shalkoc claims he met someone who kills angels. He means me. Now Zariel wants to meet this "angel-slayer" within a week. It's not a question, it's an order.

At the party's prompting, I confess that I killed an angel. I was trying to help, I did not mean to. Emilio tries to cheer me up, with little success. Fearghas says that we can't blame ourselves for circumstances outside of our control. If only their words could make the nightmares end… I clutch my staff to remind myself that even a stained soul can be forgiven. It will not make the nightmares end. Shalkoc just takes it in stride that I am an angel-slayer, and we can keep Zariel waiting before sending me to Hell to meet her.

We go browse herbs for Shalkoc who is looking for seasoning. Fearghas grimaces as we walk into a shop (something about "a bunch of snake oil"). The shopkeeper is doubtful about letting slaves in, but Fearghas insists. The lady shows us a very dubious brown mould… which I'm sure is some kind of body part… very much not fresh… She offers to let Fearghas sniff it. Shalkoc is enthusiastic and speaks up about wanting to smell it. Out loud. The shopkeeper is SHOOKETH at the lack of control Fearghas has over his slave… She then opens the glass right under Fearghas' nose. He downplays the absolute reek of the stuff with all the dwarven sturdiness he can muster.

I recognise glowworm root, that wriggles and glows in contact with air. It's edible and nutritious, if not pleasant. There is also a fungus called barrelstalk… drinkable, as they store a lot of water, but they taste like very stale, very mushroomy flavour. On Emilio's behalf, Fearghas asks the shopkeeper if she has seen any unusual creatures when she was out gathering plants. She claims some larva-like creatures near a nearby lake have been unusually large. Fearghas enquires about the deeprot (the brown mould) and its uses. He buys a portion for 15 gold, and she saws off a piece of the growth, scrapes up the mould, and hands it to our alchemist. She claims it's great for freeing up clogged sinuses. I am doubtful.

Fearghas mentions he is an alchemist and the shopkeeper begins to stammer. She was scamming us was she not… She says she has to close down the shop now. The apothecary very nervously closes down her shop. She did mention that the miners use the deeprot, and also the priests. We walk to the lake some miles away. It's relatively peaceful, for the Underdark. The water is very still, and on the shores grow bioluminescent lichen. As we walk up to the nearby shore, we smell something disgusting. The plants on the shore look mutated, leaves growing out of other leaves like cancerous growth.

We find the larvae mentioned by the apothecary. They are massive, and also mutated, growing into one another in a chaotic and twisted manner. Fearghas says there is something "fucked up" here for sure. Emilio doesn't sense anything void-y. Shalkoc argues that the larvae must be full of protein. Fearghas absolutely vetoes the idea and investigates, finding a faint trace of transmutation magic in the mutated things. It seems to be coming from under the lake. Fearghas hands out potions of water breathing. I can't swim, so Fearghas says "take my hand". We all drink our potions and jump into pitch-black water.

We lose all sense of up or down in the absolute darkness. Emilio seems to be able to see… just fine? For the rest of us, the colours are gone, so he updates us on the fish's weird colours. The fish are looking at us weirdly, some with all three of their eyes. We swim deeper down, pressure building on my ears the only indication that we are farther from the surface. In the distance, a bright light flickers. Fearghas is guiding us towards the source of the transmutation magic he sensed. We can't really gauge direction or distance from the light source. Is it moving? We can't tell…

We approach carefully, all too aware of the tactics of anglerfish. Emilio spots first the tips of multiple spikes, unevenly spaced, rising from below us. He says they look like quills, like they are part of something bigger. As we come closer, it's a full forest of them, about half a metre in diameter, growing to a very sharp point. D-do they look like needle-sharp teeth…? The light source we saw from afar is actually a tiny fish swimming in a circle, with a luminous growth on its head.

We give the glowing fish a wide berth, and swim on downwards. Emilio glimpses something moving in between the big spikes. I finally remember to use magic to enhance my vision. Out of the corner of my eye, I spot the end of a tentacle between the spikes, retreating out of sight. I stammer "k-k-krakeeen!!" in the telepathic bond, which seems to amuse Fearghas and Shalkoc. We spot a flat white surface below us; as we grow deeper, we see it's a brine pool. We swim closer to it but stop short of it, oh goddess I hope we survive this.

We spot more spikes, these looking more metallic and a bit rusty. These spikes are not attached to, but sticking through a surface… around the spikes is scar tissue… very old scar tissue, wounds that have healed and re-opened over and over again for years. I imagine this wall of scars in front of us is an ancient creature, and a very large creature that has been suffering for longer than I can imagine. We pick a direction at random and follow the wall, hoping to find a head or a tail. Fearghas swims down into the brine pool, promising to go back up immediately.

He swims back up a good 30 feet away from where he dove. There is a current in there. We follow the direction of the current with the idea that one person dives into the brine pool now and again, tied to a rope so we don't lose them. We figure out the rough shape of an immense flattened blobfish. At the edge of the brine pool, the skin of the creature becomes flat and glassy, a giant eye mostly immerged in the brine pool. The eye is so huge we cannot see it all. Multiple spikes are piercing the eye… we can see into it, the needles pierce all the way through. The outside wounds have closed, but on the inside, the wounds are a lot worse. We could squeeze along that spike into the body of that thing… there seems to be light inside.

I tell the party about what I think is torturing the creature. Sibriex. I show them my memories of an angel endlessly tortured. Clinging to sanity, I tell them that this is my problem, that I cannot let this demon live. We decide to go into the creature and attempt to end its suffering. As we are about to go in, the giant fish begins to shake as if in pain… This creature is alive, and it's being tortured. As it moves, the spikes tears bigger wounds in the tissue surrounding them. Shalkoc is leading, and squeezes through the opening with a squelching sound, and he disappears from sight.

A chilling thought occurs to me then. What if it was not a creature being tortured? Not a fish pierced by spikes but something that was never an animal in the first place. What if this was a space shaped by a demon? A Sibriex' lair.

pages.name: 73 - Summary - A strong neck can rule a nation
pages.content:
Shalkoc flies away from the Duergar with Aviana in the iron flask. She is not happy about this, and when they meet up with us in the tunnel, she tries to strangle Plex, and both disappear to the Feywild. Again. We set up camp in the tunnel with the use of magic and grilled sausages.

We return to Ukgluz where many soldiers have been wounded in capturing the Leshen. Fearghas obtains an audience with King Dimzad, who is surprised to see him return alive, but more friendly than last time, and very forthcoming with (unwanted) advice on how to handle his slaves (that's us). There are some casual mentions of how to bind demons (shudder), and the "demon engines" the Duergar are using. This definitely is just an edgy name of no actual significance. Has to be. Right?

Fearghas requests a day of preparation before going to war with Matron Vandree. Dimzad agrees, and gifts to Fearghas a null-steel chain to better control his slaves. Fearghas invites us to his beautiful 7th-level mansion, and we have tea and investigate the null-steel chain. Emilio is particularly bothered by it. For Fearghas and I, it uncomfortably inhibits magic... and the chain's colour sends me into a panic as I suspect it's been made using the blood of angels.

Don't ask me how I know.

They ask me how I know.

Shalkoc assumes I have killed an angel.

Words fail me, surely this will have no consequences.

The party agrees to investigate the process of making the chains. We return to Ukgluz, ask around, learn that the chains are regular steel which are then treated in secret by priests, and no one is allowed in to see the process. Oh. No. Somewhere on the way, Shalkoc gets a ~~Discord ping~~ Message from Zariel checking in on his progress. Shalkoc replies that he has found an angel-slayer (HE MEANS ME) and Zariel orders him to present this person to her before the end of the week. Well this escalated quickly.

We can't figure out a way to spy on the priests yet, so we go to an apothecary for Shalkoc's needs of tasty herbs. We ask the apothecary if she has seen any unusual creatures, as Emilio insists the voidborn will return.

The Duergar just love to tell people how to handle their slaves. The apothecary scams us with foul-smelling "mould" (I'm convinced she chopped that off a rotting corpse somewhere) and mentions larvae larger than usual by a nearby lake. Fearghas freaks her out by saying he is an alchemist, and we walk to the lake.

Nature is twisted here, plants and larvae mutated, but Emilio doesn't sense the touch of the void. It reminds me too much of a certain demon and I grow increasingly anxious. Fearghas detects transmutation magic coming from inside the lake. We chug potions of water breathing, and jump in.

After a good half-hour of nerve-wracking swimming in darkness, and glimpsing tentacles among sharp pillars, we reach a brine pool and a fleshy wall pierced with long metal spikes. It looks like a huge, ancient creature being tortured. Reluctantly, I tell the party about the Sibriex lair I was in. I give them as much information as I can, including telepathic images of half-organic corridors and twisted creatures, but my courage fails me at the end.

We follow a current to a giant eye, also pierced with spikes. We can squeeze in... we don't talk very long before deciding to go in. The party is intrigued, but my conscience will not let me walk away. This thing is so close to a city full of people... slavers, yes, but people nonetheless.

Wait... the Duergar use "demon engines"? What if this big creature was *not* a giant tortured fish? What if the close proximity with Ukgluz is deliberate? I am filled with dread at the strong suspicion that we are... intruding into the lair of a Sibriex... that is *working with* the Duergar.

pages.name: 74 - AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
pages.content:
As Shalkoc disappears inside the Sibriex lair (?), Emilio turns around and sees Aviana appear, with one hand around Plex' neck and the other hand holding… a screaming goat, making a lot of bubbles. Shalkoc sticks his head through the opening at the base of the spike, and signals that the inside is dry. We follow him in. Aviana asks about the goat, arguing that it was going to be a sacrifice. Fearghas rolls his eyes, and promptly roasts the goat with a Fire Bolt; "we don't have time for another goat." He pushes me through the opening; I collide into Shalkoc who smelled the roasted goat and wonders what is cooking.

We eventually all slip through the opening, in the residual smell of soggy goat curry. The tunnel we are in is damp, uncomfortably warm, walls glistening and pulsating. It smells like a constitution save… we hold our noses in disgust, but Plex and Emilio don't look so good. We hear an androgynous, gentle and caring voice in our minds telling us: I felt your arrival, like soft whispers in the æther. Fear not the crossing; you are safe now within this hallowed realm. Emilio is very angry at this. Something about enough voices in his head…? I tell the party to not trust it, that the demon is trying to get us to let our guard down. Fearghas agrees, and hands me a vial of silvery powder… He does not say what it is, only urges me to consume it as he hands a similar one to Emilio.

Aviana explains that Plex acquired a goat hat, and the curry goat that Fearghas murdered. She also says that she and Plex could not save the kittens in the Feywild from the red caps, and that we have to return there to save the kittens. Fearghas hands the null-steel chain to Aviana, who goes on a tirade about king and why we should all settle for bondage instead. Plex pulls out his thinking cap, a Headband of Intellect in the shape of a goat. Aviana grabs the headband with the plan to reforge it into thinking glasses.

Fearghas asks me whether the Sibriex has mental powers. I say yes, though I can't be entirely certain. He uses a spellgem of Mind Blank on Aviana. Plex no longer detects her with Detect Thoughts. She is no longer a thinking creature as far as his spell is concerned… He then recasts Rary's Telepathic Bond to include Aviana and Plex into the connection. Plex casts Fey Step, ignoring Fearghas' warning against teleporting in here… He takes a step up… and thinks to us that there are enemies next to him. We can't see or hear him. I summon my Umbral Spirit, Fade, and tell her to find the goblin. I also heal Emilio to cure the poisoning incurred when he stepped into the lair.

Aviana steps up to me and says proudly "Look! I can do magic too!" She says some gibberish words, then casts Death Ward on me! Fearghas is incredibly proud. Plex is being attacked by humanoid creatures that… look like they used to be people. Some bits swapped, a messed up jaw, and psionic shullbit. Fearghas considers breaking through a wall to get to Plex, then evaluates the thickness of the wall, and reconsiders. He sees something up ahead, and is in turn seen by it too. It's a swarm of maggots, and something invisible. I miss my mum and dad…

Shalkoc runs past Fearghas into the left branch of the tunnel. He sneezes on the swarm of maggots, like only a Dragonborn can, burning them all like popcorn. Delicious… Something lashes back at him, and he is stunned. Fade runs down the tunnel, attracting unwanted attention. She does not find Plex, and blends into the shadows, turning invisible. Plex casts Ashardalon's Stride to unleash fire on the maggots, but a wild magic surge turns him tiny. He picks up popped, not burnt, maggots.

Aviana congratulates Emilio on being the most sensible, least aggressive member of this party. Plex glimpses an honest-to-gods ABOMINATION, bloated with a second head that is nothing but a gaping maw. I very frighteningly sidle close but not too close to a big lump of wall-flesh… Bits of it seems to be chewing… I don't want to know on what… I inhale the silvery powder Fearghas gave me, trying all the while to look everywhere at once. Aviana chugs a potion of growth and becomes big again.

Fade is hit by a psychic ray from a Walleye, but the charm has no effect. Plex is getting attacked by something bitey but he's so small he dodges… once. On the second bite, he is swallowed by the Bloater. Plex uses his gift of the Gem Dragon to push it back, inflicting minor damage. He is still inside the thing, swimming in stomach acid. Fade runs back to where I was to report, as I don't share her senses… but I do feel what Plex is feeling and it's not fun.

Plex blasts the Bloater from the inside with his magic, hard enough to be spit out. Emilio buffs himself somewhat uselessly, but who knows what the future may bring? He joins Shalkoc by a pile of dead maggots. The Bloater dashes towards Aviana, this waddling thing as big as Aviana. It's aptly named… it's so full of fluid, the skin is tight and it makes sloshing sounds. Disgusted, I focus my magic at it and fire a Guiding Bolt! It hits real hard, and I leave Aviana to deal with it as I join Shalkoc, Emilio, and Fearghas. The latter is grumbling at something and flailing with his axe. A wild magic surge makes him explode-y.

Aviana is highly disgusted by the Bloater and dreads getting vomit on her new dress. She enters rage and slashes at the Bloater with her talons, tearing it open. Fluids spill all over her. She is deeply disgusted. I don't blame her. Plex is considering the benefits of being eaten again, even though he is already in a rough shape after the first time he was snacked on. He is bitten by the second Bloater, swallowed again, and uses a MYTHIC FEATURE to convince himSELF that he is not blinded in there. I'm screaming in the telepathic bond because I feel his wounds, and he will die if he is exposed to the stomach acid again. He beholds the wonders of the inside of the Bloater's stomach with eyes open. If we did not need the telepathic bond for a petty thing like SURVIVAL, I would nope out.

Fearghas enquires on the state of the Bloater. Aviana says it's probably almost dead; I squeak that it is still very much moving despite leaking fluids everywhere. Fearghas sends a barrage of Magic Missiles towards it. This is how he figures out that there are two of them; because Plex is broadcasting the inside of a Bloater through the telepathic link, and no impacts happen. Shalkoc is punching another monster (the one with a very altered jaw; Obscuroth). As he kills it, Shalkoc hears a voice in his mind again. Almost motherly, it says: I sense your confusion, and it is alright. Many souls arrive still carrying the shadows of conflict. But that creature… it was just another soul, like you, perhaps a little lost in its own way. Let us try a gentler path to understanding. When he shares the message into the telepathic bond, I feel sick… and increasingly angry.

Fade runs towards the slashed Bloater and leaps out of the shadows to bite it, before fading into the darkness once more. Plex barely survives being digested by using his Abjurer's Bangle. He throws an immovable spear into the Bloater's stomach, then gets out by using Fey Step. Emilio blasts maggots and another invisible Obscuroth. He then also hears something in his mind and shares it to us: Please, children, there is no need for such harshness in this place of healing. Let understanding be your weapon, not violence. Healing?! I'm going to MURDER this thing! Emilio blasts the Obscuroth all the harder; it responds with a Psionic Rebuke, but Emilio saves.

I slap a Chill Touch on the Bloater, but it's not enough to kill it. I back off just before Aviana slashes it again; it collapses and explodes in a burst of acid. Aviana goes down the right-hand tunnel and finds… a cloud of magical darkness. She decides to CHARGE INTO IT. She hits a flesh wall, and attacks the darkness. A Walleye spots her, and fires a Psychic Ray at her. She resists the charming, and continues into the darkness. Plex is calling out in the telepathic bond… none of us knows where he is. I'm sticking with my friends and letting Fade scout.

One of the Obscuroths attacks Emilio, breaking invisibility. He reacts with a Hellish Rebuke, frying it where it stands. Shalkoc… catches… a Psychic Ray… and tries to slap a Bloater, to no avail. He dashes, slaps again, but his hand only meets a wall with a disappointing wet sound. Fade takes some acid damage, shakes herself to get rid of the acid, and runs up almost to Aviana. There is a Walleye there, it casts Darkness, nobody can see Aviana anymore. There is also an Obscuroth there, but Aviana scares the wits out of it. That's how we figure out it still had wits of a sort. Knowing that does not help in the slightest, because it indicates that there is maybe a person enduring in the monsters…

Plex casts Maelstrom, trapping Shalkoc in it while the Bloater escapes the spell almost unscathed… The Dragonborn exclaims "What the hell? I'm coming to save you!" I call out to Plex and try to find him, but in my haste I run right into the line of sight of a Walleye… The Psychic Ray hurts, but I resist the charm. I asked Emilio to stay close to me, he confirms he will follow. Aviana shouts out to me, but she is not in the telepathic bond and I'm too far to hear. She swaps her Spirit Beast's Blessing to Tiger. She pokes a Walleye, then grabs it. She jabs her thumbnail into the eye, making it lose concentration. The darkness disappears but Aviana still can't see a thing.

Another Psychic Ray shoots out of the wall; I ignore the pain, barely keeping concentration, and resist the charm with all my might. Fearghas tries to find Aviana; why did we split up agaaaaaain?! He blasts an Obscuroth with a Ray of Frost, then laughs at it magically. "You've got a face like a burst kebab!" He says, dealing psychic damage. Shalkoc takes damage from Plex' Maelstrom. We take care of one another in this party… Shalkoc delivers a bonk on the Bloater with enough force to stun it, then punches it a lot more for good measure.

Fearghas points out an enemy for Fade. She crits her bite, but doesn't manage to kill it, and fades (haha) into the shadows again. The invisible monster hits her hard in response; she is very close to dissolving into darkness. Plex drinks one repulsive potion to heal himself (it's snot), then casts Sapping Sting on the Bloater. I step right up to the edge of the Maelstrom and throw my +2 dagger at the Bloater. It hits! The monster still stands, barely.
