Aviana squeezes the Walleye she is grappling, piercing it with her talons. It's still not dead, so she jumps in place, causing one massive blast from her Thunderfeet Footwraps. It hits her too, and she yanks the eyeball out of the wall.

Fearghas once more laughs at the invisible Obscuroth, which barely fails to kill it. "Naami, your cat's got this," he says and walks away. He finds Aviana, who chucks him the eye she ripped from the wall. Shalkoc is still unable to escape Plex' spell. This is getting embarrassing… Shalkoc goes into the centre of the Maelstrom to punch the Bloater to death. It explodes, but Shalkoc dodges the acid blast. Turns out, Fade hasn't got this. Her bite misses, and the Obscuroth kills her. My poor Fade dissolves into dark mist.

Emilio launches three blasts against the Walleye that'd been hitting me every turn, but it reflects one of them onto me. It hurts… but I can finally see Plex! Heedless of the cost, I extend a hand towards him… the magic takes my blood to fuel a healing spell. I don't care. Plex' wounds are healed, and a voice speaks in my head: Such selfless acts are the very essence of Nirvana. You bring joy to this tranquil place with your innate kindness. You understand already. I am livid… but suspicion begins to sneak in. Is this the demon speaking, or is it something worse?

Aviana runs past me, and attracts the attention of the Walleye. Emilio asks me for permission, but he won't say what for. I yell at him that this is not a time to keep secrets. Fearghas backs me up, but Emilio refuses to speak. I'm very upset with everyone except Fearghas. Emilio is hit by the Walleye, and reacts with a Hellish Rebuke. Aviana hears something come towards us… something huge, stomping with meaty sounds. Emilio stammers that it's bigger than Aviana. The monster (Major Malleable) grabs her; she calls Shalkoc to come help. Plex casts a spell of Detect Thoughts to try to locate the enemy, but the range is too short. Plex is eating the maggots again… he convulses, and collapses, unconscious. Uncontrolled terror blinds me for a second, my mind flooded in memories and overwhelming dread. Do I even dare healing him? What if…

Emilio blasts the Major. I run to Plex and examine him… he is afflicted by a form of madness that will last 8 minutes. A spell of Calm Emotions or Lesser Restorations can cure this! Just as I figure this out, a spellgem begins to glow in Plex' pocket, reanimating him. I yell at him as Aviana dares him to eat another maggot. I heal some of my own wounds, but my magic feels weak, my hands are shaking. I don't think using healing magic on Plex would have harmed him… but the dread that overwhelmed my mind for a moment is not entirely gone. It will get worse. I need to get a grip.

Aviana flexes and makes her cloak billow. Only Emilio sees this because of the magical darkness. She grabs the Major and drags it out of the darkness. She jumps with it, landing in a blast of thunder. That monster is not only huge… it's amorphous, with organs that don't belong in their places… I've seen the like before… I have seen… I see Aviana's wounds, and all my fear returns in a rush as the Major attacks her and grapples her. Half of her wounds would kill me.

Fearghas chugs a Potion of Maximum Power, and casts Scorching Ray. Three powerful rays of flame hit the Major. Shalkoc repeatedly punches the Major, and realises it is completely immune to acid damage. Plex casts a level 7 Tether Essence on Shalkoc and Aviana. They willingly fail the save, letting the spell take effect. Emilio pummels the Major with three blasts, exploding in purple clouds. The misshapen creature collapses and dies.

Finally, the chaos ends… for now. Fearghas begins to cast Leomund's Tiny Hut as a ritual… and the voice speaks up in our heads again: Yes, pause and breathe in the tranquility, dear ones. The transition from the River to the boundless peace of Nirvana can be… intense. Rest is a balm, and I am here to offer comfort and guidance. Fearghas grumbles that this demon is weird. Aviana casts Find Traps and says that the walls are traps, the floor is a trap, the ceiling is a trap… everything around us is a trap of confusion, disorientation, madness, acid, suffocation, poison, infestation with maggots, exhaustion, blindness, and losing the ability to escape.

Aviana requests Plex to bite her. I draw my dagger and threaten her with it, telling her to sit still and let me heal her. The voice tells us: Please, try to be calm. Such reactions are echoes from the world you left behind. Here, in Nirvana, all spirits are to be cherished and guided with kindness. I snarl at it to shut up. Shalkoc casts Cure Wounds on Aviana, which pleases the voice. Plex bites Aviana. Fearghas starts violently scolding Aviana and Plex, with good reason.

We attempt a short rest, and heal up. Fearghas pulls out his void explorer spellbook. Emilio glares at it for a second; his hands twitch and he struggles for a moment, then transforms into his Void Form. The white of his eyes go black and the bandages on his hands burst open, revealing wicked claws. Eldritch energies spark around his claws. Plex freaks out and pushes Emilio away and out of the bubble with his telekinesis, knocking him prone in the bargain. We question him, but he growls that this is his real form, and there are more important matters to take care of.

As Emilio is thrown out of the hut, he sees that the hallway behind us… looks nothing like it used to. Shalkoc begins to cook an eyeball cake for Aviana, with very little concern. Our wizards figure out that teleportation and planar travel do not work here. We're trapped.

As we settle down to rest, the voice speaks again: Rest now, little spirits, you've just navigated the currents of the River of Souls. It's not uncommon to feel a little bewildered upon arrival. All is well here. I am convinced now that this is not the demon speaking, but a celestial from Nirvana. While we sit and rest, the magical darkness moves towards us. The celestial (?) speaks about the light of dawn as the darkness is coming closer.

pages.name: 75 - There are TOO MANY fluids!!
pages.content:
Fearghas crushes a gem of Mind Blank and smears the dust on my forehead. I am excluded from the telepathic bond, but immune to psychic damage, charmed, mind reading, and scrying spells. Shalkoc makes me a batch of… meat… cookies? Lacking in crunch, they are surprisingly tasty. I try to not wonder too much where the meat comes from. Plex pulls out a stash of Silver Tears and requests something in exchange for them, which makes Fearghas grumble. After trading with our goblin for cocaine, Fearghas casts Foresight on Shalkoc to give him the power of the Echo and advantage on pretty much everything. I give Aviana a root to eat and recover 21 HP. She claims I am the only one who cares about healing her, which is not only false but mildly pisses off Shalkoc (understandably).

Clouds of magical darkness drift past us. We're already completely lost in the maze of shifting corridors… We eventually gather our courage and leave the bubble. As we walked along a narrow hallway, then walked back, we found a wall. Then another wall as we turned around. The ground started to open up, a puddle of blood forming, sizzling like acid. Emilio and Fearghas start to feel unwell. The hallway in front of us opens up and the walls around us twist and shake with growing intensity. A cloud of darkness comes towards us! Just in time, Emilio warns us of a creature in the darkness, then says the wall blinked, removing one of the Walleyes.

Emilio goes ahead and describes a lake of blood to us in the darkness, and a big creature ahead. There is a snake-like creature in the pool, along with body parts and, below the surface, items like in a waste pool. We wonder if there is a stomach up ahead, I interject that this is not a real creature we are in. Emilio fires his three blasts into the darkness, and hits another Major Malleable. A snake made of guts slithers from the blood pool and up the wall. The Slithering Bowel (eat dirt, Aerelia) sprays digestive fluids at Emilio, he dodges most of it.

Aviana walks up to Emilio; the tunnels are barely wide enough for her. She casts Resistance on herself, then takes out the dented iron flask and holds it at the ready. One of the eyes on the wall glares at Emilio with such intensity that he is charmed. I heal him of his poison, then apply Piercing the Veil. Emilio turns to me and says that now he is not the only one cursed with knowledge. Shalkoc tries to blindly punch the Slithering Bowel, but misses, punches a hole into the wall that immediately closes itself. Another of those abominations spits a tooth at Shalkoc, who deflects it onto the other bowel. It spits another spray of digestive fluid at us. I am so disgusted I dodge it close to perfectly, but Plex on my shoulder is not so lucky and gets a whole drop on him.

Plex and Emilio are blinded by the acid. Emilio is hit by more acid, and dazed. Fearghas mumbles at the back, and then casts a Lightning Bolt, under my direction. His spell only grazes us harmlessly, but it hits two bowels and the Obscuroth from last time that we didn't chase. It was just chilling invisible at 1 HP. F in the chat. It appears as its corpse drops on the shore of the blood lake. Shalkoc is grabbed by something exceedingly fleshy and dragged into the acid pool. He managed "elp" before he got attacked by a Major Malleable.

The walls are spasming violently, tripping Emilio who was already blinded, charmed, and dazed. From the ground, he shoots three blasts at… Fearghas? They all miss, and Emilio shakes himself from his daze. He breaks free from the Walleye's charm too, but he is still lying prone. One of the slithering bowels spits acid at us, blinding Emilio and Plex all over again. Aviana works herself into a rage and steps into the darkness and grabs a bowel, at Emilio's urging to tear it apart (he is very sick of being blinded). She can't see through the darkness, and steps into the blood pool. She struggles out and climbs up on the wall, still squeezing the bowel, shouting to Shalkoc all the while.

Shalkoc gets hit by the Walleyes' psychic ray, but deflects it. He still gets charmed. I start towards Emilio to heal him, but as I do so, a wild magic surge surrounds me in magical darkness. I'm distracted and my spell comes out weak; the spasming walls trip me and I stumble next to the warlock. Plex falls off my shoulder squeaking. I grit my teeth and channel a Healing Word on Emilio, doing some actual healing this time, but ANOTHER wild magic surge makes me allergic to cloth. I am wearing cloth. My eyes are just streaming at my own dress, and the channelling fatigue hits hard.

Not my day.

Plex dodges the meat folds in the ground, and climbs back up on my shoulder. He casts, blindly, Ice Storm. Aviana dodges it, but the terrain is all slippery now. Shalkoc is charmed by the Walleye, but uses Stillness of Mind to remove it. And that's another surge, the next dog he sees in in fact, god. Anagrams, y'all. He is still being grappled by the Major Malleable in the acidic blood pool; as Fearghas puts it, "gently caressed by the meatball".

Fearghas is tripped by the spasming walls, jumps to his feet, and uses a spellgem of Dispel Magic to clear up the magical darkness around me. It's a big relief… although my dress still itches and makes my eyes water. Grappled by the malleable, Shalkoc is being drained of his spirit so hard that even his max HP would be reduced, but he uses a mythic power to resist it. Another cloud of magical darkness erupts from the Major Malleable, from the same wild magic surge I got a minute ago. Emilio is still prone but gets up at last. He is pissed off and goes into Void Form of his own accord. He stumbles into the icy area left by Plex, and fires Eldritch Blast on the Slithering Bowel. The latter wriggles free from Aviana's grapple and slithers away. Aviana smacks her talon down on it and crushes it before it can escape.

She calls out to Shalkoc, leaving one cloud of magical darkness and stepping into another one. Shalkoc calls for help, he is being grappled. She grabs the Major Malleable that is holding Shalkoc, and drags it, then jumps while holding it. "Shalkoc, do not resist," she says, as Shalkoc is dragged along, through the air, and takes heavy damage from the Cursed Thunderfeet when Aviana lands. The Walleye sees Aviana get too close, and becomes very uncomfortable. It casts Darkness.

I channel my summoning spell and call a powerful form of Fade to help in the battle. Emilio describes to Plex where the enemies are as he loads up a Gravity Fissure. Plex is no longer blinded, but he can't see through magical darkness like we do. I point Plex at the monsters like a gun. Aviana, Shalkoc, and the Walleye dodge, but both Major Malleables fail. Fade runs towards one of the Major Malleables, hunting by sound, and bites it hard, then becomes invisible. Shalkoc punches the Malleable to death and chugs a potion of speed. He vibrates out of the grapple and punches the other Malleable very hard, you might say critically so, then shifts to Turtle Stance and moves back, screaming he needs help.

Now that the Dragonborn is close, I see his injuries are critical! Just then, a Slithering Bowel spits acid from behind us, blinding me and Shalkoc. Plex dodges it somehow. Fearghas dodges the spasming walls with impressive agility. He puts on his Glasses of True Seeing, and chugs a potion of Maximum Power. The Malleable shuffles towards Shalkoc, stepping over my invisible Fade. It hits Shalkoc, who shields himself with his Protective Wings.

Emilio gets to the Malleable and starts tearing it apart with his claws. I only hear concerning slashing sounds… Aviana grabs the Walleye and squeezes it, then pushes her talons into it. She is pulling it out of the wall and almost has it out, but a bit at the back is still sticking. I wobble towards Shalkoc, blind but guided by Fearghas. Plex is shouting into my ear a lot of lines to the general effect of "let me at 'em!" He is distracting me and I step into the pool of acidic blood… Metal crunches under my feet. I cast Heal on Shalkoc, unseasoned because I am spending way too many resources already.

Plex chugs a Potion of Heroism. None of us like where this is going. Plex grimaces like he is ready to bite. Level 13 Wizard by the way. I hope he does not bite me… Fade shreds the Bowel with her teeth and knocks it prone, but doesn't manage to kill it. Shalkoc brutally slaps the Bowel, which attempts to slither away into a hole under the acid blood. Emilio slashes it on its way, killing it.

Fearghas' magic reaches to Aviana, ripping blood from her and crystallising it into three spikes that stab the Malleable to death, and pin the corpse against a nearby wall. Aviana says "hey the walls are helping us!". A mouth in the wall opens up and replies "No we're not.". I stare at Fearghas in shock. I climb onto the fleshy island in the middle of the blood pool to get out of the acid. Something revolting bursts under my hand, and Emilio lends me a steadying… errr… claw. The celestial speaks to us; I try to answer, but Emilio snaps at it.

Now that we can see again, we can distinguish what is at the bottom of the blood pool. Low-quality clothes and chains like that of the slaves in Ukgluz, some useless items… and a lot of coins. Some of the coins are too deep to pick up without diving, but Fearghas uses Mage Hand.We estimate that there are around 9700 gold coins in there! Aviana casts Find Traps, with the same result as before; everything is a trap.

The problem is time. How much time are we willing to sacrifice to fish out gold coins? There are other items in the blood pool, stuck in the crevices so someone will have to dive down to retrieve it. There is a silk robe embroidered in gold, untouched by the acid. There is also jewelry, potentially magical. Fearghas casts Guidance on Aviana, she casts Resistance on herself, and prepares to dive to retrieve anything of value (that isn't money). She spots a gold chain with an opal set inside, and a gold locket. The harpy dives in, pushes the flaps of meat aside and retrieves all three items, taking minimal damage in the process, as she is resistant to acid.

Emilio picks up the gold chain set with the fire opal, and Aviana takes the gold locket with a painted portrait inside, as well as the silk robe with gold embroidery. Emilio is mesmerised by the fire opal. We start walking, trying and failing to find our way. The tunnel shrinks, space is getting too tight for comfort… we can either let it squeeze us into a direction, or try to resist and stand our ground. Fearghas breaks a gem of Leomund's Tiny Hut, shielding us all within a dome of force. The walls begin to crush the dome; if we had tried to resist this, we would probably have suffocated. The bubble doesn't move, and after about three minutes, the walls expand again. We move on.

We reach another area of magical darkness. Emilio and Fearghas walk in, I hesitate next to Shalkoc. Behind us, Aviana hears a trickling, then a rushing. A wall of greenish bile floods the tunnel towards us. We brace for it and withstand it, but Fearghas and Emilio are swept away, pushed into a wall, and dragged along. Fearghas manages to hold on, but Emilio is pushed farther from us, unable to find his footing. (he's failed 6 saves at this point and we are screaming)

Something tries to snatches Emilio before he can be swept into a hole but he wriggles out and falls into the hole. HE FINALLY SAVES, holding onto teeth at the edge of the maw. He pulls himself up and out of the gaping maw at the cost of extensive acid burns. Left behind, Shalkoc starts to stumble through the magical darkness. He uses Step of the Wind to catch up to Emilio, but I lose sight of him completely.

I cast Piercing the Veil and advance through the magical darkness. Fade caught up to us, she is invisible but her presence reassures me. Less so Plex' on my shoulder, but he hands me two bottles of very dark wine as thanks for carrying him. To maintain the balance of trade, I hand him a torch. I don't think it will help him see through the magic-wrought darkness, but it's symbolic, right? I'm worried about Emilio, I'm sure he is injured. I need to get to him. Fearghas went ahead of me, and caught up to him and Shalkoc. I can't be too far behind.

Plex drinks some of the same dark wine. The magic around him shifts, shapes into a spell just short of casting. An invisible Obscuroth slides just in front of us, and Plex releases his Thunderwave… triggering a MAJOR WILD MAGIC SURGE. THAT BLINDS ANYONE WITHIN 60 FEET OF PLEX. I'll need a 9th-level spell to remove that!

An unfinished flesh golem is speaking to Emilio and Fearghas, begging to be left alone because it's been tortured so much, all its scales ripped of. It has the head of a juvenile dragon, on a humanoid body. The Dragonflesh golem unleashes an Elemental breath on Emilio, knocking the life out of him. The golem cries that he is sorry, then returns to being an emotionless golem.

Aviana tears through the wall of flesh, emerging next to the others whom I was trying to catch up to! Fearghas shouted that Emilio was down, from the shouts I hear, he could be dying. Fearghas shouts to Aviana to put Emilio in the flask. Shalkoc runs up to Emilio and feeds him snot, which revives him with a lot of coughing. He weakly thanks Shalkoc, who is silenced and just gives a thumbs up. The celestial's voice congratulates Shalkoc for pouring snot down Emilio's throat while he was unconscious and dying from his wounds.

What a time to have ears.

I dash towards the noise made by my friends, Plex guiding me. How the tables turn. I call out to them and say I'm blind. Unable to cast a spell, I draw my sharp dagger and clutch it for dear life. I hear a Walleye fire a Psychic Ray, and Fearghas grumbles about Wizard bullshit. He summons a Spectral Hand and uses a spellgem of Dimension Door to drop Emilio and Shalkoc next to me, by grabbing them with the very spooky hand. Fearghas joins us, swinging his obsidian battleaxe. Level 13 Wizard by the way.

Plex offers to Fearghas to buy his Haste Potion. Fearghas retorts "Plex, do you understand the concept of DYING?" Aviana is getting attacked by something. Shalkoc gains inspiration as the Dragonflesh golem is proof of the existence of dragons. Plex uses Fey Step and disappears on the other side of a wall. Again. This time he is not far from us, and he casts Gravity Sinkhole. We discuss what to do with the Dragonflesh golem, and decide to put it out of its misery. I argue that I prefer to spend my most powerful spell on my friends rather than attempt to save a creature twisted beyond recognition, that has tried to kill us.

Plex shunts the Dragonflesh golem into the gaping maw. It screams in terror that it doesn't want to fall into that hole again, then sinks beneath the waves. I feel so sick… The darkness is suffocating… I can't fight it, it comes from my own eyes. Can we survive this? Will we even live to find the Sibriex? I can't break now, I am still needed. An Obscuroth wanders close to Fade, she tears it to shreds. The golem struggles in vain, shouting it doesn't want to go there again, not again. I can't shut out the screams, they sound too much like mine. The last we hear from the golem is that it doesn't want to "receive any more mercy from that thing". What a sickening thing to hear…

Emilio is completely unconcerned with his own survival, and enters Void Form again. I will dose this man with catfern and mavinsleaf if we ever get out of here. Abundantly. He applies Accrued Vitality and gives himself 26 temp HP, so maybe I will maybe it a slightly weaker brew. He slashes at a Bloater that is right in front of us. I get hit by a Tooth Spit from a Slithering Bowel, and dazed, but I keep my concentration on Fade. She dashes to us, but can't attack this turn.

Aviana shoves a repulsive enemy like Captain Falcon, straight into the maw in the middle of the room. Shalkoc hesitates to kill the Bloater because they explode when they die, he (rightfully so) fears he'll kill us (Emilio and me). I use a Mass Cure Wounds but it turns out to be weak sauce on everyone but me. Since I'm dazed, I can do nothing else…

Aviana gets critted and recovers a lot of resources! She brings up wanting to be bitten again. Fearghas casts Shocking Grasp on the Bloater, then slices at it with his axe, with precision entirely out of place for a Wizard! He moves away from us, past Fade, and drinks another Potion of Maximum Power. Fearghas spots a kind of flesh… workbench? in the distance. On it rests a heavy tome, and he gets this glint in his eyes…

Plex pushes the Bloater away from me, but closer to Fearghas. The monster tries to eat Emilio; he takes damage from the bite, then gets swallowed. Plex, still tiny, convincingly shouts at Emilio that he can, in fact, SEE in there! The Bowel next to Aviana tries to slither away, but she kicks it, sending it close enough to attack me, which it does. I take acid damage, and I am dazed again. This time I lose concentration and Fade dissipates in a burst of dark mist. Emilio somehow survives the Bloater's stomach acid but he is still severely injured. In clawing his way out, Emilio kills the Bloater, which explodes in a burst of acid. Our warlock emerges covered in acid, enraged.

The Bowel spits acid at me again. I can't think for the pain… We finally kill that last Bowel, and combat ends. I'm still blind, so I cling to anyone I can find. Fearghas picks up the tome; a Manual of Fiendish Flesh Golems. It is bound in many kinds of skin. He also finds a cloak woven in dragon scales, which he hands to Emilio. Shalkoc's last remaining braincell whispers to him to not run away on his own. Thank you so much, braincell.

I'm standing in place, paralysed with fear, when Fearghas walks up to me with a spell scroll and a spellgem, and removes my cloth allergy, and my blindness. I can finally see! And I see the blood in the pool in the middle of the room draining… The celestial's voice speaks to us not in our minds, but from below the pool, welcoming us.

Fearghas says out loud what we all think; we are in no condition for another fight and we absolutely need to rest. Emilio trades with Plex; one haste potion for Aviana, in exchange for Plex' last surviving chicken, which Emilio held onto. Fearghas prepares to put up the tiny hut, and we settle for a short rest next to the corpses, the acid puddles, and the empty pool of blood.

pages.name: 76 - Healing fear
pages.content:
Aviana and Plex begin to argue, which ends as usual with Aviana grabbing Plex by the throat and squeezing, and them both disappearing. Teleportation out of here is impossible, so we assume they are still in the lair. Fearghas pulls out alchemical supplies, grumbles at our friends' disappearance, and we hear a sound coming from the north-east corridor. Fearghas says the telepathic bond ended when I bring it up, so we go look for them using our little feet, Emilio and I leaving a trail of blood from our injuries. Emilio's blood is black?!

We follow the twisting corridor to a room where we find a small Malleable that has… wings? Behind it is a large black egg. Emilio and Fearghas immediately blast the Malleable; its body melts into the ground, leaving feathers behind. The egg is warm and has a thin, slimy shell like a snake egg. Fearghas and Shalkoc say it looks nothing like a dragon egg… How do they know that? Not the time to ask. Something is moving sluggishly inside the egg. A humanoid hand seems to try to break through the shell, but is too weak to do so.

Before Fearghas can advise against this course of action, Emilio punches a hole through the egg, spilling fluid onto Emilio. Inside the egg is a gooey, disheveled… human woman. She is not happy, understandably so. She is small, blonde with green eyes, wearing black armour. Groggily, she asks where she is.

"We're in the lair of a demon."

"At the bottom of a lake."

"In the Underdark."

5 iridescent feathers on the ground, untouched by the filth.

The blonde woman introduces herself as Kyrin. She is spooked by Shalkoc, towering over the party. She offers me a healing potion, then upon seeing Emilio, hands it to him instead. No hard feelings. He is hurt even worse than I am. She hands me a second healing potion. Emilio and me drink gratefully; a little of the tension goes out of him.

We return to the drained blood pool and Fearghas carries out the ritual for Leomund's Tiny Hut. Kyrin examines herself, checking for any unnatural growths that may have occurred while she was in the egg. Her shadow seems… strange. Doesn't move quite right, like it's lagging behind. I speak up, but Fearghas and Kyrin say I'm maybe seeing things. For a moment her shadow looked like mine… I must be imagining. Shalkoc cooks a thankfully vegetarian soup for Emilio and me.

I patch up Emilio with the bandages and herbs I have, then treat my own wounds. Shalkoc cooks a big medium rare steak for Kyrin, generously spiced with ginger. What meat is that? After handing her food to Kyrin, Shalkoc gives me a very soothing high-five with his Hand of Healing. Fearghas insistently asks Shalkoc where he got the steak from, which makes Kyrin hesitate until Shalkoc assures he bought the steak in the city. Shalkoc cooks more meat, this time some kind of chicken, as a snack for Fearghas.

The voice calls from the hole: "Yes, pause and breathe in the tranquility, dear ones. The transition from the River to the boundless peace of Nirvana can be… intense. Rest is a balm, and I am here to offer comfort and guidance." Emilio shouts at it to shut up. Fearghas offers him a drink, he refuses. The dwarf insists, and pours him some dwarven ale. Kyrin enquires as to why Emilio is so angry at the voice. His voice seeps barely controlled fury as he speaks about the abysmal luck he's been having.

I offer to treat the party's remaining scrapes and hurts. They decline, but the celestial speaks in my mind, saying they are impressed with my dedication to heal, and they are eager to teach me to heal even better. I go positively green at that. Fearghas hands out potions of heroism, which we all drink as we steel ourselves.

The hole in the middle of the room is deep, with slippery walls. Fearghas suggests to cast Feather Fall, and just jump. AAAAAAAAAA. We float down into a large fleshy chamber, very humid and reeking. A big hole in the north wall leads to another chamber, presumably. We hear skittering, squelching steps. There is no sign of the Dragonflesh golem… The voice calls "There you are, let me tend to you." Kyrin crouches behind a fleshy growth, all but disappearing from sight. Fearghas takes a steeling drink. I panic and use Shadowslip to disappear (and a major wild magic surge giving me a permanent 1d8 to my charisma checks!). Shalkoc uses Guardian of Nature: Primal Beast. Emilio glares.

The skittering comes closer… Hands, followed by elbows, more hands, more elbows… It straightens, a monster of arms and more arms that moves gingerly but dextrously. The monster cradles what remains of a celestial, or rather, many celestials stitched together. Bones sticking out of its fingers make dreadful claws. It asks us to come into its embrace. Emilio is enraged and threatens it. The monster responds with kindness…

We roll initiative.

The Perfected Deva takes two steps towards us, then teleports very close! It swings claws at Fearghas saying soothing things, to which Fearghas grumbles heartily. It encourages us to come closer, and sweeps across the entire area with its claws. It hits and grapples Fearghas, restraining him as it pulls him into its loving embrace. Urgh. Emilio gets hit and delivers a spicy Hellish Rebuke in reaction, but the boss saves and takes half damage. Emilio gets grappled as well. I get hit even in shadow form, breaking the spell, and grappled. Shalkoc blocks the attack with his wings. Kyrin is not noticed by the monster at all.

I resist the curse, try to escape the grapple, but fail. Shalkoc goes into Mantis Style and punches, then attempts to deliver a Stunning Strike, twice. He does damage, but both strikes fail to stun the Deva. He unleashes a Flurry of Blows, triggers Chromatic Hardening, and tries one last Stunning Strike, to no avail. He steps away, unharmed by the monster.

Emilio resists the curse like it's nothing. He casts Void Torrent, and teleports away; the acid does not seem to harm the Deva at all. He goes into Void Form and uses Accrued Vitality but it's weak sauce and he only gains 8 temp HP. Tragic. Kyrin gets cursed. The Deva tells us to not be afraid, which promptly frightens Shalkoc and me (I rolled with advantage, and thankfully, because that was a 4 and a 1…). Kyrin pulls out a SUN BLADE and swings at the monster in a sneak attack, dealing a ton of radiant damage. She follows it up with a Psychic Blade, but the attack misses. She runs to safety.

The Deva uses Helping Hand (a claw attack with free necrotic damage and spicy crit range) and crits Fearghas for a massive chunk of HP. He casts Misty Step to get the hell out, leaving me alone in the grapple. He casts Hold Monster from a spellgem.

"Aerelia if this thing is immune to paralyse, I'm going to shank you." Karnack, 2025.

We don't find out because the Deva saves, and Fearghas is very upset. The Deva uses Gentle Light, spawning a cloud of magical darkness on Kyrin. The Deva uses To the Rescue, teleporting to Shalkoc and dragging me along. Pressed into its ribcage, I feel squirming underneath the skin. There is a lot of maggots in there… The Deva hits me, it's another crit. I take heavy damage, leaving me at low health with a half-baked plan.

The Deva has a legendary resistance, and I only get one shot at a healing burst. I levitate myself out of the grapple, run away 20 feet in the air, and apply a healing word on myself, healing barely anything. Shalkoc punches for all he's worth, with a lot of feeling, but does not stun the Deva, so he shifts to Turtle Stance. The Deva uses Don't be Afraid again, but we all endure the wave of fear without flinching. Emilio growls that he has seen much worse in the void, and pummels it with an Eldritch Blast. Two beams hit, and Emilio uses Grasp of Hadar to drag the Deva closer to him.

The monster unleashes another wave of fear, terrifying Shalkoc and Kyrin. It uses Empathy/Loneliness as a reaction to her failing the save, forcing us to make two other saves which she barely passes, at the cost of light psychic damage. She sidesteps out of the magical darkness and throws a Psychic Blade because she is frightened and unable to move closer.

The Deva feels lonely and teleports to Kyrin, who flips it off as a free action. "What a gentle gesture," it sighs. "Oh I've got a gesture for you all right!" She says. Fearghas steps in cat puke IRL then casts Scorching Ray. It would deal massive damage, but the Deva uses a Legendary Resistance! Then Fearghas chucks a Spiritual Weapon at it. The Deva uses a legendary action to attack Kyrin on Fearghas' turn, she uses her Uncanny Dodge to halve the damage.

The Deva hits Kyrin again, taking half her life in one blow. She then hits me; I drop to 1 HP and the Death Ward dissipates! I stop concentrating on Levitate and float to the ground. Through the Staff of Power, I cast Wall of Force and put myself in an unbreakable box to buy time. A Healing Word on Shalkoc gives him courage to approach the enemy and punch the living daylight out of it. Emilio gets close and readies up a spell. The Deva uses a Helping Hand on Kyrin, who dodges it perfectly. Close call!

Kyrin gets an otherworldly inspiration called Karnack; she hides, applies Shadow Strike to increase her reach, then attacks with a melee Psychic Blade, and marks the enemy's soul. She books it to a safe distance. A new wave of fear rolls out from the Deva, but none of us are afraid! Fearghas commands his Spiritual Weapon to attack, then prepares a Scorching Ray.

Another wave of fear hits us, and this time it's too much for everyone but Fearghas. Shalkoc indirectly saves my life by using a Dreamfeather and allowing me to reroll, avoiding psychic damage from Empathy/Loneliness. Kyrin gets hit by it but saves, barely surviving. On its turn, the Deva goes to her. Shalkoc tries an attack of opportunity, but is hit by a wild magic surge that inflicts disadvantage on all his attack rolls, cancelling the advantage from his future sight. Kyrin gets hit by Helping Hand, and goes down. The Deva jumps back to Shalkoc's rescue and bumps into my Wall of Force. Eyes lock onto me and hands feel at the Wall of Force, looking in vain for an opening. It looks disappointed, but it waits for my barrier to fall off.

Emilio and Fearghas unleash their readied spells, Tasha's Mind Whip and Scorching Ray. The Deva rolls a critical save on the mind whip and does not use resistance… Five of Fearghas' rays hit, and the Deva uses Legendary Resistance!

Steeling myself, I drop concentration on the Wall of Force. The hands reach out to me as I am defenseless, critically injured, but I am faster. Ripping my spellwards from my wrists, clutching the Staff of Power, I channel my strongest healing spell. A torrent of positive energy rushes towards the Deva, closing all wounds but also feeding the maggots inside and making them multiply until the creature's skin tears and the disgusting things burst out. The Deva's twisted body crumples, and the ruined face looks up at me. In a last whisper, it says "Thank you". For a moment I am filled with serenity and thoughts of the dawn's light, just like the day I received my staff.

Maggots are swarming all over. I step around them, casting a Healing Word on myself, and start toward the unconscious Kyrin. Shalkoc makes short work of the maggots with a fire breath, popping them like corn. Combat ends at last, and I rush over to Kyrin and get her back on her feet. Fearghas harvests the maggots, while telling Shalkoc to NOT eat them or even pick them up. He tries to get materials from the Deva's corpse, but it's too corrupted to make anything out of.

Kyrin finds 15 gleaming Springseeds. I scoop them up carefully and put them in my bag of herbs, hoping to plant them on Promise soon. We consider taking another rest, but the lair begins to quake and spasm. Again a rushing sound comes towards us from above. We cannot take another wave of bile now! I can confirm that we are in a stomach, urgh. The hole up north should be a throat of sorts; we dash into it, chased by the rushing sound becoming louder behind us. I block the tunnel with a Wall of Force as soon as we are through, but if the wall is unbreakable, the sticky walls of flesh will not hold much longer. We burst out of the sticky throat into a mouth with several rows of enormous teeth, closed.

Fearghas casts Shocking Grasp to get the creature to open its mouth, and his Lich Hand to tickle the uvula. It doesn't work out, so Emilio tries with a Mage Hand, but fails miserably. Kyrin stabs the tongue with her Psychic Blade. The blade goes in to the hilt, but we see no wound. The tongue rises to crush us against the roof of the mouth, but the teeth are cracking open. A wall of water rushes in…

Fearghas and Emilio very quickly put their heads together, talking quickly about magic. They come to the conclusion that teleportation should now be possible. Fearghas says "Get in my mouth!" and nobody understands until he polymorphs himself into a whale and takes a deep breath, filling his mouth with air. We all hop in.

"I am the coo of the sea!" Fearghas, 1497.

The water is a lot murkier, polluted with blood and bile. Whaleghas spots small Aboleths in the water. He swims up, and beaches himself on a… beach, and kindly opens his mouth to let us out. He reverts to his true form spitting, saying one of us tastes awful. Emilio apologises.

We are in a cave we've never seen before. Kyrin suggests a Detect Magic spell, so I take out my wand and give it a happy little wave. Kyrin seems to see just fine, she is intently looking around the cavern as if searching for something. We discuss our options; do we return to Fearghas' mansion in Ukgluz, or teleport to Promise? We quickly brief Kyrin on our… history with the Duergar. And the Drow of House Vandree… We decide to head back to Fearghas' mansion, on foot. Fearghas pops a spellgem of Find the Path.

We are on the other side of the lake, so it isn't far, but we have to go through the water again. Not a problem, as Fearghas turns back to Whaleghas to ferry us across. On the way, Kyrin says she was employed by the Drow to investigate Ukgluz, then tried to infiltrate Lessia with the Duergar, but she messed up, and can't be seen by them now. The last thing she remembers is Matron Vandree telling her she will never disappoint her again, and the next thing she knew she woke up in a gooey egg in the lair. The whale noises stop at that, then resume, and Whaleghas sneakily slaps Shalkoc with his tongue. Whalegas spits us all out on the other side of the lake, on the side of Ukgluz. The mutated larvae here have grown even larger…

Fearghas, back to dwarf form, grumbles about "mahr-might taste" again, and blames Shalkoc, who is offended. We make for Ukgluz, but Kyrin stops. She fears being recognised. Anxiously, she asks us not to tell on her as she shapeshifts into a child with the look of an urchin. Although she is smaller, her shadow grows larger. Irritatedly, she stomps on it and mutters at it under her breath. Her shadow behaves, and with child-Kyrin in tow, we walk to Ukgluz. Fearghas sticks the hat on his head and reminds us that we are all pretending to be his slaves.

As we reach the alleyway where the manor is, Fearghas stops abruptly. We all collide into him, which amuses a Duergar nearby, who asks how he will punish his slaves for this, and thankfully leaves. Right in front of the manor's invisible door is one of the Duergar's statues. Apparently these are the "demon engines" or are powered by them. It hasn't noticed us yet.

We investigate a little, then sneak past the statue. It doesn't move and we slip into the mansion unnoticed. Fearghas officially welcomes us to the Chateau de MacAllistar. We chill and get Kyrin up to speed about why we were in the Sibriex lair. Fearghas mentions, with no ill intentions I'm sure, that we went into the lair because I insisted on it. We nearly died in there… Suddenly choked with guilt, I excuse myself to the kitchen to make tea, but Kyrin thanks me for saving her, that if we hadn't gone into the lair, she would have been warped into a monster. I try to reply, but only squeak, and hurry to the kitchen, asking Shalkoc if we can make some cookies for everyone, too.

Fearghas, Emilio, and Kyrin discuss origins, reputation, and casual racism in the dining hall. We return with tea and snacks. Fearghas contacts Aviana with a Sending, asking where she and Plex are, and whether they are both safe. Aviana replies very tensely with "where the fuck are you", "what is this bullshit", and something about her dress being all dirty, and she was done with sewers, and she was done with filthy places! And this is more than 25 words for sure.

pages.name: 76 - Healing Fear (Summary)
pages.content:
Aviana grabs Plex' throat after 2.5 seconds of arguing and they both teleport. Good start. They can't have gone far, what with the teleport restrictions here. I ask if Fearghas can contact them telepathically, but that Discord call ended while I was forcefully offline thanks to Mind Blank.

We leave to look for our missing companions, but find instead a... Minor Malleable? With wings? Emilio and Fearghas blast it dead, we pick up 5 dreamfeathers and share them among us. There is a large black snake-like egg, with movement inside. Emilio punches it open and a petite woman comes out, a human who woke up from the worst nap ever.

We introduce ourselves and explain to her where she is. Her name is Kyrin and she has very little idea how she got here, poor soul. She gives healing potions to Emilio and me after seeing how beaten up we are, how nice! The potions that is, not the beating up part.

We return to the blood pool room and take a short rest in the bubble. There is a lot of healing to be done, Shalkoc cooks a big steak for Kyrin which prompts relentless questioning from Fearghas to ascertain the origin of the meat. Bless this dwarf. Kyrin's shadow seems odd, but I brush it off as imagination.

The celestial's voice encourages us to rest, and Emilio snaps at it. Fearghas offers him ale, for his nerves. Emilio refuses. Fearghas insists. Kyrin asks why he is so angry (Emilio, not Fearghas, understandable mistake dear reader). Emilio grumbles about his terrible luck. The celestial wants to teach me to heal better. Hard pass. I'm fine. Nuh-uh.

After some much needed R&R, we jump down the maw in the middle of the room, and live thanks to Fearghas' Feather Fall spell. We end up in a large, disgusting, vaguely round cavern. No sign of the monsters we chucked into that hole last time, I'm sure that's nothing to worry about. Something is coming! Kyrin hides so well I can't see her at all. I panic and slip into my shadow. Fearghas quaffs some ale. Shalkoc casts a spell to make his muscles bigger. Emilio glares.

We're attacked? By a monster with FAR too many hands, claiming it just wants a hug. It has the celestial's voice, but the body is corrupted beyond recognition and twisted into a fiend. In spite of this, it kept its good intentions and keeps trying to help us, which turns into trying to kill us.

"Aerelia if this thing is immune to paralyse, I'm going to shank you." Karnack, 2025.

It's a hard battle, the Perfected Deva always targets the lowest health character to "help" them, and it grapples like a son of a kobold too. It teleports, inflicts fear, and generally hits like a truck. Kyrin flips it off as a free action. I'm grappled within an inch of my life and I realise that under the creature's skin, maggots are teeming. If they could teem a bit more, we could get interesting results. Speaking from experience.

We hatch a plan. Emilio and Fearghas ready their spells to hit the Deva on my turn and force it to use its legendary resistance. I put myself in a box, that is Wall of Force, because I am at 1 HP and my Death Ward triggered. Kyrin goes down despite some sick dodges, but all is in readiness. I drop concentration on Wall of Force, take off my spellwards, and channel for all I'm worth.

I CAST HEAL AT 9TH LEVEL!

According to plan, the maggots multiply and the boss explodes! It thanks me in a last whisper just before Shalkoc grills all the maggots with a dragon breath. Do not eat the maggots. I rush to help Kyrin but it's too soon to celebrate, as another wave of bile is coming for us. We run into the only exit, a sticky tunnel that I block with a Wall of Force. This only buys us a little time, as the flood of bile is so bad, the throat-like tunnel will give out before my spell does. We exit the tunnel into a huge mouth with several rows of teeth, firmly shut.

We think on how to escape, but soon Fearghas says "Get in my mouth!"

Nobody knows what he is talking about. (except Emilio for meta reasons)

He polymorphs into a sperm whale.

Everybody knows what he is talking about.

Shalkoc gets slapped by a tongue, one of us tastes like Marmite, we are carried to freedom by the glorious form of Whaleghas.

"I am the coo of the sea!" Fearghas 1497.

After learning Kyrin is a changeling, we decide to return to the Chateau de MacAllistar in Ukgluz. We dodge a statue that was staring at the door, thankfully without consequences (right?), get in, chat over tea and cookies, and send a Message spell to Aviana, with a response that is mostly grumbling about her dress being all dirty.

pages.name: 77 - Cookies and threats
pages.content:
While the rest of us are safe in the Chateau de MacAllistar sipping tea and eating cookies, Aviana and Plex are still in the Sibriex lair, fighting for their lives. They do a very respectable amount of ripping and tearing until it's done, and find loot equal to 1700 gold (850gp each). Their resources all but spent, they are attacked by a giant ooze that… promptly dies by melting away as it moves, flooding the entire hall in blood and bile and other disgusting things. (This is when Aviana gets Fearghas' message spell, as she was waist-high in that ichor with Plex on her shoulder.)

They get to one closed butthole and ponder how to get out. Aviana ponders tearing it a new one, literally, but decides against it and tries to pry open the existing one. It does not work out, as she is too grossed out, and attempts to use Plex as a towel to avoid touching it. Plex is at 8 HP. He has some ideas, none of them good. He settles on Prestidigitation, which triggers an irrelevant minor surge, to clean up Aviana so she doesn't use him as a towel. Plex hands Aviana a slice of cloth cut from a tent, from the time we first met Emilio.

Plex casts Pulse Wave to force the butthole open. They exit the lair into pitch-black water. Below them is a mountain of waste from the lair; some things within are shimmering. There are 3 pyropes and 3 jades, which Plex grabs with his mage hand. Because of the earlier surge that teleported Fearghas to the Plane of Water, both Aviana and Plex know where Fearghas is, and they know where his manor is. Plex casts a Dimension Door to the surface, but Aviana doesn't fit through it, not just because she is too big but also because Plex is too small (he is still tiny).

Aviana grabs Plex, who chugs snot to survive her Vice Grip. This circumvents the issue with Dimension Door, and they teleport to the surface. Plex would 100% have died without the snot. They swim ashore; they know where to go, but must be sneaky about it to not be taken for runaway slaves by the Duergar again. They are immediately spotted by two Duergar who call out to them.

Plex stands on Aviana's shoulder and says hello, which confuses the Duergar because they can't see the tiny Plex. He says he wants to get into Ukgluz to meet a friend. The Duergar demand to know what they were doing, and who owns them. Plex guesses he is owned by Mannon, who is not there at the moment. The Duergar call for reinforcments. Plex requests to be grabbed by Aviana again, and casts Vortex Warp at 4th level on himself to teleport into Ukgluz.

This of course attracts a lot of attention and soon 15 guards are running after them. Plex panics, casts Fey Step and teleports 20ft to the East. Fearghas' Plex-sense is tingling; he gets a splitting headache out of nowhere, sends a Message to Aviana, who screams in answer. Fearghas gets The Look (tm) on his face as he says Plex and Aviana are running amok in the city, and he needs to go and get them. We all go out to look for our… friends.

We soon hear a commotion three streets over, of a now-normal-size harpy running like Jack Sparrow shouting "What did I do? Stop chasing me!". She runs into a market stall, prompting more screaming that guides Fearghas and the rest of us towards them. Plex pockets a piece of cloth, Aviana runs into soot and her face is now black. She spots Fearghas dashing towards her with The Look (tm) on his face. Aviana is chased by 20 guards shouting to stop these runaway slaves. Plex teleports him and Aviana a short distance.

Fearghas says "play along" and cracks both of them on the head with his staff, shouting at them. I try to stop the violence, to no avail. Emilio nods like this is the most reasonable thing. Fearghas apologises to the Duergar and makes a good show of a repentant master. The Duergar are visibly losing brain cells, and say that they will have to report this and Fearghas is to show up at the court house by tomorrow for the report.

The Duergar insists that Fearghas puts his slaves in chains, so Aviana says she brought her own chain and pulls out a regular chain, a pair of manacles, and finally the Null-Steel chain. Fearghas chains Aviana up with the regular chain, and Plex with the Null-Steel chain, and we head back into the manor the moment the guards have their backs turned. Fearghas hesitates to unchain Plex, who is very confused about the Duergar (he has never met them directly). Fearghas explains. Plex is confused as to who Fearghas can't be the slave.

Aviana is stuck in the steel chain and calls Fearghas for help. Kyrin meets Aviana for the first time as her face is black with soot. Fearghas cleans her up with Prestidigitation, and makes the introductions with Kyrin. I hand Aviana a cookie and gain inspiration, yay!. Kyrin is happily munching away on more treats, looking like a child with chocolate smudged on her nose.

Aviana wants to open a cookie business because she thinks Kyrin is adorable. I remind her that we are now in legal trouble with the Duergar, and we are summoned to Hell within the week, not to mention we are planning an ambush on Matron Vandree. We also need to retrieve the Eye of Dahak from the Drow to help the king of Lessia before we can go back to fulfilling our contracts with Hell. Kyrin says she knows where the Drow are. Or… were. She's not sure how long she was in the egg. She describes the place where the Drow where, a place I recognise. We both grimace as we speak about Matron Vandree.

Aviana grumbles very much about how Fearghas' manor looks, and that it needs a complete makeover. We argue there are more pressing matters, i.e. resting because we are all beaten up. Fearghas gives me a triggered spellgem of Private Sanctum. To release the spell, I need to say Execute in Dwarven. Kyrin pulls out an ink-black piece of cloth and slaps it down on the floor, then climbs down into it. It's a Portable Hole! She suggests using it to sneak out of the city, which will cause issues with bags of holding, but this is something we are aware of (thankfully).

Kyrin takes the appearance of Aviana, at her urging. Aviana is star-struck and has her try on a silk robe, and a dress. Fearghas sighs and disappears into the cellar with the intention to drink himself silly. The servants bring a comfortable little pad for Emilio and put it in a corner, as if he was a grumpy little cat; surprisingly he is sitting at the table and having cookies with the rest of us. Emolio

I use my last spell slot, and channel to heighten it from level 5 to level 8, and cast Remove Curse on Plex. He can speak again without music playing in the background, and he is again of reasonable size.

We take a long rest. I HAVE HP AGAIN.

(Now the new rest rules come into effect; the next long rest we can take is on Saturday.)

We are having breakfast the next day and discussing our plans when Matron Vandree speaks into my mind:

Naami. My little traitor.

Did you think your disloyalty would go unnoticed?

A little bird, fluttering through King Dimzad’s halls, sang me such a lovely song.

It spoke of a stolen sceptre, a clever little plan... and you. The bait. Squirming so prettily in the jaws of a trap meant for me.

But fret not, little one. That shall not be your fate.

No - yours will be a special one.

For you will soon learn what fate awaits those foolish enough to betray me - and anyone they've ever held dear.

Shaking, I repeat these words to the party. She will hurt Madr. Emilio and Kyrin comfort me, and Fearghas promises we will take care of it. Aviana suggests making Matron Vandree disappears. We say that is the idea, and nothing short of it will free Kyrin and me from her influence.

Shalkoc cooks up a feast for us, in which he eagerly takes part. Plex and Aviana give 1 pyrope and 2 jades to Fearghas. Kyrin gives me a potion of greater healing. Fearghas cooks up some potions, but the alchemy goes awry.

We have to exile Shalkoc to the other end of the manor to drink tea, ale, and potions, as all liquids still turn to lukewarm water when he is within 60 feet.

Plex turns himself and Aviana tiny so they can sneak better. Emilio scoops up Aviana and hides her in his breast pocket. I lift Plex, scold him, and gently place him in my bag with instructions to not disturb my herbs! Fearghas casts Rary's Telepathic Bond, which I am again excluded from, my mind is still blank... We leave the mansion. Fearghas is tracking mud everywhere for a week because of a surge. I offer to cast Remove Curse on him, but he advises me not to spend this many resources.

We head to the market as I need to replenish my healer's supplies. Fearghas buys me 2 healer's kits, and I sneakily hand him the money when we are out of sight. Fearghas then buys alchemical supplies. Aviana bullies him into buying her a new mug, which grants her inspiration as it is useless.

We head to the king's hall to speak to Dimzad. Kyrin, who transformed into a Duergar, so she stays outside to "watch over the slaves", that is the rest of us, while Fearghas goes in to speak with the king. Kyrin grumbles at this, she wanted to investigate the hall for something hidden, or someone disguised. Fearghas solves her concern by using a See Invisibility gem.

One of the seats to the king's right is empty; last time, a priest was sitting there. The king greets him by saying "Out of your portal, are you?". Fearghas says the Matron is aware of the ambush, and that she has a spy in Dimzad's court. He furrows his brows at this, says he suspected something as some scrying sensors were recently found, one of those at the entrance of Fearghas' portal. (I assume he means the door to the manor.) The sensors were destroyed (presumably this is why an armour was at the door?), but Dimzad says the plans have changed, and asks Fearghas what he is planning to do.

Fearghas says he assumes the Matron will come get me, and also he plans to investigate a camping location of the Drows'. Dimzad asks why he should let the Halfling (me) go. Fearghas says that I am in his employ and care. Dimzad asks why he should let either of us go, as us surface-dwellers don't know how to use Null-Steel…

Fearghas warns us telepathically, and the hall's doors begin to close! Fearghas teleports back to us with a Dimension Door cast with a Subtle Mind Crystal to escape being taken prisoner. The plan is now to run. The moment we start running, statues (demon engines) advance towards us, carrying black nets of Null-Steel.

Aviana hops out of Emilio's pocket and chugs a Potion of Giant Size. Plex drops concentration on the spell that made him tiny, and casts Adjust Density on Aviana to halve her density and increase her jump distance. She uses Legendary Vigor to further increase it. Fearghas casts Feather Fall on us so we don't straight up die.

Aviana scoops us all up and jumps 700 meters up and forward, to not bonk her head on the ceiling (close call). Kyrin and me point to the Drows' camping site as we are gliding through the air; the campsite is empty, and we float far past it. We end up about 3km from the city gates. Aviana approaches the ground and we wriggle out of her grasp to avoid being caught in the explosion from the Thunderfeet Footwraps. All of us jump and float down before she lands, but Emilio is too fancy for this and uses his Robe of Stars to disappear from this reality and reappear a short moment later.

Aviana gently floats down, triggering an explosion, but she takes the superhero landing pose. It looks very different when she isn't slamming down into the ground, but she is having a great time. Plex missed the landing a bit, and emerges from underneath a large mushroom cap somehow. Aviana stomps over to us, Fearghas asks if everyone is alive, and Emilio wants to fly again. Adrenalin junkie…

We agree to return to the campsite to look for clues. It's uncomfortably close to Ukgluz, but needs must. Emilio gives a heartfelt compliment to Fearghas on his excellent use of Dimension Door; he feels invigorated. Aviana carries Emilio up on her shoulder to repay the favour of him carrying her in his pocket earlier. He is loving the height.

We get to the campside, and from Ukgluz we see several demon engines coming in our general direction. We decide to hide nearby and wait for the searching to die down. Aviana puts us all in a potato sack and climbs up to a ledge where we hole up in a cavern that is big enough even for her in giant mode. As we arrive in the cavern, a lage lizard slithers away, deciding it isn't messing with something the size of Aviana. Kyrin scouts further into the cavern, finding only large lizard eggs. Shalkoc gets a hungry look in his eyes and sneaks off towards the eggs until we grab him by the scruff of the neck.

We sit down to keep watch; around 30 demon engines are roaming the area, and after around 3 hours they start to head back towards Ukgluz. After 6 hours, they are all gone. In the meantime, Fearghas looks for herbs and finds some Shimmerleaf, which he coaxes to grow with magic from a gem. I help him out with herbs as he starts brewing. Aviana inspires him to do his best by flexing. He brews up 1 Potion of Supreme Healing. Kyrin takes out a notepad and starts sketching the area, adding some notes. Kyrin conjures up a Mage Hand to pick a blue flower she spotted. She picks two, gives me one which I put in my hair, and presses the other into a book, which gives her inspiration!

Plex summons a Mage Hand to… fight Kyrin's Mage Hand? He only gets a moderate surge that restrains him for a day. The Mage Hand backfired and is now holding him very tight. Aviana wants to chain him up to carry him like a bag. Or tie him up with a hempen rope. Or a jungle vine, whatever he prefers. He can't struggle anyway, and is fine being carried around, but he would much prefer if Fearghas carried him around on Tenser's Floating Disk for a day. Fearghas grumbles, but Plex argues he owes him a favour. Fearghas casts Tenser's Floating Disk and Aviana places Plex on it. She spins the disk.

We climb down with Aviana's help and approach the camp; Aviana stays on the ledge as she is too noticeable, and could easily jump to us in an emergency. There isn't much here, and footprints make it clear that this place has been searched by the Duergar. Fearghas casts Detect Magic. I wave my wand to do the same. We see remains of divination magic, and high-level conjuration magic… that's traces of a Plane Shift spell!

"Fearghas, where did you park Plex?" Aerelia.

Plex was parked next to the remains of the campfire; staring into the ashes, he spots bones… weird bones he's never seen before, they're a little transparent with an iridescent shimmer. He picks them up with his Mage Hand. The bones used to belong to a magical creature, it still holds faint conjuration magic. Plex licks the bones, it tastes surprisingly fishy, a lot like his Fishy Magic.

Wait… I've eaten this fish before, on my travels with the Drow. At a time when we were travelling through deeper levels and food was scarce, the Matron left saying she would get food from the castle, Plane Shifted away, and returned with a barrel full of these fish. When I asked which waters she got these from, she chuckled and said "there is no water there, they just float".

I describe the fish I remember, and Fearghas conjures up an illusion, both of us working out an accurate image of the creature. None of us knows what this is. Shalkoc tries to eat the illusion. I mention the Drow having a place in the Shadowfell where they would stay, which makes Plex do a big frown. Kyrin gives the camp a last good look and spots an elusive little emblem of two crossed daggers. It's made of a mate metal that doesn't reflect light; I immediately recognise the crest of House Vandree. Assassins who worked for House Vandree wore this in the centre of their chest. Thin leather straps lie next to it, one of them stained with blood. I suggest a scrying spell.

We return to where Aviana was waiting, but on the way, Fearghas and me are spotted by the lookouts on the walls of Ukgluz… the gates open and 12 demon engines charge towards us! Aviana bids goodbye to the lizard mum who she was having a deep conversation with, and jumps down to help us.

Fearghas shouts "Hop on!" and polymorphs into a giant dinosaur bird! (Quetzalcoatlus) We get on Quetzalcoatlhus MacAllistar, Aviana wonders if her wings would look like this if she didn't have any feathers, what a sad thought. Emilio is happily sitting on the dinosaur, aura farming. We get away, land, and Fearghas drops Polymorph to cast… Plane Shift?! Where are we going?

We appear in a tower in a demiplane. Fearghas says it belonged to another wizard, who seems to have passed on and, in scientific terms, "he called dibs". We climb the stairs to a room which floor tiles are carved with letters and numbers, and the edges of the room are littered with bones. Fearghas warns us to not go into that room alone. We climb up to the library, a room that makes Fearghas very happy. He starts researching the fish. Another room in the library holds an empty altar and glowing runes that look similar to the ones on the Void Explorer's Spellbook that Fearghas pulled out in the Sibriex lair, which caused Emilio to lose control… Fearghas says the room is no longer trapped, and Kyrin walks in there unharmed. Fearghas, Plex, and me research the golden fish. Plex has to cast Comprehend Languages to read any of the books because he does not know how to read.

Aviana and Emilio were left behind on the floor we arrived in. Emilio is anxious, doesn't feel safe. Aviana encourages him to follow the rest of us, but she is too big to fit through the staircase, so he goes alone. Into the room with the letters. The one we should never be alone in. He climbs up the stairs, and ends up… at the bottom of the stairs, unable to leave the room. Fearghas gets a Skype notification in his head that someone intruded into the tower. He goes to get Emilio, getting him unstuck. Emilio joins us in the library… and immediately sees the purplish runes on the floor of the other room. His gauntlets react even at this distance. He asks Fearghas why he has void runes in the tower, he replies they came with the tower when he took over.

Emilio is not feeling good because of the runes, I offer help but he brushes me off roughly. Fearghas hands me the "Note to Future Self" they previously found in the tower. I read it with great fascination, and eventually Fearghas finds information on the fish! It's a space guppy, native to the Astral Plane. Led by Fearghas, we climb up to the Greenhouse. I am fascinated by everything, and lag behind a bit. When I join the rest of the party on the floor above, it's very overgrown and there is a giant dead plant. Fearghas mentions having to fight it.

Another floor up is a room-wide device that can enhance magic items. It's crazy messy in there, so I tease Fearghas about it. Above is the Observatory, a room where the floor looks like a star chart and most of the space is taken up by a massive telescope. Fearghas instructs me on how to use it, and I hop on the chair and look for Ildilas. It doesn't look so different from when I left it… except it waves like a mirage, only Ildilas, like something is distorting the image. The desert in the centre of the island… maybe has expanded? It's hard to tell, the image is so distorted, and I've only seen maps a few times. The coastline is the same, but the sea just off the island seems shallower, lighter in colour, like the sea floor is raised, in a pattern reminiscent of tree roots jutting from a stump. It faintly reminds me of something I read once, or heard from an elderly relative. Ley lines? I can't recall…

We try to search the Astral Plane for a castle but it's a needle in a haystack situation. That being said… we do have time. Fearghas summons an Unseen Servant to clean up the tower so he doesn't have to do it himself. Wizards… I ask Fearghas if we are safe in the tower, if the Matron can come get me here. He's pretty sure she could not, or at least it would be as tough as it's going to get for her!

We suggest spending some time in the tower to research:

  • Matron Vandree, on the off chance we find anything

  • The Astral Plane and a castle with space guppies

  • Dragon aspects, their eyes, effects on mortal races, dragon sickness

  • Ley lines

  • Duergar religion and scepters

I also said I wanted to examine everyone, with their permission, because we sustained severe wounds in the recent fights, and I want to make sure we're all okay before we get into another battle.

pages.name: 78 - Further threats and goblin traps
pages.content:
Wednesday 29th of Nonus, 1497

01:23

Ley lines are rivers of mana left over by the mixing of positive and negative energy. The high elves of Aethel'eren (an island far east of Quadira) use ley lines in their magic.

A temple to Nethys, goddess of magic, buried under the Redwind Sands, could contain information about lichdom.

Shadows are reflections of strong emotions or events in the Material Plane that leave echoes in the Shadowfell. This can also happen the other way around, though it is a lot rarer.

Fearghas reads us the Duergar Creation Myth, as told by the Dwarves. In the tower, we find another version, as told by the Duergar. It is quite different… The Duergar claim they disobeyed their god Torag out of curiosity and yearning for understanding, and were burnt by Azgal, the Ebon Fire. The Duergar look down on the other Dwarves for their blind obedience to Torag. In Ukgluz, there was a temple to Azgal, and the stolen scepter was the Scepter of Azgal.

Fearghas, Plex, Kyrin, and myself have been doing research in the library. Aviana has been playing chess with Emilio and bugging Fearghas for a gravity-enhanced gym room. Aviana won every chess game by virtue of neither her, nor Emilio knowing the rules. They gambled, and somehow Emilio won 800 gold?! I learn that last time Plex' curse tried to teleport him away from the tower, he got stuck in a teleportation loop between the curse pulling him away, and the tower pulling him back, for hours. Which made him very nauseous.

After reading Draconic Aspects and their Kin, we theorise that the eye of Dahak held by the king of Lessia contains half the dragon's soul. We suspect it's the left eye, that of evil. How frightening… where would the right eye have gone? Does Vrazzak the Lich have it? We attempt to figure out whether Plex is left-handed or right-handed to judge if he is evil. Aviana chucks a ball at him to see which hand he catches it with. He catches it with telekinesis. All our plans are in tatters.

We wonder if Dahak's right eye might cure the king of Lessia.

Vrazzak supposedly is friends with Dam'ghur (the undead mage whom we beat up after Shalkoc picked up his little finger that he is now waving around as a wand). Their friendship consists of trying to kill each other. If we want to find out more (read: when we have time to find out more), we could start in the Redwind Sands!

Kyrin's shadow wiggles of its own volition. She does not know why. We talk about how both the Shadowfell and the Feywild are very susceptible to emotion and intent. Plex says the Shadowfell is… taking over the Feywild? That's terrifying! Shalkoc says we should go to Hell to meet Zariel, as she wants to meet "the angel slayer" (that's me). Emilio suggests he can claim to be the angel slayer, to protect me. Shalkoc says I can just pretend I am a regular angel slayer. What in the world. Kyrin gives me a cookie.

We shuffle to bed at 2am.

Plex is dragged to bed while still restrained on his floating disc.

WE SLIP ON THE STAIRS BECAUSE PLEX TRAPPED THEM WITH SOAP.

Ouchie.

Fearghas wants to kill Plex. He cleans up the stairs with Prestidigitation. I help Plex back to his disc, as he was knocked off by most of us tumbling down the stairs. We end up in the kitchen for a 2am snack before going to bed. Totally did not go to the wrong floor of the tower, we would never. I call dibs on the tiny room with the plants. Fearghas finds a hidden door behind the wall of one of the toilets. the diarrhea room Shalkoc tests every bed to find the most comfortable one. Fearghas finds a Dispelling Stone, and deposits Plex into a hammock. Fearghas wanders to a room adjacent to the plant room I picked, and he drops into a spike pit?! I rush to help him, and he only mutters "ow". I throw him a rope and he climbs out, muttering.

The room seems full of stolen stuff, and it contains a wand that makes Fearghas feel so tired… it's a Wand of Catnap! Actually quite a powerful item. Plex rolls around his hammock with great satisfaction, until he falls out. Fearghas pauses his bedtime reading to say "I'm not getting him". Plex tries to get back to the hammock. We have pleasant quiet for the rest of the night.

Wednesday 29th of Nonus, 1497

10:22

Short rest

On our way to get breakfast, we descend to the ouija room letter room. Plex is there, and he made a lineart of his face with the bones littering the room. What. We need to:

  • figure out where the Drow are

  • deal with Shalkoc's and Fearghas' contracts

  • figure out what is happening with the Shadowfell

  • track down the Lich

I ask whether we want this done before or after lunch. We agree that dealing with Matron Vandree is the most urgent, as she will come for Kyrin and me as soon as she can. Plex can move freely again, and Aviana wants her chain back. Plex has the zoomies; he is stress-testing the pathfinding algorhythm, running laps around the tower. That's a lot of magic words! Fearghas shuffles back to the library for more research on the Astral Sea and the castle mentioned by Lady Vandree. No luck, so we discuss how to find the Matron. Kyrin pulls out the House Vandree crest she found at the campsite; it has blood on it, so it would be useful in divination magic to locate its owner.

The crest is a cloak pin in the shape of crossed daggers. It is not magical. We have no idea how to make use of it.

We consider going to Heaven, and waiting and seeing whether Matron Vandree comes to get me. Plex suggests going to the Feywild, to Mennon. I ask who Mennon is; Plex casually responds Mennon is an archfey. I squeak at this. Aerelia gets carrot up his nose again. Must be a surge, a major one.

I get a Sending from Matron Vandree and repeat it to the party:

Little traitor, remember your friend Madr? He had some words for you. "Did we not take care of you? Protect you? You had to run to your kin of cowering surface-dwellers!" I might have misheard some parts, his words were difficult to make out between his screams. I'll let you know if he has more to say.

I panic and tell the party that the Matron is torturing my friend, and I will surrender myself to her so I can help Madr. They suggest I send a message to Madr first to try and ascertain the Drows' whereabouts, and if this fails, I will surrender myself. I use one of my scrolls of Sending and message Madr:

Madr, this is Naami. Where are you? Are you okay? I will come free you, whether you want it or not.

He responds:

Naami? Are you ok? The Lady told of your treachery so I'm surprised you're still alive! Stay out of this! Don't come for me!

Fearghas and me discuss whether Matron Vandree could have intercepted my Sending and tampered with it somehow. He doesn't know of any way, and enquires about the nature of Lady Vandree's magic. Shalkoc suggests I message Lady Vandree and claim I've captured a dragon. Somehow the discussion ends up in whether to tie up Shalkoc, which makes Fearghas very frustrated. We discuss where to go and draw the Matron to (or more likely, her minions), and settle on someplace near Lessia.

Shalkoc whips up some food for us; spicy poultry for Fearghas, spicy chocolate biscuits for me (delicious!), a stack full of meat burger for Kyrin (Fearghas asks where he got the meat from), a herby donut for Emilio (he is very happy), then after Aviana grumbles about Emilio getting a donut, Shalkoc whips up another donut for her. It's covered in dark sauce… it's chocolate sauce, right? Lastly, Shalkoc grills up a fish for himself. Then he realises he forgot to make a snack for Plex, and cooks a green salad with some weird stuff on it. Supposedly it tastes like meat, but it isn't meat? How does he do that…

Fearghas teleports us to Promise around noon. For Emilio and Kyrin, it's the first time they see the floating island! Fearghas gives them a warm welcome to the island. Kyrin asks how it stays up, and Fearghas explains that the wind crystals are degrading and need research and repairs. Aviana says they are enslaving air elementals. What??

I use another scroll of Sending to contact Matron Vandree:

Matron, please do not hurt Madr. I will surrender myself. I am on the floating island above Lessia.

(By the way I get a surge and I am unable to read for a week. Very tempted to burn a spell slot to remove that.)

She responds immediately:

Oh such innocence. During all of your time with us, you still haven't understood, have you? I don't care about where you are and I don't need to. To punish you for your disgression, all I need to know is where those you care about are.

Kyrin and Fearghas guess that Matron Vandree is making me suffer for fun, and eventually she will come to see it with her own eyes. Therefore our best bet is to wait for her cruelty to get the better of her. Oh, joy.

Plex placed traps around the doors in the cabin while nobody was looking. Oh, further joy.

Shalkoc's cat-sized dragon Ivernia perches on his shoulder, and Aviana's frost wolf Kaar is hanging around the chicken coop. Aviana asks for food for the dog. That wolf is very hungry, and so is the dragon, and we will need to resupply food soon. Kyrin feeds the dragon some dried meat; somehow she doesn't like it, and spit on Kyrin's face. She's devoured similar food before…

Kyrin feeds Kaar, and he gives her a thorough lick, drenching her in drool. How friendly!

We go upstairs so Kyrin and Emilio can pick a room. Plex doesn't remember which doors he has trapped, so he uses a magical key to make more doors. Shalkoc triggers one of the goblin's traps, and he jumps out of the way. Plex says to tell him before opening doors. Fearghas does not tell Plex, opens the door to his room, and triggers a trap. A stone hurtles towards him, whacking him in the head. The stone shouts "Ow!" and a light powder explodes in the air, making Fearghas sneeze violently. He also explodes at Plex, telling him to remember where he puts his traps!

Emilio gives up on this whole bullshit and snuggles up in a bed.

"Are you gonna use Plex as a hammer?" - Aerelia

Fearghas uses a spellgem of Sending to ask Kali to come to the cabin.

I ask if I can examine everyone and check for lingering injuries, to make sure we are all in fighting shape. I knock on Emilio's door and he is… not… here? He's woven a cocoon of purple light around him and is just floating in there, eyes glowing. Since when can he do that? I guess I'll ask again later…

Plex plants magic mushrooms from the Feywild, what could go wrong? I check everyone for injuries but they are all doing fine, it's a relief. Aviana is thankful for my care and I get inspiration!

Kali arrives and Fearghas casts Comprehend Languages so he can understand her Druidic language. She looks at us with all her 6 red eyes, Kyrin is taken aback. Fearghas asks Kali to go to Lessia and rescue his parents. She is a little doubtful on how to carry out the task. Fearghas asks Kali how much she was paid to kill Aviana. To… KILL… Aviana? So Kali is an assassin, and also a bachelorette apparently.

Kyrin shapeshifts into her child form, which intrigues Kali (don't blame her). Kali says she was paid 8000 gold to assassinate Aviana, and she only took the contract as a side job. Aviana is offended by the low price on her head, and argues she should be worth at least 10 000 gold. Fearghas grumbles, and offers Kali 5000 gold to rescue his parents. She asks for double. Fearghas barters and rolls a natural 20! Kali says she just wanted to test him, and agrees to the 5000 gold.

Kali says we can contact her by speaking to any of the spiders here. Spiders understand common? the Drow says they don't understand in the way we can have a conversation, but they will go to her if anything is up. I ask Kali if she would plant the Springseeds for me, and care for them. I show her one of the seeds, she is very intrigued. She says the seeds must have come from a beautiful place. My mind flashes back to the celestial warped into a fiend, and the fight for our lives in the Sibriex lair; I get choked up, unable to get a word out. Kali assumes the place I got the seeds was so beautiful I am at a loss for words. I let her believe that.

Kali enquires about Kyrin's shapeshifting ability. Kyrin explains it's part of who she is, not something learnt. Kali seems sad about this, and says a lot of people would pay good money to hire her. Kyrin says yes, she was working for the Drow, it did not go well. Kali is very confused at the talk of the egg and the Sibriex lair. I kindly ask that we don't speak of this further. Sarenrae knows, I have plenty of nightmares as it is.

Kyrin starts chatting with Kali telepathically using Psychic Whispers. Kali also says she can teach us certain spells, given time. She can teach me to speak with the spiders! I definitely want to spend some time with her, not only for the spells, I want to plant my trees! Kali casually mentions that the two easternmost doors are trapped, so Kyrin decides to sleep on the couch, it's safer than trying to open doors.

Kali invites Kyrin and me to join her on the other side of the island, where it is much quieter (glares at Plex). Aviana wants Kali to teach her many knots, so she can tie up Plex.
